3.  CHERRY CRUNCH (CHERRY PIE FILLING):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 21 lb (2¼ gal 3 No. 10 cn)  prepared cherry pie filling.  Spread about 10 lb 8 oz (4½ qt)  filling in each greased pan.  Follow Steps 5 through 8.  If microwave-convection oven is used, use 4 half sheet pans (13 by 18 inches).  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, pour 5 lb 4 oz (2¼ qt)  filling into each pan.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, sprinkle about 1 lb 11 oz (5-1/2 cups) mixture over each pan.  In Step 7, bake at 375° for 20 minutes with 50% microwave power first 2 minutes or until lightly browned.  Step 8, cut 5 by 5.
4.  CHERRY CRUNCH (CANNED RED TART (SOUR) CHERRIES):  In Step 1, use 9 oz (2 cups) pregelatinized starch.  In Step 2, drain 19 lb 5 oz (2¼ gal 3 No. 10 cn)  red tart (sour), pitted cherries.  Use juice for water;  add 6 oz (3/4 cup)  sugar to juice.  In Step 3, fold in cherries.  In Step 4, spread about 11 lb 14 oz (1¼ gal)  filling in each greased pan. Follow Steps 5 through 8.
5.  PEACH CRUNCH (PEACH PIE FILLING):  Omit Step 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 21 lb (2¼ gal 3 No. 10 cn)  prepared peach pie filling or 1 recipe Peach Pie Filling (Recipe Nos. I-20, I-23, I-24, or I-25).  In Step 4, spread about 10 lb 8 oz (4½ qt)  filling in each greased pan.  Follow Steps 5 through 8.
6.  PEACH CRUNCH (PEACHES, FROZEN):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, drain 12 lb 14 oz thawed peaches.  Use juice for water;  add 6 oz (3/4 cup)  sugar to juice.  In Step 3, fold in peaches.  Follow Steps 4 through 8.

YIELD:  100 Portions (1 Pan)
EACH PORTION:  1 Banana Split
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Peel and slice bananas lengthwise into quaters;  place on pan.
STEP 2:
Pour juice over bananas;  cover with waxed paper;  refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 3:
Make banana splits to order.  Place ½ cup (1 No. 8 scoop)  ice cream in soup bowl.  Drain 2 banana quaters;  place 1 on each side of ice cream.  Ladle 2 tbsp (1-0 size ladle)  sauce over ice cream.  Top with 1 tbsp whipped topping, 1 tsp chopped nuts and ½ maraschino cherry.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 2,  4 lb (8 oranges)  fresh oranges A.P. will yield 2 cups juice.
2.  In Step 2,  1/2 cup frozen orange juice concentrate combined with water or ½ No. 3 cyl cn canned orange juice or ½ No. 3 cyl cn canned pineapple juice may be used.
3.  If desired, in Step 3, bananas may be peeled and sliced to order.  Omit Step 2.
4.  In Step 3,  Chocolate Sauce (Recipe No. K-5)  or Chocolate Syrup or Topping, Ice Cream, Butterscotch, Fudge, Marshmallow, Pineapple, or Strawberry may be used.
5.  In Step 3, Whipped Topping (Recipe No. K-2)  may be used.
6.  In Step 3, hard or soft serve ice cream or soft serve may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTIONS:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Using warm water reconstitute milk.  Reserve 2 cups for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Heat remaining milk in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot to a boil.  Add butter or margarine.
STEP 3:
Combine reserved milk with tapioca, sugar, salt, and eggs.
STEP 4:
Add tapioca mixture to hot milk in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Bring to just a boil;  reduce heat;  cook without boiling;  stirring occasionally until lightly thickened, about 5 minutes (mixture will be thin).  Turn off heat;  cool in kettle 15 to 20 minutes.
STEP 5:
Add vanilla;  blend well.  Pour 1 gal in each pan.  Cover surface of pudding with waxed paper.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.  (Mixture will thicken as it cools).

NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 7-1/2 oz (scant 2 cups)  dehydrated egg mix combined with 2-1/4 cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.  See Recipe No. A-8.
2.  Garnish with Whipped Topping (Recipe No. K-2)  and 1/2 maraschino cherry (1 lb 2 oz, 1-1/8, 16 oz jr).
3.  One No. 8 scoop may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½ inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Using cold water reconstitute milk.  Chill to 50 F.  Place in mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Add dessert powder.  Using whip, blend at low speed 15 seconds or until well blended.  Scrape down sides of bowl;  whip at medium speed 2 minutes or until smooth.
STEP 3:
Pour about 4-1/2 qt pudding into each pan.  Cover surface of pudding with waxed paper.
STEP 4:
Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1.  One No. 8 scoop may be used.  See Recipe No. S-4.
2.  Pudding may be garnished with well-drained fruit or whipped topping.

VARIATIONS:
1.  BANANA CREAM PUDDING:  In Step 1, use 1 lb 14 oz (1-3/4 qt)  nonfat dry milk and 8-3/4 cold water.  In Step 2,  use 5 lb 8 oz (1 No. 10 cn)  instant dessert powder, vanilla.  In Step 3, pour 3-2/3 qt pudding into each pan.  Use 6 lb 8 oz (4-1/2 qt)  1/4 inch sliced, peeled bananas (10 lb A.P. 25 bananas).  To prevent discoloration, slice bananas just before adding to pudding.  Fold 2 lb 3 oz (1-1/2 qt)  bananas into each pan.  Follow Step 4.
2.  COCONUT CREAM PUDDING:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, fold 1 lb 12 oz (2-1/4 qt) prepared, sweetened, flaked coconut into pudding.  Follow Step 4.
3.  PINEAPPLE CREAM PUDDING:  In Step 1, follow Variation Banana Cream Pudding.  In Step 3, omit bananas.  Use 6 lb 13 oz (1 No. 10 cn)  canned, crushed pineapple, drained.  Fold drained pineapple into pudding.  Pour 1 gal pudding into each pan.  Follow Step 4.
4.  BUTTERSCOTCH CREAM PUDDING:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 6 lb 14 oz (1-1/4 No 10 cn)  instant dessert powder, butterscotch.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
5.  CHOCOLATE CREAM PUDDING:  In Step 1, reduce water to 10-2/3 qt.  In Step 2, use 6 lb 10 oz (1-1/3 No. 10 cn)  instant dessert powder, chocolate.  Follow Step 3 and 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4½ oz)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine rice, cold water, and salt.  Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.  Reduce heat;  cover tightly;  simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until water is absorbed.  Refrigerate for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Using warm water reconstitute milk;  add eggs, margarine or butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg;  blend thoroughly.  Refrigerate for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Place about 2 lb 12 oz (1-3/4 qt)  cooked, cooled rice and 7-3/4 oz (1½ cups)  raisins in each lightly greased pan.  Blend thoroughly.
STEP 4:
Pour 4 lb 6 oz (2 qt)  egg mixture over rice-raisin mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 65 to 75 minutes or until lightly browned and a knife inserted in center comes out clean.
STEP 6:
Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 7:
Cut 4 by 6.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 12 oz (3 cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with 1 lb 13 oz (3-2/3 cups) warm water may be used for whole eggs.  See Recipe No. A-8.
2.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 325 for 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned on low fan, open vent.

VARIATION:
BAKED RICE PUDDING (FROZEN EGGS AND EGG WHITES):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 1 lb 4 oz (2¼ cups)  frozen whole table eggs and 1 lb 4 oz (2¼ cups)  frozen egg whites.  Thaw eggs.  Mix well.  Follow Steps 3 through 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place about 4½ qt day old bread (cut into ½-inch cubes)  in each greased pan.  Pour margarine or butter over bread cubes;  toss lightly.  Toast in oven until light brown.
STEP 2:
Add sugar, salt, nutmeg, and vanilla to thawed eggs;  blend thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Using warm water reconstitute milk;  combine with egg mixture.  Pour 1 gal over bread in each pan.
STEP 4:
Add 3 cups raisins to each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 15 minutes;  stir to distribute raisins.  Bake 45 minutes or until firm.
STEP 6:
Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 7:
Cut 4 by 6.

VARIATIONS:
1.  CHOCOLATE CHIP BREAD PUDDING:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, omit raisins;  use 2 lb 4 oz (3-12 oz pk)  chocolate, cooking, semisweet chips or chocolate flavored baking chips;  add 12 oz (1 pk)  chips to each pan.  Omit Step 5.  Bake 1 hour or until firm.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.
2.  COCONUT BREAD PUDDING:  In Step 1, use 1 lb 12 oz (2¼ qt)  prepared, sweetened, flaked coconut;  toss 8 oz (3 cups)  coconut with toasted bread cubes in each pan.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, omit raisins.  Omit Step 5.  Bake 1 hour or until firm.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cream Puff
PAN SIZE: 18x26 inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400 F Oven; 350 F Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine butter or margarine and boiling water;  bring to a boil.
STEP 2:
Add flour and salt all at once, stirring rapidly.  Cook about 2 minutes or until mixture leaves sides of pan and forms ball.
STEP 3:
Remove from heat;  place in mixer bowl.  Cool slightly.
STEP 4:
Add eggs, while beating at high speed, using a flat paddle.  See Note 1.  Beat until mixture is thick and shiny.
STEP 5:
Drop 2-1/2 tbsp batter (1 No. 30 scoop) 2 inches apart on lightly greased pans.
STEP 6:
Bake 10 minutes at 400 F;  reduce oven temperature to 350 F;  bake 30 minutes longer or until firm.  Turn oven off.
STEP 7:
Open oven door slightly;  leave puffs in oven 8 to 10 minutes to dry out after baking.  Shells should be slightly most inside.
STEP 8:
Using pastry tube, fill shells.  See Note 2.
STEP 9:
Refrigerate filled shells until served.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 4, crack eggs into 8 small bowls (4-5 eggs per bowl);  add one bowl of eggs at a time to mixture in mixer bowl.  Beat after each addition.  Repeat until all eggs are added.
2.  Fill shells with 2/3 recipe Vanilla Cream Pudding (Recipe No. J-21),  1 recipe Whipped Topping (Recipe No. K-2),  Ice Cream (Recipe No. J-12),  or commercial prepared hard ice cream may be used.  Fill shells with 1/3 cup (1 No. 12 scoop)  filling.  Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar or cover with Chocolate Glaze Frosting (Recipe No. G-24).
3.  Shells may be filled with Chicken Ala King, Chicken Salad, Tuna Salad, Ham Salad, and Shrimp Salad.

VARIATION:
ECLAIRS:  Follow Step 1 through 4.  In Step 5, use pastry bag or drop 2-1/2 tbsp batter in rows 2 inch by 6 inches apart;  spread each mound into a 1 by 4-1/2 inch rectangle, rounding sides or piling batter on top.  Follow Steps 6 through 9.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION: 1/2 Cup (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Using warm water reconstitute milk.  Add sugar and salt.  Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 2:
Combine cornstarch, sugar, and water;  stir until smooth.  Add gradually to hot mixture.  Cook at medium heat, stirring constantly, about 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 3:
Stir about 1 qt hot mixture into eggs.  Slowly pour egg mixture into remaining hot milk mixture;  heat to boiling, stirring constantly.  Cook about 2 minutes longer.  Remove from heat.
STEP 4:
Add butter or margarine and vanilla;  stir until well blended.
STEP 5:
Pour 1 gal pudding into each pan.  Cover surface of pudding with waxed paper.
STEP 6:
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1.  Pudding will curdle if boiled or subjected to prolonged intense heat.
2.  One No. 8 scoop may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

VARIATION:
CHOCOLATE CREAM PUDDING:  In Step 1, increase sugar to 3 lb 12 oz (2¼ qt).  In Step 2, combine 1 lb (1 qt) cocoa with cornstarch, sugar, and water.  Omit Step 3.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.

YIELD: 100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE: 12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook rice in 3¼ qt boiling salted water 20 to 25 minutes or until tender.  Cover;  set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Combine sugar, cornstarch, milk, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg;  mix until well blended.
STEP 3:
Add 3½ qt warm water to dry mixture;  stir until smooth.
STEP 4:
Add eggs;  blend well.
STEP 5:
Slowly add 3 qt boiling water to egg mixture, stirring with wire whip.  Cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 6:
Turn off heat;  add cooked rice, butter or margarine, vanilla, and, if desired, raisins.
STEP 7:
Pour 1 gal pudding into each pan.
STEP 8:
Sprinkle cinnamon or nutmeg over pudding in each pan.
STEP 9:
Cover surface of pudding with waxed paper.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1.  Pudding may be served hot.  Omit Step 9.
2.  In Step 4, 10 oz (½ No. 3 cyl cn)  canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 3 cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.  See Recipe No. A-8.
3.  One No. 8 scoop may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (12½ Quarts)
EACH PORTION1/2 Cup (No. 8 Scoop)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine cold water, rice, salt, and salad oil;  bring to a boil.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 2:
Cover tightly;  simmer 20 to 25 minutes.  DO NOT STIR.
STEP 3:
Remove from heat, refrigerate for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Drain pineapple;  reserve juice for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Combine rice, pineapple, and drained cherries.  Refrigerate for use in Step 7.
STEP 6:
Pour 7½ cup reserved juice and water into mixer bowl;  add topping, milk, and vanilla.  Using whip at low speed, whip 3 minutes or until thoroughly blended.  Scrape down bowl.  Whip at high speed 5 to 10 minutes or until stiff peaks form.
STEP 7:
Combine rice mixture and marshmallows and coconut.  Mix thoroughly.  Fold in whipped topping.  Mix lightly.
STEP 8:
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

YIELD: 100 Portions (1 Gallon)
EACH PORTION: 2 to 3 Tablespoons

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pour cream into chilled mixer bowl.  Using whip, whip 3 to 7 minutes at medium speed or until slightly thickened.
STEP 2:
Gradually add sugar and vanilla.  Whip 7 to 8 minutes or until stiff.  DO NOT OVERWHIP.
STEP 3:
Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1.  Keep cream chilled before and during serving period.
2.  Whip cream in small batches of not more than 1 gal cream (measured before whipping) at one time.
3.  In Step 1, DO NOT use a mixer bowl larger than 20 qt.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Dream Whip Whipped Topping Mix-Dry  KFT
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  3 Tablespoons (1/2 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place cold water in mixer bowl;  add topping, milk, and vanilla.  Using whip at low speed, whip 3 minutes or until well blended.  Scrape down bowl.
STEP 2:
Whip at high speed 5 to 10 minutes or until stiff peaks form.  Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:
When topping is used for icing cakes, fold 8 oz (2 cups) sifted powdered sugar into whipped topping.

VARIATION:
WHIPPED TOPPING (TOPPING, DESSERT, AND BAKERY PRODUCTS, FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 3 lb 6 oz (1-1/2 qt, 1/2, 6-1/2 to 7 lb cn)  topping, dessert, and bakery products, frozen.  Thaw topping in chilled mixer bowl.  Using whip at medium speed, whip topping 10 to 20 minutes or until stiff peaks form.  Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.  EACH PORTION:  About 3 tbsp (1/2 oz)

YIELD:  100 Portions (3¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Melt butter or margarine;  add brown sugar;  cook at low heat 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute milk;  add to sugar mixture.  Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil.
STEP 3:
Remove immediately from heat;  cool 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add 1/4 up rum flavoring;  stir until well blended.

NOTE:
1.  Sauce may be served over puddings, plain cake, fruit cake, and ice cream.
2.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (1 Gallon)
EACH PORTION:  2½ Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine pie filling with water in mixer bowl.  Mix well.

NOTE:
1.  Sauce may be served over ice cream, pudding or plain cake.
2.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Using 1.5 qt warm water reconstitute milk.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Mix sugar and cocoa with 2 cups cold water to form a paste.  Bring to a boil, stirring constantly;  cool slightly.
STEP 3:
Add milk stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil;  cook 3 minutes.  Remove from heat immediately.
STEP 4:
Add butter or margarine and vanilla;  stir.  Serve warm or at room temperature.

NOTE:
1.  Sauce may be served over ice cream, puddings or cooled plain uniced cake squares.
2.  In Step 2, 1 lb chocolate, cooking, unsweetened may be used for cocoa.  In Step 4, reduce butter or margarine to 2 oz (¼ cup).  Add chocolate with butter or margarine.
3.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

VARIATIONS:
1.  CHOCOLATE COCONUT SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Just before serving, add 1 lb (5½ cups)  prepared, sweetened, flaked coconut to sauce;  mix well.
2.  CHOCOLATE MARSHMALLOW SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Just before serving, add 1 lb (2¼ qt) miniature marshmallows to sauce;  mix well.
3.  CHOCOLATE NUT SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Just before serving, add 1 lb (1 qt) chopped unsalted nuts to sauce; mix well.
4.  CHOCOLATE MINT SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 1 tbsp peppermint flavoring for vanilla.

YIELD:  6¼ Quarts
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain cherries;  set aside for use in Step 5;  add enough water to cherry juice to make 1 gal.
STEP 2:
Combine cornstarch, salt, and sugar.  Add liquid (1 gallon);  mix well.
STEP 3:
Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil.
STEP 4:
Reduce heat;  continue cooking slowly, stirring occasionally until sauce is thick and clear.
STEP 5:
Remove from heat;  add 3 tsp brandy flavoring and cherries.
STEP 6:
Serve warm or cold.

NOTE:
1.  Sauce may be served warm over vanilla ice cream or cold over vanilla pudding or white or yellow cake squares.
2.  One Size 1 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3-3/4 Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2½ Tbsp (1½ Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain strawberries.  Set juice aside for use in Step 2;  berries for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Combine cornstarch, sugar, and 2.25 qt strawberry juice.  Bring to a boil.  Cook at medium heat,  stirring constantly until thick and clear.  Remove from heat.
STEP 3:
Fold 6.5 cups strawberries into thickened mixture.
STEP 4:
Chill topping.

NOTE:
May be used as topping for cheese cake, cream pie, vanilla pudding, or plain

YIELD:  100 Portions (1½ Gallons)
EACH PORTION: ¼ Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Slowly blend cold water into cornstarch mixture.  Bring to a boil;  cook 5 minutes or until thick and clear;  remove from heat.
STEP 3:
Add margarine or butter and vanilla;  mix well.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 5 oz (1-1/8 cups)  pregelatinized starch may be used for cornstarch.  Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl; mix at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.  In Step 2, add boiling water gradually to dry mixture while beating at low speed.  Scrape down bowl.  Continue mixing until smooth.  Follow Step 3.
2.  Sauce may be served over puddings, fruit, and plain cake.
3.  One Size 1 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD: 100 Portions (1½ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Slowly blend cold water into cornstarch mixture.  Bring to a boil.  Cook 2 minutes or until thick and clear;  remove form heat.  
STEP 3:
Add margarine or butter, lemon juice, and lemon peel;  mix well.  

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 9 oz (2 cups) pregelatinized starch may be used for cornstarch.  Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl, mix at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.  In Step 2, add boiling water gradually to dry mixture while beating at low speed.  Scrape down bowl.  Continue mixing until smooth.  Follow Step 3.
2.  In Step 3, 3 lb lemons A.P. (12 lemons)  will yield 2 cups juice and 1/4 cup peel.
3.  Sauce may be served over puddings, gingerbread, and plain cakes.
4.  One Size 1 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4-3/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Stir 10 lb vanilla, dehydrated yogurt mix into 2½ gal water (40° F to 60°F).  Mix thoroughly with wire whip or mixer.  Cover container.
STEP 2:
Chill 4 to 24 hours in refrigerator to 35°F to 40°F.
STEP 3:
Stir until smooth.  Pour mixture into top hopper of soft serve ice cream freezer;  start dasher motor;  turn on refrigeration according to manufacturer's directions.  Freeze to temperature of 18°F to 22°F (about 10 minutes)  or until product can be drawn with stiff consistency that will hold a peak.

VARIATIONS:
1.  CHOCOLATE SOFT SERVE YOGURT (DEHYDRATED CHOCOLATE):  In Step 1, use 10 lb (2-5 lb cn)  dehydrated chocolate yogurt mix.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  FRUIT FLAVORED YOGURT (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 10 lb (2-5 lb cn)  dehydrated strawberry, peach, red raspberry or black cherry yogurt mix.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4-3/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pour 3½ gal liquid vanilla or fruit flavored yogurt mix (chilled 35°F to 40°F)  into top of hopper of soft serve ice cream freezer; start dasher motor; turn on refrigeration according to manufacturer's directions.
STEP 2:
Freeze to a temperature of 18°F to 22°F (approximately 10 minutes) or until product can be drawn with a stiff consistency that will hold peak.

YIELD: 100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (6 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain fruit; reserve juice for use in Step 3; fruit for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Dissolve gelatin in 1.5 gal boiling water.
STEP 3:
Add 1.5 gal reserved juice + cold water; stir mix well (water substituted for reserve juice).
STEP 4:
Pour about 1 gal into each pan.  Chill until slightly thickened.
STEP 5:
Fold an equal quantity of fruit into gelatin in each pan.  Chill until firm.

NOTE:
In Step 1, the following canned fruits may be used:
    Fruit cocktail, canned, 13 lb 8 oz (2-No. 10 cn)
    Fruit chunks, mixed, 13 lb 11 oz (2-No. 10 cn)
    Peaches, quarters or slices, canned, 13 lb 14 oz (2-No.           10 cn)
    Pears, quatered or slices, canned, 13 lb 4 oz (2-No. 10 cn)
    Pineapple, chunks or tidbits, canned, 13 lb 8 oz (2-No. 10       cn)

VARIATIONS:
1.  BANANA GELATIN:  Omit Step 1.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 1½ gal cold water.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, use 15 lb bananas A.P. (37 bananas).  Add about 3 lb 4 oz (2¼ qt) thinly sliced bananas to gelatin in each pan.
2.  FRUIT FLAVORED GELATIN:  Omit fruit in Step 1.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  Follow Step 4, except chill until firm.  Omit Step 5.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 oz).
3.  FRUIT GELATIN (CRUSHED ICE METHOD):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, dissolve gelatin in 4½ qt boiling juice and water. Omit Step 3.  Add 12 lb 8 oz (3-1/8 gal)  crushed ice, stirring constantly until ice is melted and gelatin begins to thicken.  Add fruit;  stir until well blended;  pour into pans.  Chill until firm.  (NOTE:  ice should be weighed as volume varies.)
4.  STRAWBERRY GELATIN:  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2, use strawberry flavored gelatin;  increase boiling water to 1-3/4 gal.  Omit Step 3.  Add 15 lb (7½ qt)  partially thawed strawberries and ½ cup lemon juice (12 oz-3 lemons A.P.)  to gelatin.  Stir strawberries until thawed and separated.  In Step 4, pour about 5½ qt gelatin mixture into each pan.  Omit Step 5.  Chill until firm.
5.  PEACH GELATIN:  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2, use orange flavored gelatin;  increase boiling water to 1-3/4 gal.  Omit Step 3.  Add 15 lb (7½ qt)  partially thawed sliced or quatered peaches to gelatin.  Stir peaches until thawed and separated. In Step 4, pour about 5½ qt gelatin mixture into each pan.  Omit Step 5.  Chill until firm.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4-3/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Stir 10 lb of vanilla ice milk-milk shake mix into 2½ gal water that is 40°F to 60°F.  Mix thoroughly with wire whip or mixer.  Cover container.
STEP 2:
Chill 4 to 24 hours in refrigerator to 35°F to 40°F.
STEP 3:
Stir until smooth.  Pout mixture into top hopper of soft serve ice cream freezer;  start dasher motor;  turn on refrigeration according to manufacturer's directions.  Freeze to a temperature of 18°F to 22°F (about 10 minutes)  or until product can be drawn with a stiff consistency that will hold a peak.

VARIATIONS:
1.  CHOCOLATE SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM:  In Step 1, use 10 lb (2-5 lb cn) dehydrated chocolate ice milk-milk shake mix.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  CHOCOLATE MILK SHAKE:  In Step 1, use 10 lb (2-5 lb cn) dehydrated chocolate ice milk-milk shake mix.  Increase water to 3 gal.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, pour sufficient amount of mix into top hopper of milk shake mix machine (according to manufacturer's directions);  freeze to a temperature of 27°F to 30°F.  EACH PORTION:  About 1 cup (8 oz).
3.  STRAWBERRY SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM:  In Step 1, decrease water to 8¼ qt.  Follow Step 2.  Thaw 6 lb 8 oz frozen strawberries;  crush;  add 1 tsp red food coloring (optional).  In Step 3, remove mix feed and air control units.  Mix strawberries with soft serve mixture.  Stir occasionally.
4.  VANILLA MILK SHAKE:  In Step 1, use 3 gal water.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, pour sufficient amount of mix into top hopper of milk shake machine (according to manufacturer's directions);  freeze to a temperature of 27°F to 30°F.  EACH PORTION:  About 1 Cup (8 oz).
_description: Ice Cream, vanilla, soft serve, f/dry

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4-3/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pour 3½ gal of vanilla liquid ice milk mix (chilled 35°F to 40°F)  into top hopper of soft serve ice cream freezer;  start dasher motor;  turn on refrigeration according to manufacturer's directions.
STEP 2:
Freeze to a temperature of 18°F to 22°F (about 10 minutes)  or until product can be drawn with a stiff consistency that will hold a peak.

VARIATIONS:
1.  STRAWBERRY SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM:  Follow Step 1.  Thaw and crush 6 lb 8 oz frozen strawberries;  drain;  add 1 tsp red food coloring (optional).  In Step 2, add strawberry mixture to soft serve mixture.  Note:  While drawing ice cream, strawberries must be stirred up occasionally from bottom of the freezer hopper.
2.  VANILLA MILK SHAKE (MILK SHAKE MIX, LIQUID, FRESH, VANILLA):  In Step 1, use 3 gal fresh liquid vanilla milk shake mix;  add 1 gal cold water.  In Step 2, pour sufficient amount into top hopper (according to maufacturer's directions);  freeze to a temperature of 27°F to 30°F.  EACH PORTION:  About 1 Cup (8 oz).
3.  CHOCOLATE MILK SHAKE (MILK SHAKE MIX, LIQUID, FRESH, CHOCOLATE):  In Step 1, use 4½ gal liquid fresh chocolate milk shake mix.  In Step 2, turn on refrigeration according to manufacturer's directions;  freeze to a temperature of 27°F to 30°F.  EACH PORTION:  About 1 Cup (8 oz).
4.  CHOCOLATE SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM:  In Step 1, use 3½ gal liquid fresh chocolate ice milk-milk shake mix.  Follow Step 2.
_description: Ice Cream, vanilla, soft serve, f/liq

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (4½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-13.
STEP 2:
Cover potatoes with water;  bring to a boil;  add ¼ cup salt;  cover.  Cook until tender.
STEP 3:
Drain potatoes well.  Cool slightly.
STEP 4:
Combine onions, salad oil or olive oil, 1-2/3 tbsp salt, pepper, and vinegar.  Add to potatoes.  Cover;  refrigerate 1 hour.
STEP 5:
Combine celery, chopped eggs, relish, pimientos (optional), and Salad Dressing;  add to potato mixture.
STEP 6:
Mix lightly but thoroughly to coat potatoes with Salad Dressing mixture.
STEP 7:
Garnish with parsley and paprika.
STEP 8:
Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1: 
   22 lb 2 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 18 lb peeled    potatoes.
   1  lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
   4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped celery.
   1 oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 1 oz chopped parsley.
2.  In Step 3, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 5, 1½ 7 oz cn canned pimientos may be used.
4.  One-No. 6 scoop may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

VARIATIONS:
1.  DEVILED POTATO SALAD:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, add 6 oz (3/4 cup)  prepared mustard, 1 oz (2 tbsp) granulated sugar, 12 oz (3 cups) crumbled, crisp bacon (3 lb raw bacon A.P.).  In Step 5, use 4 lb 8 oz (8¼ cups) Salad Dressing.  Follow Steps 7 and 8.
2.  POTATO SALAD WITH VINEGAR DRESSING:  In Step 1, use 22 lb potatoes (27 lb 1 oz A.P.).  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, omit salad oil, salt, pepper, and vinegar.  In Step 5, omit eggs and Salad Dressing.  Prepare 1 recipe vinegar dressing (See Recipe No. M-9-1)  for Salad Dressing.  Follow Steps 6 through 8.

YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pies)
EACH PORTION: 1/8 Pie
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425° F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies)
STEP 2:
Drain blueberries;  reserve juice for use in Step 4 and blueberries for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl.  Mix at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.
STEP 4:
Add 3 qt reserve juice and lemon juice gradually to sugar mixture while beating at low speed.  Scrape down bowl;  beat at low speed until smooth.
STEP 5:
Fold berries carefully unto thickened mixture.
STEP 6:
Pour 2-3/4 to 3 cups filling into each unbaked pie shell.  Cover with top crust.  Seal edges.
STEP 7:
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut 8 wedges per pie.

NOTE:
In Step 4, 4½ oz lemons A.P. (1-1/8 lemons)  will yield 3 tbsp juice.

YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pies)
EACH PORTION:  1/8 Pie
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425 F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies)
Drain pineapple;  reserve juice for use in Step 4;  pineapple for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl.  Mix at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.
STEP 4:
Combine 2 1/4 qt reserved juice and lemon juice;  mix until well blended;  add gradually to sugar mixture while beating at low speed.  Scrape down bowl;  beat at low speed until smooth.
STEP 5:
Fold pineapple carefully into thickened mixture.
STEP 6:
Pour 2-3/4 to 3 cups filling into each unbaked pie shell.  Cover with top crust.  Seal edges.
STEP 7:
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut 8 wedges per pie.

NOTE:
In Step 4, 4-1/2 oz lemons A.P. (1-1/8 lemons)  will yield 3 tbsp juice.

YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pies)              
EACH PORTION:  1/8 Pie
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425 F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies)
STEP 2:
Drain cherries;  reserve juice for use in Step 4;  cherries for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl.  Mix well at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.
STEP 4:
Add reserved juice (1-1/2 qt) gradually to sugar mixture while beating at low speed.  If desired, add 1-1/2 tsp red food coloring.  Scrape down bowl;  beat at low speed until smooth.
STEP 5:
Fold  cherries carefully into thickened mixture,
STEP 6:
Pour 2-3/4 to 3 cups filling into each unbaked pie shell.  Cover with top crust.  Seal edges.
STEP 7:
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut 8 wedges per pie.

YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pies)
EACH PORTION:  1/8 Pie
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425 F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies)
STEP 2:
Thaw peaches according to Guidelines for Handling Frozen Foods, Recipe No. A-19.  Drain; reserve juice for use in Step 4;  peaches for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl.  Mix at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.
STEP 4:
Add water to reserved juice to make 3 qt.  Add gradually to sugar mixture while beating at low speed.  Scrape down bowl;  beat at low speed until smooth.
STEP 5:
Fold peaches carefully into thickened mixture.
STEP 6:
Pour 2-3/4 to 3 cups filling into each unbaked pie shell.  Cover with top crust.  Seal edges.
STEP 7:
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut 8 wedges per pie.

YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pies)
EACH PORTION:  1/8 Pie
PAN SIZE: 9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425 F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies)
STEP 2:
Drain peaches;  reserve juice for use in Step 4;  peaches for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine sugar, starch, and salt in mixer bowl.  Mix at low speed until well blended.  DO NOT WHIP.
STEP 4:
Add 3 qt reserved juice to sugar mixture while beating at low speed.  Scrape down bowl;  beat at low speed until smooth.
STEP 5:
Fold peaches carefully into thickened mixture.
STEP 6:
Pour 2-3/4 to 3 cups filling into each unbaked pie shell.  Cover with top crust.  Seal edges.
Step 7:
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut 8 wedges per pie.

YIELD:  About 4¼ Quarts

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Blend butter or margarine and flour together using wire whip to form roux;  stir until smooth.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute milk (using warm water);  heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 3:
Add milk gradually to roux stirring constantly.
STEP 4:
Add salt.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.

NOTE:
Alternate Method:  Melt butter or magarine at low heat.  Add flour gradually;  stir with wire whip until mixture is smooth.  Add dry milk and salt to roux.  Blend thoroughly.  Add water gradually, stirring constantly.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes.  Stir as necessary.

VARIATION:
CHEESE SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Add 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups)  shredded American or Cheddar Chesse.  Stir until blended.  NOTE:  9 oz (2¼ cups)  dehydrated cheese combined with 1-1/8 cups warm water may be used for cheese.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine vinegar, tomato paste, catsup, water, sugar, salt, mustard, red peppers, finely chopped onion, celery, garlic, chili powder, and, if desired, 3 tbsp liquid smoke.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  cover;  simmer 40 minutes or until sauce is blended.

NOTES:
1.  In Step 1, for milder sauce, use 2 tsp red pepper.
2.  In Step 1, 1-3/4, 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb finely chopped onions;  1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb finely chopped celery.
4.  In Step 1, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  Barbecue Sauce Mix may be used for all ingredients.  Prepare according to instructions on container.
6.  Sauce may be used to baste meat or chicken during cooking.
7.  One size 1 ladle may be used.  See Recipe A-4.

VARIATION:
BARBECUE SAUCE (PREPARED):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 14 lb 2 oz (6-1/4 qt)  prepared barbecue sauce.  Heat to serving temperature.

YIELD:  100 Portions (1¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3 Tablespoons (1½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain cherries;  reserve juice for use in Step 3;  cherries for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Combine corstarch and sugar in mixer bowl;  add water;  stir until smooth.
STEP 3:
Add water to reserved juice to make 1-1/2 qt.  Bring to a boil;  add cornstarch -sugar mixture;  stirring constantly.  Cook 10 minutes or until thick and clear.  Remove from heat.
STEP 4:
Add cherries, butter or margarine, 1 tsp red food coloring, and lemon juice;  mix well.
STEP 5:
Serve hot or cold.

NOTE:
In Step 4, 12 oz lemons A.P. (3 lemons)  will yield 1/2 cup juice.

VARIATION:
CHERRY SAUCE (PREGELATINIZED STARCH):  Follow Step 1.  In Steps 2 and 3, combine 5 oz (1-1/8 cups)  pregelatinized starch and sugar in mixer bowl.  Combine water and juice to make 2 qt.  Bring to a boil.  Add boiling liquids to dry mixture while blending at low speed.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4-3/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute garlic and chopped onions in melted shortening, salad oil, or olive oil until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine sauteed onions and garlic with tomatoes, tomate paste, water, 6 whole bay leaves, oregano, basil, salt, sugar, and thyme;  mix well.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  simmer 1 hour or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Remove bay leaves before serving.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 4-1/4 oz (3/4 cup-36 cloves)  dry garlic may be used.  Mince;  fry with onions.
2.  In Step 1, 6-2/3 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
4.  In Step 2, Five 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
5.  Sauce may be served over cooked spaghetti, vermicelli, or macaroni noodles.

VARIATION:
MARINARA SAUCE WITH CLAMS:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, drain 12 lb 8 oz (4-49 oz or 4-51 oz cn)  canned, minced clams;  add water to clam liquid to make 1 gallon.  Combine with remaining ingredients.  Reserve drained clams for use in Step 3.  Follow Step 3.  Add clams.  Stir Simmer about 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6-1/2 oz).

YIELD:  100 Portions (8½ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1/3 Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute chopped onions, peppers, and celery in melted shortening, salad oil, or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Add tomatoes, salt, pepper, sugar, and Worcestershire sauce to vegtables.  Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  cover;  simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 3:
Blend flour and water to make a smooth paste;  add to sauce. Stir to combine.  Simmer 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1:  1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions;  1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped peppers;  2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, 3-1/3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions and 4 oz (3 cups)  dehydrated green peppers (see Recipe No. A-11)  or 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups)  frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.

VARIATIONS:
1.  SPANISH SAUCE:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add ¼ tsp hot sauce, 1 bay leaf, 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp dehyrated garlic or 1-1/3 tbsp (4 cloves)  minced dry garlic, and 1 lb 13 oz (1-jumbo or 2-8Z cn)  canned sliced drained mushrooms.  Follow Step 3.  Remove bay leaf.
2.  CAJUN CREOLE SAUCE:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, increase pepper to 1-1/3 tbsp;  add 2 tsp ground red pepper, 2-2/3 tbsp crushed oregano, 2-2/3 tbsp crushed sweet basil, 2-2/3 tbsp ground thyme, 1 tbsp dehydrated garlic or 1-1/3 oz (¼ cup-12 cloves)  minced dry garlic and 1 tbsp ground paprika.  Follow Ste

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with boiling water;  stir to dissolve.
STEP 2:
Combine pepper, cornstarch, sugar, and cold water to make smooth paste.  Stir gradually into hot stock.  Cook until smooth and thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 3:
Add mustard, horseradish, vinegar, and butter or margarine;  stir until smooth.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 1/2 oz (2-1/3 tbsp)  dehydrated horseradish (See Recipe No. A-17)  or 1/2 oz (2-1/3 tbsp)  frozen horseradish may be used.
2.  Sauce may be served with ham.
3.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3½ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine tomatoes, chopped onions, peppers, salt, and sugar;  blend well.
STEP 2:
Cover;  refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, a milder sauce may be prepared by removing seeds from jalapeno peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 8-3/4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions.
4.  One Size 0 ladle may be used. 
5.  7 lb 10 oz (16-7 oz bt)  prepared taco sauce may be used.  Omit Steps 1 and 2.

VARIATION:
SALSA:  In Step 1, use coarsely chopped canned tomatoes or 6 lb 6 oz (3¼ qt)  finely chopped fresh tomatoes (6 lb 8 oz A.P.).  Follow Step 2.  Note:  For a hotter sauce, increase jalapeno peppers to 1 lb (1¼ cups).

YIELD:  100 Portions (3½ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine peach jam, vinegar, water, and, if desired, 3 tbsp soy sauce.  Blend well.

NOTE:
1.  Serve with Chinese or Philippine style egg rolls.
2.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine sugar and boiling water;  stir until dissolved.
STEP 2:
Blend cornstarch and cold water to make smooth paste.  Add paste to hot water, stirring constantly;  cook 10 minutes or until thick and clear, stirring constantly.
STEP 3:
Add crushed, undrained pineapple, nutmeg, lemon juice, and lemon rind (lemon peel substituted for rind);  mix; return to a boil.  Reduce heat;  cover;  simmer about 5 minutes.
STEP 4:
Serve hot.

NOTE:
In Step 3, 12 oz lemons A.P. (3 lemons)  will yield 1/2 cup juice.

VARIATION:
RAISIN SAUCE (FOR HAM):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Combine 1 lb 8 oz (3-1/4 cups)  packed brown sugar and 3 qt boiling water.  Stir until sugar is dissolved.  Add 2 lb (1-1/2 qt)  raisins.  Bring to a boil.  Blend 5 oz (1 cup) cornstarch and 1 qt cold water to make a smooth paste.  Add 1 tsp ground cinnamon and 1/2 tsp ground cloves.  Blend well.  Slowly add cornstarch mixture to boiling raisin mixture, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil;  cook 5 minutes or until thick and clear, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add 6 tbsp lemon juice (2-lemons 8 oz A.P.).  Stir well.  Serve hot.  EACH PORTION:  3 Tbsp (1-1/2 oz).

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1/3 Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine water, salad oil, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, catsup, and pepper in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot;  bring to a boil.  Reduce heat;  simmer 5 minutes.
STEP 2:
Combine cool water and corn starch.  Blend until smooth.  Add to mixture slowly while stirring.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat;  simmer 3 minutes.

NOTE:
1.  Sauce is peppery hot.
2.  Sauce may be used as marinade for chicken, pork, and

YIELD:  100 Portions (3-1/3 Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoon

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine catsup, horseradish, and hot sauce;  blend well.
STEP 2:
Cover;  refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1¼ oz (5 tbsp)  dehydrated horseradish (See Recipe No. A-17) or 1 lb (1½ cups)  frozen horseradish may be used.  Thaw horseradish.
2.  In Step 1, add 1 or 2 tsp additional hot sauce for hotter sauce.
3.  Seafood Cocktail Sauce may be served with French Fried shrimp, shrimp cocktail, fried oysters, scallops, fish fillets, portions or nuggets.
4.  In Step 1, 7 lb 8 oz (10-12 oz bt)  prepared Seafood Cocktail Sauce may be used.  Omit Step 2.
5.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (1 Gallon)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute chopped onions in salad oil, shortening melted, or olive oil until tender.
STEP 2:
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, salt, pepper, basil, 3 whole bay leaves, garlic, and oregano.  Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  simmer 1 hour.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 13 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 1½ oz (½ cup) dehydrated onions may be used.  
3.  In Step 2, 3/4-36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 1 tbsp (3 cloves)  dry minced garlic may be used.  Saute onions in Step 1.

VARIATION:
PIZZA SAUCE (CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 6 lb 9 oz (1-No. 10 cn)  canned Pizza Sauce.  Heat to simmer.  If desired, 2 tbsp crushed basil, 2 tbsp crushed oregano, 2 tsp dehydrated garlic, and 2 tsp black pepper may be added to pizza sauce.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine Salad Dressing, relish, parsley, pimientos (drained and finely chopped), finely chopped onions, paprika (ground), and pepper (could be black or white).
STEP 2:
Cover;  refrigerate to chill.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1-7 oz cn canned pimientos may be used.
2.  In Step 1, ½ oz (2-2/3 tbsp) dehyrated onions may be used. 
3.  In Step 1, 4½ oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 oz finely chopped onions.
4.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Gallons)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine soy sauce, salad oil, pineapple juice, and water.
STEP 2:
Add garlic, ginger, brown sugar, lemon juice, vinegar, and finely chopped onions;  stir to mix well.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2 tbsp (6 cloves)  dry minced garlic may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 1 lb lemons A.P. (4 lemons)  will yield 3/4 cup juice.
3.  In Step 2, 13 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz finely chopped onions.
4.  In Step 2, 1½ oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used. 
5.  Sauce may be used for beef, chicken, or pork.  Pour 2 gal sauce over meat;  cover;  refridgerate.  Marinate meat 2 hours before cooking.  Drain well.
6.  2 gal prepared teriyaki sauce may be used.  Omit Steps 1 and 2.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6½ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute finely chopped onions in melted shortening, salad oil, or olive oil in steamjacketed kettle or stock pot 5 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Add flour to sauteed mixture;  stir until well blended.  Cook 5 minutes.
STEP 3:
Combine hot water, tomato paste, sugar, salt, pepper, red pepper, and garlic powder.  Add to flour-onion mixture.
STEP 4:
Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  simmer 15 minutes.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.  
3.  In Step 3, two 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
4.  Sauce may be served over sliced meat loaf, roast beef, roast pork, or veal cutlets.
5.  One Size 1 ladle may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Square (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350 F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute finely choppped celery and onions (finely chopped) in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine breads, pepper, and poultry seasoning.  Toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Pour sauteed vegetables over bread mixture;  toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute (with boiling water)  Soup and Gravy base to make stock. 
STEP 5:
Mix stock and eggs together;  pour over bread and vegetable mixture;  mix lightly but thoroughly.
STEP 6:
Place 1-3/4 gal mixture in each well greased pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 1 hour or until top is lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut each pan 5 by 10.

NOTE :
1.  In Step 1, 4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb finely chopped celery; and 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 cups dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, amount of liquid may vary with dryness of bread.
4.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 300° F. 1 hour or until lightly browned on high fan, open vent.
5.  Corn bread may be prepared the day before.  Prepare 1/2 recipe Corn Bread.

YIELD:  100 Portions (1½ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1 Tablespoon (1/2 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine horseradish,  Salad Dressing, milk, garlic, onion powder, sugar, white pepper, and red pepper in mixer bowl.  Blend on high speed 1 minute.

STEP 2:
Cover; refrigerate to chill.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

NOTE:
Sauce may be used for roast beef, corned beef, or pastrami.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Square (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350 F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute chopped celery and chopped onions in margarine or butter until tender.
STEP 2:
Pour sauteed vegtables over bread;  toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute (with boiling water)  Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 4:
Combine stock, poultry seasoning, pepper, and thyme;  add to bread mixture.  Mix lightly.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 5:
Place about 1-3/4 gal mixture in each well greased pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 1 to 1-1/2 hours or until top is lightly browned.
STEP 7:
Cut each pan 5 by 10.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb finely chopped celery;  2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lbs chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.  
3.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 40 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned on low fan, open vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.  See Recipes No A-25.
5.  Dressing may be served with fish, pork, beef, and veal.

VARIATIONS:
1.  APPLE DRESSING:  In Step 1, saute 4 lb 13 oz (1-1/2 gal)  peeled, diced, cooking apples (6 lb 3 oz A.P.)  with celery and onions.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 3 oz (1/2 cup)  Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 8 lb (1 gal)  boiling water.  In Step 4, omit thyme.  In Step 5, place about 2 gal mixture in each pan.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.
2.  SAUSAGE DRESSING:  In Step 1, reduce margarine or butter to 8 oz (1 cup).  Combine sauteed vegtables with 3 lb cooked, chopped, drained pork sausage (3 lb 9 oz A.P.).  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, if hot sausage is used, omit pepper.  In Step 5, place about 2 gal mixture in each pan.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.
3.  OYSTER DRESSING:  Thaw 6 lb (2-3/4 qt)  frozen oysters.  Drain;  reserve liquid;  chop oysters.  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 2-1/2 oz (6-1/3 tbsp)  Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 6 lb (3 qt)  boiling water.  In Step 4, add oysters and reserved oyster liquid.  In Step 5, place 1-3/4 gal mixture in each pan.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2¼ Cups)
EACH PORTION:  1 Teaspoon

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add water gradually to mustard;  blend until smooth.

NOTE:
1.  Serve with Chinese or Philippine style egg rolls.
2.  If a hotter sauce is desired, cover and refrigerate overnight.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3-1/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP !:
Combine tomato juice and lemon juice; cover; refrigerate for several hours or overnight.
STEP 2:
Stir well before serving.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1: 1 lb 2 oz lemons A.P. (4-5) lemons will yield 3/4 cup juice.
2.  In Step 1:  3, 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate and 2-1/4 gal water may be used.

VARIATIONS:
1. VEGETABLE JUICE COCKTAIL:  In Step 1, use 3-1/4 gal (9-No. 3 cyl cn) canned vegetable juice for tomato juice.  Follow Step 2.
2.  SPICY TOMATO JUICE COCKTAIL:  In Step 1, add 3/4 cup hot sauce.  Follow Step 2.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  See Step 6
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:
STEP 1:
Place apples in large container.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle lemon juice and lemon rind over apples.
STEP 3:
Combine sugar, starch, cinnamon, and salt; sprinkle mixture over apples.  Stir lightly to moisten sugar-starch mixture.  Arrange about 11 lb (1¼ gal) apples-sugar mixture in each pan.
STEP 4:
Combine brown sugar, flour, baking powder, baking soda, margarine or butter, and oats; blend to form a crumbly mixture.
Sprinkle about 3 lb 10 oz (2½ qt) mixture evenly over apples in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 40 minutes or until top is bubbling and lightly browned.
STEP 6:
Cut 6 by 9.  Serve with serving spoon or spatula.

NOTE:

1. In Step 2, 12 oz lemons A.P. (3 lemons) will yield ½ cup juice.
2. In Step 3, 4 oz (7/8 cup) cornstarch may be used for pregelatinized starch.
3. In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F 30 minutes or until bubbling and lightly browned on low fan, open vent.
4.  In Step 3, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 4 half sheet pans (13x18-inches); place 5 lb 10 oz (2½ qt) apple-starch mixture in each pan.  In Step 4, sprinkle 1 lb 13 oz (1¼ qt) sugar mixture over apples in each pan.  In Step 5,
bake at 375°F 18 minutes with 50% microwave power first 2 minutes.  In Step 6, cut 5 by 5.

VARIATION
1. APPLE CRISP (PIE FILLING, PREPARED AND OATMEAL COOKIE MIX):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 21 lb (2¼ gal-3-
No.10 cn) canned prepared apple pie filling.  Place about 
10 lb 8 oz (4½ qt) on each pan.  In Step 4, omit all ingredients.
Use 6 lb 12 oz (4½ - 1½ No.10 cn) canned Oatmeal Cookie Mix combined with 1 lb (2 cups) softened margarine or butter.
Sprinkle about 3 lb 13 oz (2½ qt) mixture evenly over apples in each pan.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.
RecipeItem/8/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
RecipeItem/9/_ItemName: Calumet Double Acting Baking Powder KFT

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (13 - 1 Crust Pies)
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sift together flour and salt into mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Add Shortening to dry ingredients.  Using pastry knife attachment, mix at low speed 30 seconds or until shortening is evenly distributed and mixture is granular in appearance.
STEP 3:
Add cold (40°F. to 50°F.) water; mix at low speed 1 minute until dough is just formed.
STEP 4:
Chill dough at least 1 hour for ease in handling.
STEP 5:
BAKED PIE SHELLS:
1.  PREPARE AND DIVIDE DOUGH:  Prepare Pie Crust for 
13 - 1 Crust Pies.  Divide dough into 13 - 7½ oz pieces; place on lightly floured board.
2.  ROLL DOUGH:  Sprinkle each piece of dough lightly with flour; flatten gently.  Using a floured rolling pin, roll lightly with quick strokes from center out to edge in all directions.  Form a circle 1 inch larger than pie pan and about 1/8 inch thick.  Shift or turn dough occasionally to prevent sticking.  If edges split, pinch cracks together.
3.  PLACE DOUGH IN PAN:  Fold rolled dough in half; 
carefully place into ungreased pie pan with fold at center.  Unfold and fit carefully into pie pan, being careful not to leave any air spaces between pan and dough.
4.  REMOVE EXCESS DOUGH:  Trim ragged edges about
½ inch beyond edge of pan using knife or spatula.  (Incorporate excess dough into next crust, if needed.)  Fold extra dough back and under; crimp with the thumb and forefinger to make a high fluted edge.  Dock or prick dough on bottom and sides to prevent puffing during baking.  If available, place an empty pie pan inside of shell before baking to help prevent shrinking and puffing.
5.  BAKE:  Bake at 450°F. about 10 minutes or until golden brown or in 400°F. convection oven 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown on high fan, open vent.
6.  FILL CRUST:  Fill as specified on individual recipe card.
UNBAKED SHELL:
1.  Follow above steps 1 through 4 for Baked Pie Shells; omit docking or pricking of dough in Step 4.
2.  Fill and bake according to instructions on specified recipe.

NOTE:
Pie Crust Mix may be used.  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Follow manufacturer's directions for preparation.  Follow Steps 4 & 5. Quantity of pie crust mixed requited:  5 lb pie crust mix yields 13-one crust pies.

VARIATIONS:
1.  PIE CRUST (DOUGH ROLLING MACHINE):  In Step 1, combine 1 lb 14 oz (1 qt, 3½ cups) sifted bread flour, 15 oz (3-3/4 cups) sifted general purpose flour, 1½ oz (2-1/3 tbsp) salt, 2-1/3 oz (1½ tbsp) granulated sugar, and 2/3 oz (2-1/3 tbsp) nonfat dry milk.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 1-3/4 cups cold water.  In Step 4, chill dough at least 1 hour (preferably 24 hours) at 40°F.  Follow equipment manufacturer's instructions for feeding (loading) dough into machine.  In Step 5 follow steps 3 through 5.
2.  PIE CRUST (MANUAL MIXING METHOD):  In Step 1, sift flour and salt together.  In Step 2, cut or rub shortening until evenly distributed and granular in appearance.  In Step 3, sprinkle half of water over flour mixture; mix.  Sprinkle remaining water; mix until dough is just formed.  Follow Steps 4 & 5.

YIELD:  7½ Quarts (For 13 Pies)
PORTION:  2½ Cups Per Pie
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Using whip, beat room temperature egg whites (4½ cups is about 36 egg whites) at high speed in mixer bowl until foamy, about 3 minutes.
STEP 2:
Add sugar a little at a time, beat well at medium speed after each addition.  Beat at high speed until stiff peaks are formed, about 6 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add salt and vanilla; blend.
STEP 4:
Spread about 2½ cups meringue over warm pie filling 
(122°F.) in each pan.  Meringue should touch inner edge of crust all around and completely cover top of pie.  Leave meringue somewhat rough on top.
STEP 5:
Bake 16 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned.

NOTE:
Topping is for 13 pies.

VARIATION:
1.  MERINGUE (DEHYDRATED):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 4½ oz (3/4 cup) meringue powder and 3 cups cold water. 
Add water to mixer bowl; add meringue powder.  Using whip, mix at low speed 1 minute or until powder is dissolved.  Beat at high speed until stiff peaks form, about 5 minutes.  Gradually add 1 lb 8 oz (3-1/3 cups) granulated sugar beating at high speed 1 minute or until meringue is glossy.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pies)
EACH PORTION:  1/8 Pie
PAN SIZE:  9-inch Pie Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

Step 1.  See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies)
Step 2.  Combine 1-2/3 gallons mincemeat, 2-1/4 canned chopped apples, and 1-2/3 cups sugar; mix until well blended.
Step 3.  Pour about 3½ cups filling into each unbaked pie shell.  Cover with top crust.  Seal edges.
Step 4.  Bake 45 minutes or until lightly browned.
Step 5.  Cut 8 wedges per pie.

YIELD:  About 1½ Cups (FOR 13 Pies)

METHOD:

Step 1.  Combine milk and water; mix until thoroughly blended.
Step 2.  Add eggs (6 tbsp is about 2 eggs); whip until well blended.
Step 3.  Brush on pies.  Allow to dry before baking.

NOTE:

1.  This wash will cover 13 to 15 2-crust pies (apple, blueberry, cherry, peach, and pineapple) which are baked 30 to 35 minutes  See Pie Crust (13 - 2 crust pies).
2.  Keep all washes refrigerated until ready to use.

VARIATIONS:

1.  EGG AND WATER WASH:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Combine 3 eggs (5oz or 2/3 cup) with 1½ cups water.  Whip until well blended.  Follow Step 3.  NOTE:  Use on 2-crust pies (berry and mincemeat) which are baked 40 to 50 minutes.  To prevent dark spots, allow wash to dry on crust before baking.
See Pie Crust (13 - 2 Crust Pies).
2.  MILK AND WATER WASH:  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Combine 1-1/3 oz (4-2/3 tbsp) nonfat dry milk and 1-1/3 cups warm water.  Mix well.  Brush on turnovers; allow to dry before baking.  See Recipe No.1-G-3.  DO NOT USE ON 2-CRUST PIES.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  4 Shrimp (1 ounce) plus
                               2 Tbsp Sauce (1 ounce)

METHOD:

Step 1.  Place shimp in 3 qt boiling water; cover; return to boil; uncover; reduce heat, simmer 2 to 3 minutes.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Drain immediately.
Step 2.  Place shrimp in single layer on 2 sheet pans (18x26 inches).  Refrigerate for use in Step 5.
Step 3.  Prepare 1 recipe Seafood Cocktail, Recipe No.0-11.  Cover; refrigerate for use in Step 6.
Step 4.  Line individual serving dishes with lettuce.
Step 5.  Arrange 4 shrimp on lettuce in each dish.
Step 6.  Place 2 tbsp (1-No.30 scoop) sauce in each souffle
cup.  Serve with shrimp.

NOTE:

1.  For other types of unbreaded shrimp,see Guidelines for Using Shrimp,  Recipe No. L-G-2.
2.  In Step 3, 8 lb 4 oz (11-12 oz bt) prepared seafood cocktail sauce may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 4 lb 5 oz lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb shredded lettuce.
4.  In Step 6, shrimp may be served with 1 lemon wedge.  Use 13 (3 lb 4 oz) fresh lemons A.P.  Cut 8 wedges per lemon.

VARIATION:

1.  SPICED SHRIMP:  In Step 1, reduce water to 1 qt; add 2 qt vinegar, 1 oz (6 tbsp) ground red pepper; 1-1/5 oz (6 tbsp) mustard flour, 1 oz (¼ cup) whole celery seed, 1 oz (2 tbsp) ground paprika, 1 tbsp ground ginger, 1 tbsp ground mace, 1 tbsp ground cinnamon, 2 tsp ground cloves and 12 bay leaves; mix well.  Proceed with remainder of Step 1.  Follow Step 2.  Omit Step 3.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  Omit Step 6.
EACH PORTION:  4 Shrimp (1 ounce).

YIELD:  100 Portions ( 4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Slice (1½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

Step 1.  Combine cheese, tomato paste, salad oil (or olive oil), olives, onions and peppers.  Blend well.
Step 2.  Spread about 3 tbsp (1-No.30 scoop) mixture on each slice of bread (1/2-inch thick).
Step 3.  Place on ungreased pans.  Bake 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, pizza blend cheese may be firmly packed; break apart before use.
2.  In Step 1, 4 lb cheese, Mozzarella, shredded may be used.
3.  In Step 1, ½ - 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
4.  In Step 1, 10 oz fresh green onions with tops A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped green onions.
5.  In Step 1, 8 oz (1½ cups) dry onions, chopped (9 oz A.P.) may be used for chopped green onions.
6.  In Step 1, 15 fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped sweet peppers.
7.  In Step 2, 50 sandwich or frankfurter buns or English muffins, cut in half, may be used for French bread.
8.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 5 minutes on low fan, open vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORITON:  8 Ounces

METHOD:

Step 1
Combine cocoa, salt and sugar.
Step 2:
Add 1½ qt cold water; mix.  Heat to boiling point; reduce heat, simmer 5 minutes.
Step 3:
Reconstitute milk with the 5¼ gallons warm water; add to cocoa syrup, stirring constantly.  Add vanilla (optional); mix until well blended.
Step 4:
Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
Step 5:
Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  Cocoa may be served with miniature marshmallows.  8 oz (4½ cups) marshmallows will yield 4 to 5 marshmallows per serving of cocoa.
2.  If 6 oz portions are desired, prepare 3/4 basic recipe.

VARIATION:

1.  HOT WHIPPED COCOA:  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Place 6 lb Cocoa Beverage Powder in dispenser container.  Follow manufacturer's directions for preparation and dispensing of cocoa.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  8 Ounces

METHOD:

Step 1:
Add coffee (3½ cups is one 8 oz pg) to the boiling water.  Stir until dissolved.
Step 2:
Keep hot.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:

1.  Omit Steps 1 and 2 if using an instant coffee dispenser.  Place 8 oz freeze-dried instant coffee in dispenser jar.  Follow dispenser manufacturer's directions for preparation and dispensing.
2.  In Step 1, if 6 oz portions are desired, use 6 oz freeze-dried instant coffee and about 4-3/4 gal boiling water.

YIELD:  100 PORTIONS (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  8 Ounces

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 8 oz loose tea in a cloth bag large enough to hold three times the amount.
STEP 2:
Tie top of bag with cord long enough to facilitate removal; tie cord to handle of urn or kettle.
STEP 3:
Place tea bag in urn or kettle.
STEP 4:
Pour 6½ gal briskly boiling water over tea bag.  Cover.  Steep 3 to 5 minutes.  DO NOT agitate or stir.
STEP 5:
Remove tea bag.
STEP 6:
Cover; keep hot, but DO NOT boil.

NOTE:

1.  If loose tea, not enclosed in a cloth bag, is placed in the urn or kettle, strain tea after it has steeped 5 minutes.
2.  Tea must never be boiled as this produces a bitter flavor.
3.  Schedule preparation so not more than 15 minutes will elapse between preparation and service; hold tea at temperatures 175°F. to 180°F.
4.  For 5 oz portions, use 5 oz (1-3/4 cups) tea, black, loose and 4 gal water.
5.  8 oz (100) individual tea bags may be used.  Place on serving line for self-service.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (2 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sprinkle flour evenly over 2½ cups meat drippings and melted shortening (Au Jus Gravy substituted for meat drippings above).  Scrape and use brown particles remaining in pan.
STEP 2:
Cook at low heat on top of range, in a steam-jacketed kettle or in 375°F. oven 30 minutes until flour is a rich brown color.  Stir frequently to avoid overbrowning.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base.  Add stock to roux, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 4:
Add pepper.  Stir to blend.

NOTE:

One, Size 1 ladle may be used (1/4 cup).

VARIATIONS:

1.  BROWN GRAVY (BROWN GRAVY MIX):  Omit all Steps.  Combine 1 lb 8 oz (1¼ cn) canned Brown Gravy Mix with 1½ qt cold water.  Mix until smooth.  Add 1-1/8 gal boiling water, stirring constantly.  Cook at medium heat until gravy comes to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
2.  CHICKEN OR TURKEY GRAVY:  In Step 1, use 12 oz (1½ cups) melted shorteniing or salad oil and 12 oz (3 cups) sifted general purpose flour.  Blend together until smooth; cook at low heat 2 minutes.  Omit Step 2.  In Step 3, add 6¼ oz (1 cup) Soup and Gravy base, chicken.  Follow Step 4.
3.  CHILI GRAVY:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 12 oz (1½ cups)
melted shortening or salad oil and 12 oz (3 cups) sifted general purpose flour.  Blend together until smooth; cook at low heat 2 minutes.  Add 1 lb 7 oz (3/4-No. 2½ cn) canned tomato paste, 3 oz (9 tbsp) chili powder, and 3/4 oz (3 tbsp)
ground cumin; blend well.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.  YIELD: 6-3/4 Quarts.
4.  GIBLET GRAVY:  Wash and clean 3 lb giblets.  Cover with water; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 hour or until tender.  Drain; reserve liquid for use as part of stock for chicken gravy or turkey gravy.  Chop giblets coarsely; add to thickened chicken or turkey gravy.
5.  MUSHROOM GRAVY:   Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Saute
2 lb (1-1/8 jumbo or 2¼ 8Z cn) canned mushrooms, drained, in 1 oz (2 tbsp) melted butter or margarine; drain.  In Step 3, add to thickened gravy.  Follow Step 4.
6.  ONION GRAVY:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Saute 3 lb (2¼ qt (3 lb 5 oz A.P.)) thinly sliced dry onions in 3 oz (6 tbsp)
melted shortening or salad oil until onions are tender.  Drain.  In Step 3, add to thickened gravy.  Follow Step 4.
7.  QUICK ONION GRAVY (SOUP, DEHYDRATED, ONION): Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 6¼ qt boiling water combined with 12 oz (3/4-No. 2½ cn) canned dehydrated onion soup; simmer 10 minutes.  Add soup mixture to roux, stirring constantly.  Bring to boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.  Omit Step 4.
8.  VEGETABLE GRAVY:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Saute 15 oz (3¼ cup (1 lb 2 oz A.P.)) diced, fresh carrots and 12 oz (2¼ cups (13 oz A.P.)) chopped onions in 2 oz (¼ cup) melted shortening or salad oil until tender.  Add onions, carrots, and 1 lb frozen peas to boiling stock.  Reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.  Follow Step 4.
9.  ONION AND MUSHROOM GRAVY:  Follow Steps 1 though 3.  In Step 3, saute 14 oz (1/2-jumbo or one 8Z cn, 1½ cups) canned mushrooms, drained, and 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) thinly sliced, dry onions (1 lb 11 oz A.P.) in 2 oz (¼ cup) melted shortening or salad oil until onions are tender.  Add mushrooms and onions to thickened gravy.  Follow Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Reconstitute milk using 1½ gallons warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Add flour to 1½ cups fat drippings from meat and melted shortening ( Au Jus Gravy above substituted for fat drippings) in roasting pan.  Use brown particles remaining in pan.  Cook about 5 minutes until light brown, stirring until smooth.
STEP 3:
Add hot milk from Step 1, stirring constantly.
STEP 4:
Bring to a simmer; simmer 5 minutes until thickened.
STEP 5:
Add salt and pepper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, if fat drippings from meat are not available, shortening may be used.
2.  One Size 1 ladle my be used (1/4 cup).

VARIATION:

1.  CREAM ONION GRAY:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, saute 3 lb (2¼ qt) chopped dry onions (3 lb 11 oz A.P.) in fat drippings and shortening until tender.  Add flour, blend together.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Quarts)
EACH PORITON:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

CANNED AU JUS GRAVY:
STEP 1:
Open 3 quarts Au Jus Gravy and heat to serving temperature.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

AU JUS GRAVY FROM DRIPPINGS:
STEP 1:
Skim excess fat from 2 qt meat drippings.
STEP 2:
Pour 1 qt boiling water into drippings.
STEP 3:
Stir; scrape bottom and sides of pan until drippings, water and brown particles are well blended.
STEP 4:
Add 1 tbsp each of salt and pepper.  Heat to serving temperature.

NOTE:

1.  Gravy may be served with roast beef, pork or veal.
2.  One Size 0 Ladle may be used (2 tbsp).

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute finely chopped onions in 1½ cup meat drippings and melted shortening (Au Jus Gravy substituted above for meat drippings) until tender.
STEP 2:
Add flour to sauteed onions, stir until well blended
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base.
STEP 4:
Combine hot tomato juice and stock.
STEP 5:
Add tomato juice to warm roux, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 6:
Add pepper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 13 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 1½ oz (½ cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In step 4, 2½ cups, ½ 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate and 7½ cups water may be used for tomato juice.
4.  One Size 1 ladle may be used (1/4 cup).

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Nonfat Reg Skim Dry PwdMilkw/Add Vit A
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions ( 2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Biscuit
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  450°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sift together flour, dry milk, baking powder and salt into mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Blend shortening at low speed into dry ingredients until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal.
STEP 3:
Add water; mix at low speed only enough to form a soft dough.
STEP 4:
Place dough on lightly floured board.  Knead lightly, about 1 minute or until dough is smooth.
STEP 5:  
Roll or pat out to a uniform thickness of ½ inch.
STEP 6:
Cut with 2½ inch floured biscuit cutter.  Place 50 biscuits on each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

NOTE:
1.  For browner tops:  In Step 1, add 3½ oz (½ cup) granulated sugar to ingredients.
2.  In Step 7. if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 minutes or until lightly browned on low fan, open vent.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKING POWDER BISCUITS (BISCUIT MIX):  Omit Steps 1 through 7.  Use 7 lb 14 oz (1-3/4 - No.10 cn) canned Biscuit Mix.  Prepare according to instructions on container.  For convection oven see, Note 2.
2.  CHEESE BISCUITS:  In Step 1, add 1 lb (1 qt) grated Cheddar cheese to sifted dry ingredients.  Follow Steps 2 through 7.
3.  DROP BISCUITS: Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, increase water to 4 lb 12 oz (2-1/3 qt).  Omit Steps 4 through 6.  Drop dough by heaping tbsp, 1 inch apart, on greased sheet pans in rows 6 by 9.  Follow Step 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions ( 8 Loaves)
EACH PORITON:  2 Slices
PAN SIZE:  16 x 4-1/2 x 4-1/8 inch Loaf Type Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Reconstitute milk; add vinegar.  Let stand 15 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Place flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, raisins and caraway seeds in mixer bowl.  Mix at low speed just enough to blend.
STEP 3:
Using pastry knife attachment, cut butter or margarine into dry ingredients until it resembles coarse meal.
STEP 4:
Stir eggs (2.¼ cups is about 12 eggs) into milk.   Add egg-milk mixture to dry ingreditents; blend until just mixed, about 45 seconds DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 5:
Place about 3 lb (1½ qt) batter in each greased loaf pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 55 to 60 minutes or until done.
STEP 7:
Cool throughly before slicing.
STEP 8:
Cut 25 slices (about 1/2 inch thick) per loaf.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Calumet Double Acting Baking Powder KFT

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Roll
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sprinkle yeast over 1 qt warm (105°F to 110°F) water.  DO NOT USE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 110°F.  Mix well.  Let stand 5 minutes; stir. Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Place 4¼ qt cold water, sugar, salt, and sifted flour in mixer bowl.
STEP 3:
Mix at low speed 1 minute or until all flour is incorporated into liquid using dough hook; add yeast solution; mix at low speed 1 minute.
STEP 4:
Add shortening; mix at medium speed 10 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic.  Dough temperature should be 78°F. to 82°F.
METHOD FOR HANDLING MIXED DOUGH:
STEP 5:
FERMENT:  Cover.  Set in warm place (80°F) 1½ hours or until double in bulk.
STEP 6:
PUNCH:  Fold sides into center.  Turn dough over.  Divide dough into ten 2-lb 15-oz pieces.  Let rest about 10 minutes.
STEP 7:
MAKEUP:  Divide each ball into 10 - 4½ oz pieces; flatten.  Roll up like jelly roll into 1¼ by 8 inch rolls.  Place 15 rolls about 2 inches apart on each greased pan.
STEP 8:
Prepare 1/2 recipe Cornstarch Wash (Recipe D-40).  Brush on top and sides of each roll.
STEP 9:
PROOF: at 90°F. until double in bulk, about 40 minutes.
STEP 10:
BAKE: 18 to 20 minutes or in 350°F. convection oven 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned on high fan, open vent.  Immediately brush with Cornstarch Wash.  Cool on wire racks.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 7, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 16 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).  Place six rolls on each pan. In Step 10, bake at 400°F. 8 minutes with 40% microwave power last 2 minutes or until lightly browned.
2.  Rolls may be prepared using semi-automatic bakery equipment (roll divider and rounding maching, bread molder-dough sheeter machine and bun slicer).  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, combine 1-1/3 oz (3 tbsp) bakery emulsifier with flour and milk.  Follow Steps 3 through 6.  In Step 7, divide dough into 5-lb 6-oz pieces.  Place in roll divider and rounding
machine.  Divide into 36 balls.  Press 2 balls together to form 4½-oz balls.  Let rest 5 to 10 minutes.  Feed balls, one at a time into a bread molder-dough sheeter machine, with a 9-inch pressure plate.  Follow Steps 8 through 10.  Slice rolls partially through using bun slicer.

VARIATION:

1.  SUBMARINE ROLLS (ROLL MIX):  In Step 1, use 6-3/8 oz (about 1¼ cups) active dry yeast and 2-lb 2-oz (4½ cups) water.  Omit Steps 2 through 5.  Use 19-lb 2-oz (4¼ No.10 cn) Roll Mix and 8-lb (1 gal) cold water.  Prepare according to instructions on container.  Follow Steps 6 through 10.

YIELD:  100 Portions (12 loaves - 4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Slices
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sprinkle yeast over warm (105°F to 110°F.) water.  DO NOT USE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 110°F.  Mix well.  Let stand 5 minutes; stir.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Place 8-3/4 cups cold water, sugar, salt, and sifted flour in mixer bowl.
STEP 3:
Using dough hook, mix at low speed 1 minute or until all flour mixture is incorporated into liquid; add yeast solution; mix at medium speed 5 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add shortening; continue mixing at medium speed 3 minutes.  Dough temperature should be 78°F. to 82°F.
METHOD FOR HANDLING MIXED DOUGH:
STEP 5:
FERMENT:  Cover.  Set in warm place (80°F.) 2¼ hours or until double in bulk.
STEP 6:
PUNCH:  Fold sides into center; turn completely over.  Let rest 15 minutes.
STEP 7:  
MAKE UP:  Scale into 12 19-oz pieces; shape each piece into a smooth ball; let rest 10 minutes.  Form each piece into a rope, 1¼ inches in diameter and 8 inches long.  Place 3 loaves on each cornmeal dusted pan (use 1/2 cup cornmeal (1/8 cup cornmeal per pan)).
STEP 8:
PROOF:  At 90°F. to 100°F. 50 to 60 minutes or until double in bulk.
STEP 9:
Brush top of each loaf with Cornstarch Wash (Recipe No. D-40) or Egg White Wash (Recipe No. D-17-1)  Cut 6 diagonal slashes, 1/4 inch deep, on top of each loaf.
STEP 10:
BAKE:  30 minutes or until done.
STEP 11:
When cool, cut 17 slices ( 1-inch thick) per loaf.

NOTE:
In Step 9. slashes should be make very quickly with a very sharp, razor-thin knife just before placing in oven.

YIELD:  100 Portions (8 Loaves)
EACH PORTION:  2 Slices
PAN SIZE:  10½x5x3½-inch Bread Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sprinkle yeast over 2¼ cups warm (105°F. to 110°F.) water.  DO NOT USE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 110°F.  Mix well.  Let stand 5 minutes; stir.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Place 1½ qt cold water, sugar, salt, milk, cinnamon, and 1 tablespoon lemon flavoring in mixer bowl. Using dough hook, mix at low speed just enough to blend.
STEP 3:
Add sifted flour.  Mix at low speed 1 minute or until flour is incorporated into liquid.
STEP 4:
Add yeast solution; mix at low speed 1 minute.
STEP 5:
Add shortening; mix at low speed 1 minute.  Continue mixing at medium speed 10 to 15 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic.  Dough temperature should be 78°F to 82°F.
STEP 6:
Add washed, drained raisins.  Mix at low speed 1 minute.
METHOD FOR HANDLING MIXED DOUGH:
STEP 7:
FERMENT:  Cover.  Set in a warm place (80°F) 2 hours or until double in bulk.
STEP 8:
PUNCH:  Fold sides into center; turn dough completely over.  Let rest 20 minutes.
STEP 9:
MAKE UP:  Scale into 8 1-lb 15-oz pieces; shape each piece into a smooth ball; let rest 10 minutes.  Mold each piece into a loaf; place each loaf into lightly greased bread pan.
STEP 10:
PROOF:  At 90°F. to 100°F. 50 to 60 minutes or until double in bulk.
STEP 11:
BAKE:  45 to 50 minutes or in 325°F. convection oven 40 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.
STEP 12:
Prepare 1/4 recipe Syrup Glaze, Recipe No. D-45 (optional).  Brush top of each loaf with glaze.
STEP 13:  
When cool, slice 25 slices (about 1/2-inch thick) per loaf.

NOTE:

1.  Soak 3 lb (2¼ qt) raisins in 3 qt lukewarm water 15 minutes.  Drain.  Set raisins aside for use in Step 6.
2  In Step 9, when using 9 by 4-1/2 by 2-3/4 inch bread pans, scale into 10 1-lb 9-oz pieces.  Bake 35 to 40 minutes or in 325°F. convection oven 30 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 13, slice 20 slices (about 1/2-inch thick) per lo
RecipeItem/5/_ItemName: Powdered Skim Milk w/o Add Vit A-Inst

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Loaves - 3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Slices
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sprinkle yeast over 1-3/4 cups warm (105°F. to 110°F.) water. DO NOT USE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 110F°.  Mix well.  Let stand 5 minutes; stir.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Place 2¼ qts cold water, sugar, salt, caraway seed and sifted flours in mixer bowl.
STEP 3:
Using dough hook, mix at low speed 1 minute or until all flour is incorporated into liquid; add yeast solution; mix at low speed 1 minute.
STEP 4:
Add shortening; continue mixing at low speed 8 to 10 minutes or until dough is smooth.  DO NOT OVERMIX.  Dough temperature should be 74°F. to 76°F.
METHOD FOR HANDLING MIXED DOUGH;
STEP 5:
FERMENT:  Cover; set in warm place (80°F) 1½ hours or until double in bulk.
STEP 6:
PUNCH:  Fold sides into center; turn dough completely over.
STEP 7:
