     -  Evenly slice foods such as tomatoes, cheese, and                 meats.  Cross-stack sliced ingredients such as cheese            and meat for quick and easy pickup.
    -  Prepare mixed sandwich fillings.
3.  Allow plenty of space of work.
4.  Assemble all equipment and ingredients in advance, and place within easy reach toward back of work space.
5.  Arrange ingredients in the order to be used.

2.  In Step 1, 24 lb corned beef will yield about 16 lb cooked corned beef.
3.  In Step 1, 16 lb precooked frozen corned beef may be used.  Thaw.
4.  In Step 2, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
5.  In Step 2, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
6.  Other types of bread may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  CORNED BEEF  AND CHEESE SANDWICH:  In Step 1, use 10 lb 9 oz corned beef slices (16 lb A.P.) and 5 lb 3 oz (100 slices) American or Swiss cheese.  In Step 2, use 2 to 3 slices corned beef and 1 slice cheese for each sandwich.  Follow Step 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook eggs (15 lb is 150 eggs) according to Cooked Eggs (Hard Cooked).  Shell; finely chop eggs.
STEP 2:
Combine eggs, onions (optional), pickles, mustard, and Salad Dressing; mix together lightly.  Refrigerate until ready to use.
STEP 3:
Spread 1 slice bread with 1/2 cup (1 No.8 scoop) filling; top with lettuce (optional) and second slice of bread.
STEP 4:
Cut each sandwich in half; serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 14 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
3.  In Step 3, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
4.  Other types of bread may be used.

VARIATION:

1,  NEW YORK EGG SALAD SANDWICH (EGG AND TOMATO):  In Step 2, omit onions.  In Step 3, thinly slice 11 lb 2 oz fresh tomatoes (11 lb 6 oz A.P.).  Place 2 slices on top of egg filling.  Follow S

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Slice ham into thin slices, 20 to 24 slices per pound.
STEP 2:
Spread 1 slice bread with mustard (optional).  Place 3 to 4 slices (3 oz) ham on bread; top with lettuce (optional) and second slice of bread.
STEP 3:
Cut each sandwich in half; serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:
1:
GUIDELINES FOR SANDWICH PREPARATION:
Sandwiches may be served hot or cold, closed or open-faced. Variation in the bread and rolls will provide variety in flavor, texture, size and shape.  Enriched white, rye, whole wheat,
pumpernickel, French, raisin, and Italian breads, plus hot dog, hamburger, soft and hard rolls, English muffins, and pita bread can be used in sandwiches.  Bread with a relatively firm texture makes good sandwiches for eating out-of-hand without bending or losing filling.
PRE-PREPARATION:
1.  Have sandwich counter, tools, and equipment clean and sanitary.
2.  Following recipe card, have all ingredients ready to use:
-  Wash lettuce thoroughly; core, separate leaves, drain, and  crisp.
-  Evenly slice foods such as tomatoes, cheese, and meats.    Cross-stack sliced ingredients such as cheese and meat for    quick and easy pickup.
-  Prepare mixed sandwich fillings.
3.  Allow plenty of space to work.
4.  Assemble all equipment and ingredients in advance, and place within easy reach toward back of work space.
5.  Arrange ingredients in the order to be used.

2.  In Step 1, 18 lb 12 oz ham, boneless, cooked, frozen, may be used.  Thaw ham.
3.  In Step 2, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
4.  In Step 2, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
5.  Other types of bread may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  FRIED HAM SANDWICH:  In Step 1, slice ham into ¼-inch slices (3 oz).  Grill on lightly greased 350°F. griddle about 1 minute on each side until lightly browned.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, serve hot.
2.  HAM AND CHEESE SANDWICH:  In Step 1, use 12 lb 8 oz ham.  Place 2 oz ham on each sandwich.  Add 5 lb 3 oz (100 slices) sliced American, Swiss or Cheddar cheese.  In Step 2, place 1 slice cheese on top of ham in each sandwich. Follow Step 3.
3.  HAM AND TOMATO SANDWICH:  Follow Step 1.  Use 11 lb 2 oz (200 slices) fresh tomatoes, thinly sliced (11 lb 6 oz A.P.).  In Step 2, place 2 slices tomato on top of ham in each sandwich.  Follow Step 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Hamburger
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Grill 100 - 3 oz ground beef (18.75 lb) patties 4 minutes or until browned; turn; grill on other side 4 minutes.
STEP 2:
Serve hot on buns.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 1, charbroiler may be used.  Follow manufacturer's directions for preparation.
2.  In Step 2, 1 recipe Sandwich Buns may be used.
3.  In Step 2, buns may be toasted.
4.  In Step 2, multigrain buns may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHEESEBURGER:  Follow Step 1.  After patties are turned, use 5 lb 3 oz (100 slices) American cheese; place 1 slice cheese on each pattie.  Continue to grill until cheese melts.  Follow Step 2.
2.  CHEESY BACONBURGER:     Use 6 lb thawed, raw, sliced bacon; cut slices in half; cook.  Follow directions for Variation 1.  Top melted cheese with 2 half slices bacon.  Follow Step 2.
3.  DOUBLE DECKER CHEESEBURGER:  Prepare 2 recipes Variation 1.  Use 4 lb (1 gal) finely shredded lettuce (4 lb 5 oz A.P.), 3 lb 2 oz dill pickles, drained, sliced crosswise (4 lb 13 oz  A.P.), and 12 oz (2¼ cups) finely chopped onions (13 oz A.P.).  In Step 2, use 100 double-cut sandwich buns; place 1 tbsp shredded lettuce and 1 slice pickle on bottom and middle bun slices.  Place a cheeseburger on top of bottom and middle slices of bun; place ½ tsp finely chopped onions on top of cheeseburger.  Assemble layers; cover with top of bun.
4.  CHILIBURGER:  Follow Step 1.  Use 6 lb 12 oz (1 6-lb 12-oz cn) canned chili con carne without beans.  Heat to boiling.  Follow Step 2. Spread 1 oz (2 tbsp or 1 Size-0 ladle) chili on each grilled hamburger.  Cover with top bun.
5.  DELUXE HAMBURGER:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 3 lb fresh lettuce (3 lb 4 oz A.P.), 5 lb 9 oz sliced fresh tomatoes (5 lb 10 oz A.P.), 3 lb sliced dry onions (3 lb 5 oz A.P.), 3 lb 2 oz dill pickles, drained, sliced crosswise (4 lb 13 oz A.P.), 3 lb 12 oz (6¼ cups) catsup, 1 lb 3 oz (2-1/8 cups) mustard, prepared, and 100 sandwich buns.  Spread 1 tsp mustard on bottom bun and 1 tbsp catsup on top bun.  Add 2 slices onions, 1 lettuce leaf, 1 slice tomato, and 2 slices pickle on bottom bun.  Place grilled hamburger on bottom bun; cover with top bun.
6.  PIZZABURGER:  Follow Step 1.  Use 5 lb 3 oz sliced Mozzarella cheese and 9 lb 13 oz (1½ NO.10 cn) canned pizza sauce.  Heat sauce to boiling.  After patties are turned, place 1 slice cheese on each pattie.  Contine to grill until cheese melts.  Follow Step 2.  Spread 1½ oz (3 tbsp) pizza sauce on each grilled hamburger.  Cover with top bun.
7.  DELUXE CHEESEBURGER:  Prepare 1 recipe Variation 1. In Step 2, use 3 lb fresh lettuce (3 lb 4 oz A.P.), 5 lb 9 oz sliced fresh tomatoes (5 lb 10 oz A.P.) 3 lb sliced dry onions (3 lb 5 oz A.P.), 3 lb 2 oz dill pickles, drained, sliced crosswise (4 lb 13 oz A.P.),  3 lb 12 oz (6¼ cups) catsup, 1 lb 3 oz (2-1/8 cups) mustard, prepared, and 100 sandwich buns.  Spread 1 tsp mustard on bottom bun and 1 tbsp catsup on top bun.  Add 2 slices onions, 1 lettuce leaf, 1 slice tomato and 2 slices pickle on bottom bun.  Place grilled cheeseburger on bottom bun; cover with top bun.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine finely ground ham, finely chopped eggs, chopped pickles and Salad Dressing; mix together lightly.  Refrigerate until ready to use.
STEP 2:
Spread 1 slice bread with ½ cup (1 No.8 scoop) filling; top with lettuce (optional) and second slice of bread.
STEP 3:
Cut each sandwich in half; serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 18 lb 13 oz canned ham or boneless cooked ham will yield about 15 lb cooked ham.
2.  In Step 2, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
3.  In Step 3, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
4.  Other types of bread may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Spread each slice of bread with 1 tbsp peanut butter.  Spread 1 slice bread with 1 tbsp jelly.  Top with second slice.
STEP 2:
Cut each sandwich in half.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, blackberry or apple jelly may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
3.  In Step 1, other types of bread may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  PEANUT BUTTER AND JAM SANDWICH:  In Step 1, omit jelly; use 4 lb 9 oz (6¼ cups) strawberry jam.  NOTE: Cherry, peach or pineapple jam may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain and flake tuna.
STEP 2:
Combine tuna, onions, celery, relish, lemon juice, and Salad Dressing.  Mix together lightly.  Refrigerate until ready to use.
STEP 3:
Spread 1 slice bread with ½ cup (1 No.8 scoop) tuna filling; top with lettuce (optional) and second slice of bread.
STEP 4:
Cut each sandwich in half; serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 20 - 12½ to 13 oz cn canned tuna may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 4 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 2 lb 3 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery; 3 lb fresh lemons A.P. (12 lemons) will yield 2 cups lemon juice.
4.  In Step 3, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
5.  In Step 3, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.

VARIATIONS:

1.  GRILLED TUNA AND CHEESE SANDWICH:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, omit lettuce; use 5 lb 3 oz (100 slices) cheese; place on top of tuna filling.  Melt 2 lb (1 qt) butter or margarine; brush top and bottom of sandwiches; grill on a 400°F. griddle until bread is golden brown on each side and cheese is melted.  Serve hot.  Omit Step 4.
2.  SALMON SALAD SANDWICH:  In Step 1, omit tuna; use 16 lb 7 oz (17 - 15½ oz cn) canned salmon.  Drain and flake salmon; discard bones.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.
3.  TUNA AND TOMATO SANDWICH:      Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, slice 11 lb 6 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. (200 slices); place 2 slices tomato on top of tuna filling.  Follow Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Bagel (2 Halves)
PAN SIZE:  18X26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place softened cream cheese in mixer bowl; beat at medium speed 3 to 4 minutes.
STEP 2:
Cut bagels in half.  Place in rows, 5 by 7, on ungreased sheet pans.  Toast 7 to 8 minutes until warm but still soft.
STEP 3:
Spread each bagel half with 1 tbsp cream cheese.  Serve immediately.

NOTE: 

 In Step 2, if convection oven is used, toast at 325°F. 3 to 4 minutes.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CREAM CHEESE AND TOMATO BAGEL:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Thinly slice 11 lb 2 oz (200 slices) tomatoes, fresh (11 lb 6 oz A.P.).  Place 1 slice tomato on each half.
2.  CREAM CHEESE AND OLIVE BAGEL:  In Step 1, use
6 lb (3 qt) cream cheese.  Add 1 lb (3/4 - 1 qt jar) finely chopped olives, green; beat an additional 2 minutes at medium speed.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Spread 1 slice of bread with Salad Dressing (optional).
STEP 2:
Add 3 slices selected meat (see Note No. 2).  Top with lettuce, 2 slices, thinly sliced tomato, thinly sliced onions, and second slice bread.
STEP 3:
Cut each sandwich in half; serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:  

1:
GUIDELINES FOR SANDWICH PREPARATION:
Sandwiches may be served hot or cold, closed or open-faced. Variation in the bread and rolls will provide variety in flavor, texture, size and shape.  Enriched white, rye, whole wheat, pumpernickel, French, raisin, and Italian bread, plus hot dog, hamburger, soft and hard rolls, English muffins, and pita bread can be used in sandwiches.  Bread with a relatively firm texture makes good sandwiches for eating out-of-hand without bending or losing filling.
PRE-PREPATATION:
1.  Have sandwich counter, tools, and equipment clean and sanitary.
2.  Following recipe card, have all ingredients ready to use:
  -  Wash lettuce thoroughly; core, separate leaves, drain, and      crisp.
  -  Evenly slice foods such as tomatoes, cheese, and meats.       Cross-stack sliced ingredients such as cheese and meat         for quick and easy pickup.
  -  Prepare mixed sandwich fillings.
3.  Allow plenty of space to work.
4.  Assemble all equipment and ingredients in advance, and place within easy reach toward back of work space.
5.  Arrange ingredients in the order to be used.

2.  In Step 1, sliced bologna, liver sausage, pickle and pimiento loaf or salami may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
4.  In Step 1, other types of bread may be used.
5.  In Step 2, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce; 11 lb 6 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 11 lb 2 oz thinly sliced tomatoes; 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb thinly sliced onions.
6.  In Step 2, sliced tomatoes and onions may be placed in containers for self-service.

VARIATION:

1.  COLD CUT SANDWICH WITH CHEESE:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, reduce selected type of meat to 8 lb 6 oz (200 slices); add 5 lb 3 oz (100 slices) American, Cheddar, Monterey Jack or Swiss cheese.  Add 2 slices selected meat, 1 slice cheese and 2 slices tomato.  Follow Step 3.

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine finely chopped ham, slightly beaten eggs (7½ lb is 75 eggs), chopped onions, and peppers; stir to mix well.
STEP 2:
Pour 1/3 cup mixture on lightly greased griddle.  Cook until both sides are lightly browned.
STEP 3:
Place omelet on 1 slice of bread; top with lettuce (optional) and second slice of bread.
STEP 4:
Cut each sandwich in half.  Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 9 lb canned ham will yield 7 lb 8 oz finely chopped ham.
2.  In Step 1, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped sweet peppers.  
3.  In Step 1, 1½ ox (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions and 1 oz (3/4 cup) dehydrated green peppers may be used.
4.  In Step 3, other types of bread may be used.
5.  In Step 3, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cut rolls in half lengthwise; spread each half with Salad Dressing (optional).
STEP 2:
On bottom half of each roll, arrange 3 slices meat, 2 slices cheese and 2 slices tomato.
STEP 3:
Sprinkle shredded lettuce on top.
STEP 4:
Cover with top half of roll. 
STEP 5:
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

NOTE:

1.:
GUIDELINES FOR SANDWICH PREPARATION:
Sandwiches may be served hot or cold, closed or open-faced. Variation in the bread and rolls will provide variety in flavor, texture, size and shape.  Enriched white,rye, whole wheat, pumpernickel, French, raisin, and Italian breads, plus hot dog, hamburger, soft and hard rolls, English muffins, and pita bread can be used in sandwiches.  Bread with a relatively firm texture makes good sandwiches for eating out-of-hand without bending or losing filling.
PRE-PREPARATION:
1.  Have sandwich counter, tools, and equipment clean and sanitary.
2.  Following recipe card, have all ingredients ready to use:
  -  Wash lettuce thoroughly; core, separate leaves, drain, and crisp.
  -  Evenly slice foods such as tomatoes, cheese, and meats.  Cross-stack sliced ingredients such as cheese and meat         for quick and easy pickup.
  -  Prepare mixed sandwich filling.
3.  Allow plenty of space to work.
4.  Assemble all equipment and ingredients in advance, and place within easy reach toward back of work space.
5.  Arrange ingredients in the order to be used.

2.  In Step 1, 25 lb French bread can be used for rolls.  In Step 4, cut each loaf in 4 pieces.
3.  In Step 2, suggested meats are sliced ham, bologna, pickle and pimiento loaf, and salami.
4.  In Step 2, American, Swiss, Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese, or a combination of these may be used.
5.  In Step 2, 11 lb 6 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 11 lb 2 oz thinly sliced tomatoes; 3 lb 4 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 3 lb shredded lettuce.

VARIATION:

1.  ITALIAN STYLE SUBMARINE:  In Step 1, omit Salad Dressing.  In Step 2, use 10 lb 6 oz (200 slices) thinly sliced Provolone cheese.  In Step 3, mix 1 lb 8 oz (3 cups) salad oil or olive oil with 1 cup vinegar; sprinkle over lettuce.  If desired, 1-2/3 oz (10 tbsp) crushed oregano and 2 lb (1½ qt) thinly sliced dry onions (2 lb 4 oz A.P.) may be used.  Combine oregano with salad oil or olive oil and vinegar.  In Step 3, sprinkle salad oil mixture and onions lightly on top of lettuce.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Fresh Red Tomatoes YrRndAvg Med Slc-1/4"

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Slice corned beef across grain into 1/16-inch slices.
STEP 2:
Prepare 1 recipe Thousand Island Dressing (4 lb 2 oz or 2 qt).
STEP 3:
Spread each slice of bread with about 2 tsp Thousand Island Dressing.
STEP 4:
Place about 2½ oz (3 to 6 slices) corned beef on 1 slice bread.  Add about 2 tbsp sauerkraut and 1 slice cheese; top with second slice of bread.
STEP 5:
Brush lightly outside of sandwich with melted butter or margarine.
STEP 6:
Place sandwiches with cheese side up on lightly greased griddle.  Grill 4 minutes or until lightly browned; turn; grill 6 minutes or until lightly browned and cheese is melted.
STEP 7:
Cut each sandwich in half.  Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 24 lb corned beef will yield about 16 lb cooked corned beef.
2.  In Step 2, 15 lb precooked frozen corned beef may be used.  Thaw.
3.  In Step 3, 4 lb 2 oz (2 qt) prepared, ready-to-use Thousand Island Dressing may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  OVEN-TOASTED REUBEN SANDWICH:  Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 6, DO NOT grill; arrange sandwiches on 7 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Toast in a 450°F. oven 20 minutes or until lightly browned or in 400°F. convection oven 10 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  Follow Step 7.
2.  GRILLED REUBEN PASTRAMI SANDWICH:  In Step 1, use 16 lb precooked pastrami.  Follow Steps 2 through 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE: 425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place precooked, frozen breaded chicken fillets on pans.
STEP 2:
Bake 23 to 28 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
STEP 3:
Place 1 fillet on botton half of split bun.  Spread 2 tsp Salad Dressing (optional) on top half of bun.
STEP 4:
Place lettuce leaf (optional) and 1 tomato slice (optional) over fillet.  Cover with top half of bun.  Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 375°F. 12 to 14 minutes or until thoroughly heated on high fan, closed vent.
2.  In Step 4, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
3.  In Step 4, 5 lb 13 oz tomatoes A.P. will yield 5 lb 11 oz sliced tomatoes.

VARIATIONS:

1.  DEEP FAT FRIED CHICKEN FILLET SANDWICH (BREADED):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Fry fillets in 350°F. deep fat 3 to 4 minutes or until heated.  Drain in basket or on absorbent paper.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  CHICKEN FILLET AND CHEESE SANDWICH (BREADED):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Use 2 lb 10 oz (50 slices) American cheese, sliced.  Cut slices in half.  Place 1/2
slice cheese on top of each fillet.  Return to oven; heat 1 minute or until cheese begins to melt.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
3.  GRILLED CHICKEN FILLET SANDWICH (UNBREADED): Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 18 lb 12 oz tempered precooked, unbreaded chicken fillets.  Grill 6 minutes on each side or until thoroughly heated on a 350°F. lightly greased griddle.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
4.  BAKED CHICKEN FILLET SANDWICH (UNBREADED):
In Step 1, use 18 lb 12 oz frozen precooked, unbreaded chicken fillets.  In Step 2, bake 18 to 20 minutes or in 375°F. convection oven 9 to 11 minutes or until thoroughly heated on high fan, closed vent.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Fresh Red Tomatoes YrRndAvg Med Slc-1/4"

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare meatballs.  Keep hot for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Slice rolls in half lengthwise with bottom half thicker than top.
STEP 3:
Place 3 meatballs on bottom half of each roll.
STEP 4:
Pour 4 oz (½ cup - One size 1 ladle) pizza sauce over meatballs.  Cover with top half of roll.
STEP 5:
Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 25 lb French bread may be used.  Cut bread lengthwise so that bottom half is thicker than top half.  Cut loaves crosswise into equal pieces to yield 100 portions.
2.  In Step 4, 3/4 recipe Tomato Sauce, Steps 1 through 4, may be used for pizza sauce.

VARIATIONS:

1.  HOT ITALIAN SAUSAGE SANDWICH:  In Step 1, omit meatballs.  Use 18 lb 12 oz Ittalian sausage.  Prepare sausages according to directions for Baked Italian Sausage.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use one sausage split lengthwise for each sandwich.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  CANNONBALL SANDWICH (CANNED MEATBALLS IN TOMATO SAUCE):  Omit Step 1.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 66 lb 4 oz (10 No.10 cn) canned meatballs in tomato sauce.  Heat thoroughly.  In Step 4, omit Pizza Sauce.  Follow Step 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Partially thaw pastrami; slice across grain into thin slices, 19 to 25 slices per pound..
STEP 2:
Steam until thoroughly heated.  See Note 1.
STEP 3:
Spread 1 slice of bread (rye or pumpernickel) with mustard (optional); add 3 to 4 slices pastrami; top with second slice bread.  Cut in half; serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, to heat pastrami in steamer, place in steamer tray; heat to 5 lb pressure 10 to 15 minutes.
2.  In Step 2, pastrami may be steamed in colander or perforated basket placed over boiling water in steam-jacketed kettle.  DO NOT place pastrami directly in water.
3.  In Step 3, 25 lb French bread may be used.  Cut bread in half lengthwise; then into 100 portions.
4.  In Step 3, 100 French rolls (4 oz each) may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup plus 1 Sandwich Bun

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine onions, peppers, tomato paste, chili powder, pepper, brown sugar, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and water.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 2:
Add beef; combine gently; simmer 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
STEP 3:
Place ½ cup (One Size-2 ladle) mixture on bottom half sandwich bun.  Top with other half bun.
STEP 4:
Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 15 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 12 oz chopped onions and 1 lb 4 oz sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 3½ oz (1 cup plus 3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and 3 oz (2¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 3 oz (2¼ cups) frozen, diced green peppers maybe used.  Thaw peppers.
3.  In Step 1, 4 lb 8 oz (two 36-oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate maybe used for tomato sauce.
4.  In Step 3, ½ recipe Sandwich Buns may be used.
5.  In Step 3, buns may be toasted.
_description: Sandwich, bbq beef/sloppy joe, cnd beef

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 1 slice ham, turkey and cheese on 1 slice bread; top with second slice bread.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute milk; add thawed eggs.  Blend well.
STEP 3:
Dip each side of sandwich into egg and milk mixture; drain.
STEP 4:
Grill each sandwich on well-greased griddle about 2½ minutes on each side or until golden brown and cheese is melted.
STEP 5:
Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 6 lb 4 oz ham, boneless, cooked, frozen may be used.  
2.  In Step 1, 9 lb 6 oz turkey, boneless, raw, will yield about 6 lb 4 oz cooked turkey.
3.  In Step 2, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
4.  In Step 1, other types of bread may be used.
5.  In Step 2, 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 1½ qt warm water may be used for whole eggs.

YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place frozen steaks on pans.  Bake at 425°F. 20 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned.  Cut in half lengthwise; set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Bring pizza sauce to a boil.
STEP 3:
Split French rolls almost through.  Spread 1 oz (2 tbsp - 1 Size 0 ladle) sauce on bottom half of each roll.  Add 2 steak halves; ladle 2 oz (¼ cup - 1 Size-1 ladle) sauce over steak halves.
STEP 4:
Sprinkle about 1 tbsp cheese over each sandwich; close top. Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 2½ recipes Pizza Sauce may be used.
2.  In Step 4, 1 lb 8 oz Mozzarella cheese, shredded may be used for pizza blend cheese.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Fresh Sliced Sweet Green Bell Peppers
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
If, frozen, precooked roast beef is used, thaw.  Slice thin, about 16 slices per pound.
STEP 2:
Cut slices in half lengthwise to form strips.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Saute' peppers (cut in ¼x2-inch strips) 5 minutes.
STEP 4:
Prepare Natural Pan Gravy recipe (Au Jus Gravy substituted above).  Add garlic powder and oregano.  Simmer 10 minutes. Keep hot for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Slice bread lengthwise so that bottom is thicker than top.  Slice loaves crosswise into equal pieces to yield 100 portions.
STEP 6:
Dip 5 to 6 beef strips (2-3/4 oz) into hot gravy.  Place on bottom half of bread.
STEP 7:
Top beef with 8 to 10 pepper strips.
STEP 8:
Pour 1 tbsp hot gravy over peppers.  Cover with top half of bread.
STEP 9:
Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 26 lb 8 oz beef, oven roast will yield about 18 lb
cooked roast beef.
2.  In Step 3, 9 lb 12 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield about 8 lb peppers cut into ¼-inch by 2-inch strips.
3.  In Step 4, 3 oz Soup and gravy base, beef, combined with 3 qt water, may be used for Natural Pan Gravy.
4.  In Step 5, 100 French rolls (4 oz each) may be used.  Slice bread in half lengthwise, with bottom thicker than top.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup plus 1 Sandwich Bun

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook 18.75 lb beef in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Combine chopped onions, catsup, mustard, salt, brown sugar, vinegar,
and water.  Add to beef.
STEP 3:
Cover; simmer 35 minutes; stir occasionally to prevent scorching.
STEP 4:
Place ½ cup (1 No.8 scoop) hot mixture on bottom half bun.  Top with second half bun.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 5 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb chopped onion.
2.  In Step 2, 10 oz (3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3..  If desired, buns may be toasted to Step 4.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BARBECUED PORK SANDWICH (PORK BUTT):   In Step 1, omit ground beef.  Use 13 lb 8 oz cooked, chopped or finely diced pork butt (17 lb 4 oz pork butt A.P.) or ground pork.  In Step 2, use 3 lb 10 oz (9-2/3 cups) dry, chopped onions (4 lb 1 oz A.P.), 6 lb 12 oz (3 qt) catsup, 1-1/8 oz (5-2/3 tbsp) mustard, 1-1/8 oz (3 tbsp) brown sugar, 2 lb 4 oz (1-1/8 qt) water and 9 oz (1-1/8 cups) vinegar.  Omit salt.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.
2.  BARBECUED PORK SANDWICH (FROZEN BARBECUED PORK):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 16 lb  
8 oz thawed barbecued pork.  Heat according to manufacturer's directions.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
3.  TURKEY BARBECUE:  In Step 1, omit beef.  Use 20 lb thawed ground turkey.  Follow Steps 2 through 5.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: USDA Beef Patty w/VPP-Ckd f/Fzn COMM
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PROTION:  1 Hamburger
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:  
Grill 3-oz, tempered patties 3½ minutes or until browned; turn; grill on other side 3½ minutes.
STEP 2:
Serve hot on split buns.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, charbroiler may be used.  Follow manufacturer's directions for preparation.
2.  In Step 2, 1 recipe Sandwich Buns may be used.
3.  In Step 2, buns may be toasted.
4.  In Step 2, multigrain buns may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  DELUXE HAMBURGER:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use
3 lb fresh lettuce (3 lb 4 oz A.P.), 5 lb 9 oz sliced fresh tomatoes (5 lb 10 oz A.P.), 3 lb sliced dry onions (3 lb 5 oz A.P.), 3 lb 2 oz dill pickles, drained, sliced crosswise (4 lb 13 oz A.P.), 3 lb 12 oz (6¼ cups) catsup, 1 lb 3 oz (2-1/8 cups) mustard, prepared, and 100 sandwich buns.  Spread 1 tsp mustard on bottom bun and 1 tbsp catsup on top bun.  Add 2 slices onions, 1 lettuce leaf, 1 slice tomato, and 2 slices pickle on bottom bun.  Place grilled hamburger on bottom bun; cover with top bun.
2.  CHEESEBURGER:  Follow Step 1.  After patties are turned, use 5 lb 3 oz (100 slices) American cheese; place 1 slice cheese on each pattie.  Contine to grill until cheese melts.  Follow Step 2.
3.  CHEESY BACONBURGER:  Use 6 lb thawed raw sliced bacon; cut slices in half; cook bacon.  Follow directions for Variation 2.  Top melted cheese with 2 slices bacon.  Follow Step 2.
4.  DOUBLE DECKER CHEESEBURGER:  Prepare 2 recipes Variation 2.  Use 4 lb (1 gal) finely shredded lettuce (4 lb 5 oz A.P.) 3 lb 2 oz dill pickles, drained, sliced crosswise (4 lb 13 oz A.P.) and 12 oz (2¼ cups) finely chopped onions (13 oz A.P.). In Step 2, use 100 double-cut sandwich buns; 1 tbsp lettuce and 1 slice pickle on bottom and middle buns.  Place a cheeseburger on top of both bottom and middle slices of bun; place ½ tsp finely chopped onions on top of cheeseburger.  assemble layers; cover with top bun.
5.  CHILIBURGER:  Follow Step 1.  Use 6 lb 12 oz (One 6 lb 12 oz cn) canned chili con carne without beans.  Heat to boiling.  Follow Step 2.  Spread 1 oz (2tbsp or 1 Size-0 ladle) chili on each grilled hamburger.  Cover with top bun.
6.  DELUXE CHEESEBURGER:  Prepare 1 recipe Variation 2.  In Step 2, use 3 lb fresh lettuce (3 lb 4 oz A.P.), 5 lb 9 oz sliced fresh tomatoes (5 lb 10 oz A.P.), 3 lb sliced dry onions (3 lb 5 oz A.P.), 3 lb 2 oz dill pickles, drained, sliced crosswise (4 lb 13 oz A.P.), 3 lb 12 oz (6¼ cups) catsup, 1 lb 3 oz (2-1/8 cups) mustard, prepared, and 100 sandwich buns.  Spread 1 tsp mustard on bottom bun and 1 tbsp catsup on top bun.  Add 2 slices onion, 1 lettuce leaf,  1 slice tomato, and 2 slices pickle on bottom bun.  Place grilled cheeseburger on bottom bun; cover with top bun.
7.  PIZZABURGER:  Follow Step 1.  Use 5 lb 3 oz Mozzarella cheese and 9 lb 13 oz (1½ NO.10 cn) canned pizza sauce.  Heat sauce to boiling.  After patties are turned, place 1 slice cheese on each pattie.  Contine to grill until cheese melts.  Follow Step 2.  Spread 1½ oz (3 tbsp) pizza sauce on each hamburger.  Cover with top bun.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Thaw frankfurters.  Pierce each frankfurter; cover with 1-1/4 gallons water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain, leaving enough water to cover bottom of steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Keep hot until served.
STEP 3:
Serve hot on rolls.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, frankfurters maybe steamed 10 to 12 minutes at 5 lb pressure or 9 minutes at 15 lb pressure in a steam cooker.
2.  In Step 1, if Grill, Roller, Frankfurter, is used, set control to medium; place frankfurters on grill 30 minutes prior to serving time.  DO NOT HEAT frankfurters on low control setting.
3.  In Step 3, 12 lf 8 oz (200 slices) rye, pumpernickel or white bread may be used.  Slice frantfurters in half lengthwise to facilitate serving.
4.  If desired, rolls may be toasted in Step 3.

VARIATIONS:

1.  GRILLED POLISH SAUSAGE SANDWICH:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 18 lb 12 oz Polish sausage, thawed.  Cut into 3 oz pieces, then in half lengthwise.  Grill on 375°F. griddle until thoroughly cooked and browned.  Turn frequently to ensure even browning.  In Step 3, place 2 pieces sausage in each roll.
2.  SIMMERED KNOCKWURST ON ROLL:  In Step 1, use 18 lb 12 oz (100 each) knockwurst.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, place 1 sausage on each roll..
3.  SIMMERED QUARTER POUND FRANKFURTER:  In Step 1, use 25 lb (100 4-oz each) quarter pound frankfurters.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 100 submarine of French rolls.
4.  GRILLED FRANKFURTER ON ROLL:  Omit steps 1 and 2.  Grill frankfurters slowly on greased 350°F. griddle, turning frequently, until thoroughly heated and browned.  Follow Step 3.
5.  GRILLED FRANKFURTER WITH FRIED PEPPERS AND ONIONS:  Omit Steps  1 and 2.  Saute' 1 lb 12 oz (9½ cups) peppers, sweet, fresh (2 lb 2 oz A.P.), cut into strips and 4 lb 8 oz (4½ qt) sliced onions (5 lb A.P.)  on a lightly greased 350°F. griddle until tender.  Sprinkle with 1 tsp black pepper and 1½ tsp dehydrated garlic.  Grill frankfurters slowly on greased 350°F. griddle, turning frequently, until thoroughly heated and browned.  In Step 3, top with 1 tbsp peppers and 1 tbsp onions.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine beverage base and sugar.
STEP 2:
Add cold water.  Stir until dissolved.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, other flavors (orange, lemonade, grape, cherry, lemon-lime, strawberry) may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 3 gal (12 lb) ice, crushed or cubed and 5¼ gal water may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare 3 recipes Thousand Island Dressing.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Prepare sliced bacon.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Slice ham and turkey into thin slices, about 16 per pound.
STEP 4:
Place lettuce leaf, 2 thinly sliced, slices tomato, 1 slice ham, 1 slice turkey, 2 slices egg (hard cooked), and 2 strips bacon on 1 slice of rye or pumpernickel bread.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 6:
Just before serving, pour about ¼ cup (1 Size-1 ladle) Thousand Island Dressing on top.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1½ gal prepared ready-to-use Thousand Island dressing may be used.
2.  In Step 3, 7 lb 8 oz canned ham will yield about 6 lb 4 oz cooked ham.
3.  In Step 3, 9 lb 6 oz boneless frozen, raw turkey may be used.  Cook.
4.  In Step 4, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce; 11 lb 6 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 11 lb 2 oz (200 slices) sliced tomatoes.
5.  In Step 4, other types of bread may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Fry frozen, breaded fish portions in deep fat about 3 minutes or until lightly browned. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 2:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
STEP 3:
Prepare ½ recipe Tartar Sauce.
STEP 4:
Place 1 fish portion on bottom half of bun.  Spread 1 tbsp tartar sauce on top half of bun.  Cover with top half of bun.
STEP 5:
Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, DO NOT over cook or over brown.  Portions will rise to the surface when done.
2. In Step 4, 4 lb fresh trimmed lettuce (4 lb 5 oz A.P.) and 11 lb 2 oz (200 slices) fresh tomatoes (11 lb 6 oz A.P.) may be added.
3.  In Step 4, multigrain buns may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHEESE FISHWICH:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 2 lb 1 oz (50 slices) American cheese.  Cut slices in half.  Place ½ slice cheese on bottom half of bun.  Follow Step 5.
2.  FISHWICH (OVEN METHOD):  In Step 1, use 4 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Place fish on well greased pans.  Brush fish with 1 lb (2 cups) melted butter or margarine.  Bake in 375°F. oven 35 minutes or until lightly browned.  Omit Step 2.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.
3.  FISHWICH (BATTER DIPPED FISH PORTIONS):  In Step 1, use 18 lb 12 oz batter dipped fish portions.  Fry about 3 to 5 minutes or until golden brown.  Follow Step 2 through 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook thawed turkey.  Cool.
STEP 2:
Slice turkey into thin slices, 16 to 22 per pound.
STEP 3:
Place 3 to 4 slices turkey on 1 slice of bread; top with second slice of bread.
STEP 4:
Prepare 1½ recipes (3-3/8 gal) Chicken or Turkey Gravy. Pour about ½ cup (1 Size-2 ladle) hot gravy over sandwich.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
2.  In Step 3, other types of bread may be used.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Corn Dog
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Insert 1 wood stirring stick lengthwise into each thawed frankfurter.  Dry surface of each frankfurter with paper towel.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, sugar, mustand flour and dry milk.
STEP 3:
Add water, eggs (1-1/8 cups is 6 eggs) and salad oil or melted shortening to dry ingredients.  Blend well.
STEP 4:
Dip frankfurters in cornmeal batter; allow excess batter to drain slightly; fry in deep fat 2 to 4 minutes or until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 5:
Drain on absorbent paper.
STEP 6:
Serve hot.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CORN DOG (CORN BREAD MIX):  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Combine 5 lb 10 oz (1¼ No.10 cn) canned Corn Bread Mix and 1½ oz (½ cup) mustard flour.  Prepare corn bread batter according to instructions on container.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.
2.  CORN DOG (FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 18 lb 12 oz frozen corn dogs.  Follow manufacturer's directions for cooking.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Calumet Double Acting Baking Powder KFT

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Beef Round Eye Roast All Ln 1/8"Tr-Rstd
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Slice beef into thin slices, 16 to 22 per pound.
STEP 2:
Place 3 to 4 slices beef on 1 slice of bread; top with second slice of bread.
STEP 3:
Prepare 2 recipes Brown Gravy.  Pour about ½ cup (4 oz or 1 Size-2 ladle) hot gravy over each sandwich.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 28 lb beef, oven roast, will yield about 18 lb 12 oz cooked beef.  Cook.
2.  In Step 2, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
3.  In Step 3, sandwich may be served as open faced sandwich.

VARIATIONS:

1.  HOT ROAST BEEF SANDWICH (POT ROAST):     In Step 1, 18 lb 12 oz beef, pot roast, cooked, may be used (28 lb pot roast, will yield about 18 lb 12 oz cooked beef).  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  HOT ROAST BEEF SANDWICH (PRECOOKED ROAST BEEF):  In Step 1, use 18 lb 12 oz thawed precooked roast beef.  Slice into thin slices, 16 to 22 per pound.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Slice pork into thin slices, 16 to 22 slices per pound.
STEP 2:
Place 3 to 4 slices pork on 1 slice of bread.  Top with second slice of bread.
STEP 3:
Prepare 2 recipes Brown Gravy using pork drippings.  Pour about ½ cup (1 Size-2 ladle) hot gravy over each sandwich.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 29 lb 4 oz pork loin, boned, will yield about 18 lb 12 oz cooked pork. Cook.
2.  In Step 2, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
3.  In Step 3, sandwich may be served as open faced sandwich.

VARIATION:

1.  HOT ROAST PORK SANDWICH (FRESH HAM):  In Step 1, 18 lb 12 oz cooked fresh ham may be used for pork (30 lb 12 oz pork, ham, boneless, will yield about 18 lb 12 oz cooked fresh ham).  Cook.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Slice ham into 1 oz slices.  Grill until lightly browned.
STEP 2:
Break 1 egg at a time into small bowl; beat individual portion thoroughly; pour onto griddle; cook until almost firm; place 1 slice hot ham on top of egg.
STEP 3:
Place 1 slice cheese on top of ham.  Continue to cook until cheese melts.
STEP 4:
Serve hot on buns.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 6 lb 4 oz ham, boneless, cooked, frozen, may be used.  Thaw ham.
2.  In Step 3, 5 lb 3 oz cheese food, American, sliced may be used.
3.  In Step 4, buns may be toasted.
4.  In Step 4, multigrain buns may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  GRILLED BACON, EGG, AND CHEESE SANDWICH:  In Step 1, omit ham.  Use 12 lb (200 slices) bacon; grill.  Place 2 slices bacon on top of each egg.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.
2.  GRILLED HAM AND EGG SANDWICH:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Cook until egg is set.  Follow Step 4.
3.  GRILLED SAUSAGE, EGG, AND CHEESE SANDWICH:
In Step 1, omit ham.  Use 18 lb 12 oz (100 3-oz) preformed sausage patties; grill.  Place 1 sausage pattie on top of each egg.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: LowFat Plain Yogurt w/12gProtein Per Cup
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Pita Pocket and
                              ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Yogurt Topping
                              2/3 Cup (5½ Ounces) Meat Mixture

METHOD:  

STEP 1: (Topping)
Combine yogurt and parsley.  Refrigerate for use in Step 5.
STEP 2: (Meat Mixture)
Cook 12 lb beef (pattie mix, bulk or ground beef, thawed) in its own fat until it loses its pink color, stirring beef to break apart.  Drain or skim off fat.
STEP 3:
Add tomatoes, 4 lb 7 oz or 2½ qt barley, onions, green peppers, chili powder, salt, crushed oregano, garlic powder, ground cumin, black pepper and 3½ qt hot water.  Cover; simmer 40 to 45 minutes or until barley is tender and most of liquid is absorbed.
STEP 4:
Stir in raisins.  Simmer 5 minutes (See Note 4.)
STEP 5:
Cut 50 - 8-inch diameter pita bread in halves to make 2 pockets.  Place about 5½ oz (2/3 cup or 1 No.6. scoop) meat mixture in each pocket.  Top with 2 oz (¼ cup) yogurt topping just before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 6-2/3 oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 6-1/3 oz chopped parsley.
2.  In Step 2, 4 lb fresh green peppers A.P. will yield 3 lb 5 oz chopped peppers.
3.  In Step 2, 3 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb 5 oz chopped onions.
4.  In Step 2, 6-2/3 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  In Step 4, meat mixture is done when all moisture has been absorbed and produce holds together.
6.  In Step 5, yogurt topping may be placed on serving line for self service.
7.  In Step 5, 1 No.16 scoop may b

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Spread 1 slice of bread with Salad Dressing (optional).
STEP 2:
Add 2 slices cheese (American or Swiss).  Top with lettuce, 2 slices thinly sliced tomato (optional), thinly sliced onions (optional), and 1 tbsp alfalfa sprouts (optional) and second slice bread.
STEP 3:
Cut each sandwich in half; serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.
GUIDELINES FOR SANDWICH PREPARATION:
Sandwiches may be served hot or cold, closed or open-faced. Variation in the bread and rolls will provide variety in flavor, texture, size, and shape.  Enriched white, rye, whole wheat, pumpernickel, French, raisin, and Italian breads, plus hot dog, hamburger, soft and hard rolls, English muffins, and pita bread can be used in sandwiches.  Bread with a relatively firm texture makes good sandwiches for eating out-of-hand without bending or losing filling.
PRE-PREPARATION:
1.  Have sandwich counter, tools, and equipment clean and sanitary.
2.  Following recipe card, have all ingredients ready to use:
-  Wash lettuce thoroughly; core, separate leaves, drain and   crisp.
-  Evenly slice foods such as tomatoes, cheese, and meats.    Cross-stack slided ingredients such as cheese and meat for    quick and easy pickup.
-  Prepare mixed sandwich fillings.
3.  Allow plenty of space to work.
4.  Assemble all equipment and ingredients in advance, and place within easy reach toward back of work space.
5.  Arrange ingredients in the order to be used.

2:  In Step 1, 13 lb 8 oz round top sliced bread may be used for sandwich sliced bread.
3.  Other types of bread may be used.
4.  In Step 2:  
-  4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
-  11 lb 6 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 11 lb 2 oz thinly        sliced tomatoes.
-  1 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb thinly sliced onions.
5.  In Step 2, sliced tomatoes, alfalfa sprouts and onions may be placed in containers for self service.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook 16 lb beef (pattie mix, bulk or ground beef, thawed) in its own fat in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle flour over cooked beef.  Stir well.  Cook about 5 minutes or until flour is absorbed, stirring occasionally.
STEP 3:
Combine hot water, tomato paste, chili powder, ground cumin, salt and red pepper; mix well.  Bring to a boil; simmer 2 to 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
STEP 4:
Combine sauce with beef mixture; mix well; simmer 2 to 3 minutes.
STEP 5:
On bottom half of bun, place ½ slice cheese, 1/3 cup (1 No.12 scoop) meat mixture and 2½ tbsp lettuce.  Cover with top half of bun.  Serve hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 1 lb 8 oz (2/3 - 36-oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
2.  In Step 5, 2 lb 9 oz cheese food, American, sliced may be used.
3.  In Step 5, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb shredded lettuce.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pierce each thawed frankfurter; cover with 1-1/4 gallons water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain, leaving enough water to cover bottom of steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Keep hot until served.
STEP 3:
Thoroughly heat chili.
STEP 4:
Place frankfurter in roll.
STEP 5:
Place 1 oz (1 Size-0) ladle hot chili over each frankfurter.
STEP 6:
Place 2 tbsp cheese and ½ tsp onions on top of chili.
STEP 7:
Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, frankfurters may be steamed 10 to 12 minutes at 5 lb pressure or 9 minutes at 15 lb pressure in a steam cooker.
2.  In Step 1, if Grill, Roller, Frankfurter, is used, set control to medium; place frankfurters on grill 30 minutes prior to serving time.  DO NOT HEAT frankfurters on low contol setting.
3.  In Step 6, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHILI DOG (CANNED CHILI CON CARNE):  Follow Steps 1 though 5.  Omit Step 6.  Follow Step 7.
2.  CHILI DOG:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, prepare 1/8 recipe Chili.  Follow Steps 4 through 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Pita (6 Ounces) with
                               2 Tablespoons Salsa (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Keep salsa refrigerated for use in Step 8.
STEP 2:
Cut beef into ¼-inch thin slices; cut slices into ¼-inch strips, 2 to 3 inches long.
STEP 3:
Pour lemon juice over beef.
STEP 4:
Combine salt, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, ground cumin, and red pepper; sprinkle over beef; mix thoroughly; cover; marinate in refrigerator 1 hour.
STEP 5:
Saute' onions and peppers in 1/2 cup salad oil, olive oil or melted shortening in steam jacketed kettle or stock pot about 8 to 10 minutes or until onions are almost transparent.  Keep hot for use in Step 7.
STEP 6:
Brown beef strips, turning frequently, 1 to 2 minutes on lightly greased griddle.  See Note 5.
STEP 7:  Cut each 8-in diameter pita in half.  Place 2¼ oz (6-10) beef strips and 1¼ oz (3 tbsp) onions and sweet peppers in each pita half.
STEP 8:
Serve with Salsa.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 recipe Taco Sauce may be used for Salsa.
2.  In Step 1, 1 recipe Salsa (Taco Sauce Variation 1) may be used; or 8 lb 6 oz (3½ qt) Picante sauce may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 1 lb 8 oz fresh lemons (6 lemons A.P.) will yield 1 cup lemon juice.
4.  In Step 5, 5 lb 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb onion strips; 6 lb 1 oz sweet peppers A.P. will yield 5 lb sweet pepper strips.
5.  In Step 6, brown beef strips in batches of no more than 25 portions.
6.  In Step 8, Salsa may be placed on serving line for self service.
7.  In Step 8, pitas may be served with guacamole.  Prepare 1 recipe Guacomole.  EACH PORTION:  2 Tbsp (1 Ounce).

VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN FAJITA PITA:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 18 lb 12 oz (100 3-oz) precooked unbreaded chicken fillets.  Cut into 2 to 3 inch strips by 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick.  In Step 3, use 10 oz (1¼ cups) lemon juice (2 lb - 8 lemons A.P.).  In Step 4, use 2-1/3 oz (3-2/3 tbsp) salt, 2 oz (6-1/3 tbsp) garlic powder, 7/8 oz (3-2/3 tbsp) onion powder, 2/3 oz (2-2/3 tbsp) black pepper, 1/3 oz (1-1/3 tbsp) ground cumin, 1/6 oz (2½ tsp) ground red pepper.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, brown chicken strips.  Follow remainder Step 7.  Follow Step 8.
RecipeItem/10/_ItemName: Fresh Sliced Sweet Green Bell Peppers

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Sandwich (1 Pita Pocket Half)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare 1 recipe Yogurt-Cucumber Sauce.  Refrigerate for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Separate onion slices into rings.  Set garnishes aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Place 25 fillets (unbreaded, precooked, tempered) on each lightly greased sheet pan (4 pans).  Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
STEP 4:
Cut pita bread in half forming 2 pockets.  Place on 3 sheet pans.  Bake 10 minutes or until warm and pliable.
STEP 5:
Place 1 fillet in each pita pocket.  
STEP 6:
Garnish with about 3 tbsp yogurt-cucumber sauce, 4 to 6 onion rings, ¼ cups shredded lettuce and 1 slice tomato.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 9 lb 12 oz (4-3/4 qt) prepared Tzatziki (Cucumber) Sauce may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz onions, dry A.P. will yield 2 lb thinly sliced onions; 4 lb 5 oz lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb shredded lettuce; 5 lb 13 oz tomatoes A.P. will yield 5 lb 11 oz sliced tomatoes.
3.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 375°F. 9 to 11 minutes or until thoroughly heated on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 4, bake at 325°F. 5 minutes or until warm and pliable on high fan, closed vent.
4.  In Step 3, fillets may be grilled on a 350°F. lightly greased griddle 6 minutes on each side or until thoroughly heated.
5.  In Steps 3 and 4, batch preparation should be used.
6.  In Step 6, sauce and garnishes may be placed on serving line for self service.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Fresh Red Tomatoes YrRndAvg Med Slc-1/4"

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 7 gal water to make stock.
STEP 2:
Add carrots (optional), celery (optional), onions (optional), bay leaves and pepper.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer about 30 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add rice.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until rice is tender.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2: 1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped carrots.  1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery. 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 3, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BEEF BARLEY SOUP:      Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 3 lb (1½ qt) barley.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 20 minutes or until barley is tender.
2.  BEEF NOODLE SOUP:    Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 1 lb spaghetti, vermicelli, or egg noodles.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until noodles are tender.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 7½ gal water to make stock.
STEP 2:
Add celery (optional), onions (optional), carrots (optional), 2 bay leaves and pepper.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add rice.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until rice is tender.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped carrots.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 1 lb spaghetti, vermicelli or egg noodles.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until noodles are tender.  Remove bay leaves.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1: 
Saute' onions and peppers in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 5 minutes in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 6 gal water to make stock.
STEP 3:
Add stock to sauteed peppers and onions.  Add pepper, spaghetti (2-inch pieces) and tomato paste.  Stir; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions and 5½ oz (1 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 1 lb 8 oz vermicelli may be used for spaghetti.
4.  In Step 3, 2 lb 13 oz (1¼ - 36-oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6½ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until lightly browned.
STEP 2:
Blend flour and pepper with onions.  Blend well.  Add Soup and Gravy base and water; stir well.  Simmer 15 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 16 lb 10 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 15 lb thinly sliced onions.
2   In Step 1, 1 lb 14 oz (2½ qt) dehydrated onions may be used..
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  FRENCH ONION SOUP:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add
¼ cup Worcestershire sauce.  Prepare 1 recipe Parmesan Croutons.  Place 8 croutons in each soup bowl; pour soup over croutons just before serving.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine 4 lb chopped celery, 4 lb chopped onions and 2 gallons boiling water.  Simmer 30 minutes; strain; discard vegetables; reserve broth for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 3:
Combine vegetable broth, stock, tomato juice and pepper.  Heat to serving temperature.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped celery; 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2½ - 36-oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate and 7½ qt water may be used for tomato juice.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
5.  May be served with croutons.  Prepare ½ recipe Croutons.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION (1 Cup 8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions and celery in salad oil, melted shortening, or olive oil 5 minutes in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Stir frequently.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.  Add stock to sauteed onions and celery.
STEP 3:
Add 3 bay leaves, pepper and sugar.  Stir.
STEP 4:
Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 5:
Add tomatoes, mix well.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minute.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; and  2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3..  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  TOMATO RICE SOUP:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add an additional 2 lb (1qt) boiling water.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, add 1 lb 8 oz (3½ cups) long grain rice.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender.  Follow Step 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' gralic and onions in salad oil, shortening or olive oil until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 4½ gal boiling water to make stock.
STEP 3:
Add carrots and celery.  Bring to a boil. Cover; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed garlic and onions, peppers, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, and pepper;  bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 oz (1-1/3 tbsp - 4 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.  Fry with onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
3.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 2 lb 7 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped carrots; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
5.  In Step 4, 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped peppers; 3 lb 10 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 3 lb diced potatoes; 2 lb 8 oz fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped cabbage.
6.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION

1.  MINESTRONE SOUP:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, decrease stock to 4 gal.  In Step 4, decrease potatoes to 2 lb (1½ qt - 2 lb 8 oz A.P.) and tomatoes to 6 lb 6 oz (3 qt - 1 No.10 cn).  Add 2 lb 1 oz (1 qt - 1/3 No.10 cn) canned, drained, green beans, 3 lb 7 oz (1½ qt - ½ No.10 cn) canned, drained, kidney beans, and 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) maca

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (7½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash thoroughly in cold water.  
STEP 2:
Cover with 2 gal cold water; bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes.  Turn off heat.  Cover; let stand 1 hour.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 4:
Add beans to stock; bring to a boil; cover; simmer 2 hours or until beans are tender.
STEP 5:
Add shredded carrots, chopped onions and pepper to bean mixture.  Simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 6:
Blend flour and water to form a smooth paste.  Stir into soup; cook 10 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 5, 1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb shredded carrots; 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 5, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BEAN SOUP WITH SMOKED, CURED HAM HOCKS:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Place 2 lb 8 oz thawed, smoked, cured pork hocks in water to cover.  Simmer 1 hour; remove from heat; cool.  Remove lean meat; chop into small pieces.  In Step 5, add chopped ham hocks.  Follow Step 6.
2.  KINCKERBOCKER SOUP (BEAN, TOMATO, AND BACON):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, reduce water to 3¼ gal.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, lightly brown 1 lb (3 cups) chopped raw bacon.  Add carrots, onions, pepper and 5 lb (3-3/4 qt) diced, fresh, white potatoes (6 lb 2 oz A.P.).  Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally; add to bean mixture.  Add 
6 lb 6 oz (1 - No.10 cn) canned, crushed tomatoes; simmer 25 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Omit Step 6.
3.  OLD FASHIONED BEAN SOUP:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, reduce water to 4¼ gal.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, add 6 lb 6 oz (1 No.10 cn) canned, crushed tomatoes.  Follow Step 6.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (Approx. 6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place soup in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Add water to soup.  Mix well.
STEP 3:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:

One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BEAN WITH BACON SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed bean with bacon soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  BEEF NOODLE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed beef noodle soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
3.  CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed chicken noodle soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
4.  CHICKEN WITH RICE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed chicken with rice soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
5.  MANHATTAN CLAM CHOWDER (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed Manhattan Clam Chowder.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
6.  MINESTONE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed minestrone soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
7.  SPLIT PEA SOUP WITH HAM (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed split pea soup with ham.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
8.  TOMATO SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned tomato soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
9.  VEGETABLE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed vegetable soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
10.  VEGETABLE WITH BEEF SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use, 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed vegetable with beef soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 2:
Blend flour with onion-fat mixture to form a roux using wire whip; add garlic powder.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 4½ gal boiling water to make stock.  Add stock to roux, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.
STEP 4:
Add tomatoes, celery, okra, peppers, rice, 5 bay leaves,
paprika, pepper, and thyme; mix well.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped peppers.
4.  In Step 4, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb 8 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  SHRIMP GUMBO:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 27 minutes.  Add 3 lb raw, peeled, deveined shrimp cut into quarters.  Cook an additional 2 to 3 minutes.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook chopped bacon.  Drain.  Set bacon aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Saute' celery, onions, and peppers in salad oil 3 minutes or until tender.
STEP 3:
Add water, potatoes, salt, pepper and bacon to steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Add sauteed vegetables. Mix thoroughly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
STEP 4:
Add corn.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes; stirring occasionally.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1½ gal warm water.  Add milk and butter or margarine to mixture.  Heat slowing to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 11 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped celery; 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; and 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and 1¼ oz (1 cup) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 4 lb 5 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 4 lb diced potatoes.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN CORN CHOWDER:  Omit Steps 1 through 5.  Combine 25 lb (8 No.3 cyl cn) Soup, condensed, Cream of Chicken and 17 lb 8 oz (8-3/4 qt) water; mix well.  Add 19 lb 14 oz (3 No.10 cn) canned, whole kernel corn, drained, and
1/8 oz (1½ tsp) black pepper.  Heat slowly to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTIONS:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook bacon until crisp.  Remove bacon; drain; reserve ½ cup bacon fat for use in Step 2.  Finely chop bacon.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions and celery in bacon fat about 7 minutes or until tender crisp.
STEP 3: 
Drain clams.  Reserve clam liquid for use in Step 4 and clams for use in Step 8.
STEP 4:
Combine bacon, sauteed vegetables, tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, salt, pepper, thyme, Worcestershire sauce, 2 bay leaves, catsup, water with reserved clam liquid (clam liquid plus water to make 2¼ gallons).  
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 6:
Blend flour and 1 qt cold water to form a smooth paste.  Stir into chowder.
STEP 7:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 8:
Add clams; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer until clams are
hot.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, (2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 2, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 1 lb 13 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz diced carrots; 6 lb 2 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 5 lb diced potatoes.
4.  In Step 4, 1 lb 2 oz (½ No.10 cn) dehydrated diced potatoes or 1 lb 1 oz (3/4 gal) dehydrated sliced potatoes may be used.  Increase water and clam liquid to 2-3/4 gal.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
RecipeItem/14/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook bacon until crisp.  Drain; finely chop and set aside for use in Step 6.  Reserve 1/3 cup bacon fat for use in Step 2.
STEP 2:
Saute onions and celery in bacon fat about 7 minutes or until tender crisp.
STEP 3:
Add potatoes and 2 gal water to onion-celery mixture; cook about 10 minutes or until potatoes are almost tender but still firm.
STEP 4:
Blend butter or margarine and flour to form a roux; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2-3/4 gal warm water; add to potato mixture.  Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 6:
Add roux and cooked bacon to milk and potato mixture.  Cook about 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 7:
Add fish fillets (skinless, cut in 2-inch pieces), pepper, thyme, parsley, and salt.  Simmer 10 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz dry onins A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery will yield 1 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 2, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated chopped onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 8 lb 10 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 7 lb diced potatoes.  
4.  In Step 3, 1 lb 11 oz (3/4 No.10 cn) dehydrated diced potatoes or 1 lb 8 oz (1 gal) dehydrated sliced potatoes may be used.  Increase water to 3½ gal.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  NEW ENGLAND CLAM CHOWDER:    Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, drain 12 lb (four, 49 to 51 oz cn) canned, minced clams; add water to drained clam liquid to make 2 gal. Combine with potato mixture; reserve drained clams for use in Step 7.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.  In Step 7, omit fish; add clams; reduce salt to 1 oz (1-2/3 tbsp).
RecipeItem/7/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain and chop mushrooms.  Reserve liquid for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions and mushrooms in butter or margarine until onions are tender.  Remove from fat.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Blend fat, flour, and pepper to form a roux.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with reserved mushroom liquid and enough hot water to make 4 gal.  Gradually blend hot stock mixture into roux stirring constantly until smooth.
STEP 5:
Add mushroom-onion mixture.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes,
STEP 6:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1-3/4 gal warm water.  Add to soup.
STEP 7:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 14 No.8Z cn canned mushrooms may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 13 oz dry onions will yield 12 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 2, 1½ oz (½ cup) dehydrated onions may be  used.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP:  Omit Step 1.  Use 10 lb frozen broccoli.  Thaw; chop.  Set aside for use in Step 5.  In Step 2, use 1 lb 6 oz (2-3/4 cups) butter or margarine.  DO NOT REMOVE onions from fat.  In Step 3, use 1 lb 12 oz (1-3/4 qt) general purpose flour, sifted and 1 tbsp black pepper.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, add broccoli.  In Step 6, use 2 lb 7 oz (2¼ qt) nonfat dry milk and 1½ gal water.  Follow Step 7.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
RecipeItem/5/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine potatoes, onions, warm water, pepper and Soup and Gravy base.  Bring to a boil.  Simmer 1 hour or until potatoes are mushy.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2 gal warm water.
STEP 3:
Stir milk into soup.  Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE: 

1.  In Step 1, 3 lb (2¼ qt) dry chopped onions (3 lb 5 oz A.P.) may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 5 lb (1 gal - 2¼ No.10 cn) potatoes, white, dehydrated, diced, may be used.
3.  In Step 2, ½ cup dehydrated parsley may be added.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  CREAM OF POTATO SOUP (POTATOES, WHITE, FRESH):  In Step 1, 23 lb 13 oz (4½ gal) potatoes, white, fresh, diced (29 lb 5 oz A.P.) may be used for dehydrated sliced potatoes; decrease water to 3-3/4 gal; follow remainder of Step 1.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
_description: Soup, cream of potato, f/dehyd slices
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook chopped bacon.  Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until onions are tender.
STEP 3:
Add pepper, dill weed (optional) and bacon; mix well.
STEP 4:
Add water; bring to a boil.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk and Soup and Gravy base with 2-3/4 gal warm water; add to bacon mixture.  Bring to a simmer.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 6:
Stir potatoes rapidly into hot liquid.  Mix until smooth.
STEP 7:
Simmer 5 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 4, ½ cup dehydrated parsley may be added.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
_description: Soup, cream of potato, f/inst potatoes
RecipeItem/7/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Italian Pork Sausage Link Ckd-5 Per lb
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Stir soup mix into 4½ gal boiling water.
STEP 2:
Cook chopped sausage until thoroughly browned.  Drain well.
STEP 3:
Mix peppers, tomatoes, 2 bay leaves and sausage.  Add to soup mixture.
STEP 4:
Return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 20 minutes.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 10 oz fresh peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 1¼ oz (1 cup) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz frozen, diced green peppers may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  ONION SOUP:  In Step 1, increase water to 50 lb (6¼ gal). Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Simmer 20 minutes.
2.  MEXICAN ONION CORN SOUP:  Follow Step 1; increase water to 42 lb (5¼ gal).  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Use 13 lb 4 oz (two No.10 cn) canned whole kernel corn.  Drain; add corn to soup mixture.  Add 14 oz (two 7-oz can of ½ No.2½ cn) canned chopped pimientos and 1/3 oz (2¼ tsp) hot sauce.  Stir.  Simmer 20 minutes.
_description: Soup, Spanish, f/dehyd onion soup mix

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Stir 4 lb dehydrated VegTomato Soup w/noodles soup mix into  6-1/4 gallons boiling water.
STEP 2:
Return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender stirring occasionally.

NOTE:   One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BEEF-NOODLE SOUP WITH VEGETABLES (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 3 lb 9 oz (3 No.2½ cn) dehydrated beef-noodle with vegetables soup.  Follow Step 2.
2.  CHICKEN-NOODLE SOUP (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 4 lb 12 oz (4 No.2½ cn) dehydrated chicken-noodle soup. Increase water to 6½ gal.  In Step 2, return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 7 minutes.
3.  CHICKEN-NOODLE VEGETABLE SOUP (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 4 lb 12 oz (4 No.2½ cn) dehydrated chicken-noodle soup.  Increase water to 6½ gal.  Add 5 lb frozen mixed vegetables.  In Step 2, return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 7 minutes or until vegetables are tender.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' vegetables in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes.  DO NOT brown.  Remove vegetables from fat; set fat aside for use in Step 3; vegetables for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base (beef or chicken) with 5 gal boiling water to make stock.
STEP 3:
Blend fat and flour to form a roux; stir until smooth.  Add roux to stock, stirring constantly.  Cook until blended.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed vegetables, potatoes and pepper.  Cook about 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1½ qt warm water.  
STEP 6:
Just before serving, remove soup from heat; slowly add milk, stirring constantly.
STEP 7:
Add pimientos.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1: 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions.  1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped peppers. 2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz sliced celery.
2.  In Step 1, 1 oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions and 3 oz (2¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers;  or 1 lb 2 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 7 lb 3 oz fresh potatoes A.P. will yield 6 lb chopped potatoes.
4.  In Step 4, 6 lb frozen diced potatoes may be used.
5.  in Step 7, One 7-oz cn canned, drained pimientos may be used.
6.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions and peppers in butter or margarine until tender. Remove from fat; set aside for use in Step 4.  Reserve fat for use in Step 2.
STEP 2:
Blend fat and flour to form a roux.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.  Add roux to stock, stirring constantly.  Cook until blended.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed onions and peppers, tomatoes, carrots, celery, apples, curry powder, cloves and pepper.
STEP 5:
Simmer 45 minutes or until vegetables are tender.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 11 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 6 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions and 3-3/4 oz (3 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb 6 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 4:
-  1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb diced carrots.
-  1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery.
-  1 lb 15 oz fresh cooking apples A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz       sliced or diced cooking apples.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain beans.
STEP 2:
Combine beans, 3¼ gal  water (2-3/4 gal used above for nutritional analysis), tomatoes, onions, celery, Soup and Gravy base, pepper, paprika, thyme, and 6 bay leaves in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; stir well.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 45 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
2.  In  Step 2, 6 oz (1-3/4 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb thinly sliced celery.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  ZESTY BEAN SOUP (DRY BEANS):  Omit Step 1.  Use 2 lb (4½ cups) dry kidney beans, 2 lb (4½ cups) dry white beans and 2 lb (4½ cups) dry pinto beans.  Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foregin matter.  Wash thoroughly in cold water.  Cover with 16 lb (2 gal) cold water in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes.  Turn off heat.  Cover; let stand 1 hour. In Step 2, increase water to 30 lb (3-3/4 gal); add Soup and Gravy base and bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; cover; simmer 3 hours or until beans are tender.  Stir occasionally.  Add tomatoes, onions, celery, pepper, paprika, and thyme; stir well.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 45 minutes.  Remove bay leaves.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Cream Of Chicken Soup Cond Canned-Svg
RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Cmrcl Crm Of Mushrm Soup Cond-10.75ozCan
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (approx 6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add soups to steam-jackted kettle or stock pot; mix well.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with water; stir into soup.
STEP 3:
Add 3/4 tsp nutmeg (optional); mix well.
STEP 4:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  DOUBLEY GOOD CHICKEN SOUP (CANNED):      In Step 1, omit mushroom soup.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed chicken and rice soup.  In Step 2, reduce nonfat dry milk to 8-3/4 oz (2 cups).  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  LOGGING SOUP (CANNED):  Omit Step 1.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed bean with bacon soup and 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed vegetable beef soup.  Mix well.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Add 22 lb (2-3/4 gal) water.  Mix well.  Follow Step 4.
