3.  TOMATO NOODLE SOUP (CANNED):  Omit Step 1.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup and 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed beef noodle soup.  Mix well.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Add 22 lb (2-3/4 gal) water.  Mix well.  Follow Step 4.
4.  VEGETABLE BEEF SUPREME SOUP (CANNED)  Omit Step 1.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed vegetable with beef soup and 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Add 22 lb (2-3/4 gal) water.  Mix well.  Add 1/6 oz (2½ tsp) ground ginger (optional).  Mix well.  Follow Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pick over peas, removing any foreign matter.  Wash thoroughly in cold water.
STEP 2:
Cover peas with 3 gal cold water.  Bring to a boil.
STEP 3:
Add Soup and Gravy base, 4 gal boiling water, ham (optional), onions, carrots, 4 bay leaves, sugar and pepper to peas.
STEP 4:
Bring soup mixture to a boil; reduce heat; simmer about 2½ hours or until peas are mushy.  Remove bay leaves.
STEP 5:
Whip until mixture is smooth.  Add boiling water, if needed, for a thinner consistency.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, peas may be cooked 2 minutes, removed from heat, covered and allowed to stand 1 hour.  In Step 4, cook 1½ hours.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb 13 oz (one 29-oz cn) canned ham chunks , drained may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb minced onions; 1 lb 6 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb 2 oz grated carrots.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  PUREE MONGOLE (SOUP, CONDENSED, TOMATO):  Prepare ½ recipe Split Pea Soup.  Blend with 12 lb 8 oz (4 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup and 14 lb (1-3/4 gal) water.  Heat to a simmer.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Campbell's Cond. Cream Broccoli Soup CAM
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (approx. 6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 cup (8 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place soup in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with water.  Stir into soup.
STEP 3:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CREAM OF CHICKEN SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed cream of chicken soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  CREAM OF MUSHROOM SOUP (CANNED);  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed cream of mushroom soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x4-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook bacon.  Drain.  Finely chop.
STEP 2:
Combine onions, beans, catsup, sugar, mustard, and bacon.  Mix well.
STEP 3:
Pour about 7-3/4 qt bean mixture into each pan.
STEP 4:
Bake, uncovered, 1½ to 2 hours or until browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 15 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 12 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 3-1/3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 30 lb 15 oz (12-1/3 No.2½ cn) canned white beans with pork in tomato sauce may be used.
4.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 1½ hours on high fan, open vent.
5.  In Step 5, if microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 375°F. 1 hour with 100% microwave power throughout.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
7.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED BEANS (KIDNEY BEANS, CANNED):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 27 lb 8 oz (4 No.10 cn) canned kidney beans.  Increase catsup to 1 lb 7 oz (2-1/3 cups); packed brown sugar to 1 lb 12 oz (3-3/4 cups).  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  BAKED BEANS (PINO BEANS, CANNED):  Follow Step 1. In Step 2, use 28 lb (28 No.300 or 303 cn) canned pinto beans.  Increase catsup to 1 lb 7 oz (2-1/3 cups); packed brown sugar to 1 lb 12 oz (3-3/4 cups).  Follow Steps 3 and 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pick over beans (kidney, pinto or white), removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with water (approximately 5 1/2 gallons);  bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Bring beans to a boil; add more water if necessary to keep beans covered.  Simmer 1½ hours or until tender (not mushy).
STEP 5:
Drain beans; reserve liquid and beans.
STEP 6:
Combine salt, mustard flour, brown sugar, vinegar, molasses, reserved liquid and water (to make 1 gal), and bacon.  Add to beans; mix well.
STEP 7:
Pour about 20 lb 2 oz (7½ qt) bean mixture into each lightly greased pan; cover.  Bake 2 hours or until sauce is just below surface of beans.  Remove cover; bake 15 minutes.  Stir.  Bake 15 minutes or until set.

NOTE:

1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight; drain.  In Step 4, use 3½ gal cold water.  Follow Steps 5 through 7.
2.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F., 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes (or until sauce is just below surface of beans) on high fan, closed vent.  Uncover, stir; bake additional 15 minutes or until set; on low fan.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  SAVORY BAKED BEANS:  Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 6, use 2½ qt bean liquid and water; add 3 lb 9 oz (1½ qt - 1/2 No.10 cn) catsup and 10½ oz (2 cups) chopped dry onions (12 oz A.P.)  Follow Step 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x4-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pick over beans (kidney, pinto or white), removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with cold water (approximately 3-3/4 gallons); bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Bring beans to a boil; add more water if necessary to keep beans covered.  Simmer 1½ hours or until beans are just tender (not mushy).
STEP 5:
Drain beans; reserve liquid for use in Step 7; beans for use in Step 8.
STEP 6:
Saute' onions and celery in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 7:
Add parsley, thyme, oregano, salt, pepper, garlic, basil, sugar, tomato paste, and liquids (reserved liquid plus water to make 1 gal) to onion mixture; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 8:
Place 1 gal cooked beans in each pan; add 3-3/4 qt sauce; mix carefully.
STEP 9:
Cover, bake 1 hour.
STEP 10:
Sprinkle cheese over beans. 

NOTE:

1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  In Step 6, 2-3/4 oz (2/3 cup plus 3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 6, 1 lb 6 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 4 oz chopped onions; 2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz finely diced celery.
4.  In Step 7, ½ oz (1-2/3 tbsp 5 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.  Saute' with onions.
5.  In Step 7, ¼ cup dehydrated parsley may be used.
6.  In Step 7, three 36-oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
8.  In Step 9, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 45 minutes on low fan, open vent.
9.  On No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  ITALIAN-STYLE BAKED BEANS (KIDNEY OR PINTO BEANS, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, use 20 lb 10 oz (3 No.10 cn) canned kidney beans or 20 lb 10 oz (21 No.300 or No.303 cn) canned pinto beans.  Follow Steps 6 through 10.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with 5 gallons cold water; bring to a boil in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Add bacon, salt, and pepper to beans.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; add more hot water if necessary to keep beans covered; cover.  Simmer 1½ hours or until beans are just tender.

NOTE:

1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  SAVORY STYLE BEANS:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Omit Step 4.  Add 1 lb 4 oz (3-3/4 cups) dry chopped onions (1 lb 
6 oz A.P.)  1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) chopped fresh celery (2 lb 1 oz A.P.); 2 tsp dehydrated garlic; 2 tsp ground cumin; and 2 tsp black pepper.  In Step 5, simmer 2 hours or until beans are tender.
2.  SIMMERED DRY BEANS (WITHOUT BACON):  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, omit bacon.  Follow Step 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with 5 gallons cold water; bring to a boil in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Bring beans to a boil.  If necessary, add more water to keep beans covered.  Simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 5:
Add onions, tomatoes, sugar, mustard flour, cloves, and pepper; simmer 1 hour or until beans are just tender.

NOTE:

1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  In Step 1, 8 lb white dry beans may be used.
3.  In Step 5, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 5, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb finely chopped onions.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION: ½ Cup (3 Ounces)  

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Add beans (green or wax, frozen) to boiling water salted with 1 tablespoon salt.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil; cover; simmer 5 to 8 minutes or until just tender.  Drain; reserve 1 qt liquid.
STEP 4:
Combine onions, beans, bean liquid, and pepper.  Mix lightly.

NOTE:

1.  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Use 25 lb 4 oz (4 No.10 cn) canned green or wax beans for frozen beans.  Drain; reserve 1 qt liquid for use in Step 4.
2.  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Use 1 lb 15 oz (2 No.2½ cn) canned dehydrated compressed green beans for frozen beans.  Prepare according to Guidelines For Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables.  Drain beans; reserve 1 qt liquid.  In Step 4, omit pepper; combine reserved liquid with ingredients.
3.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb sliced onions.
4.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  GREEN BEANS CREOLE:  Omit Step 1.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  Omit Step 4.  Add  3/4 recipe (1½ gal) Creole sauce to drained beans.
2.  GREEN BEANS WITH MUSHROOMS:  In Step 1, omit onions; drain 3 lb 9 oz (two jumbo or four 8Z cn) canned mushrooms.  Saute' in butter or margarine.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.
3.  GREEN BEANS NICOISE:  In Step 1, add ½ tsp dehydrated garlic to onions.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, drain 6 lb 5 oz (1 No.10 cn) canned tomatoes.  Crush tomatoes; combine with remaining ingredients.  Mix lightly.
4.  GREEN BEANS SOUTHERN STYLE:  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2, omit salt.  Cook 1 lb bacon until crisp; drain, crumble bacon; reserve 4 oz (½ cup) bacon fat.  Add bacon fat to beans and water.  Follow Step 3.  Add reserved bean liquid, crumbled bacon and 3/4 tsp black pepper.  Mix lightly.  Omit Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain beets; reserve 4-1/8 qt liquid for use in Step 2; beets for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Add cloves to liquid (reserved liquid + water to make 4-1/8 qt); bring to a boil.
STEP 3:
Dissolve cornstarch in cold water; add to boiling liquid.
STEP 4:
Cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly until thick and clear.
STEP 5:
Add sugar, salt, vinegar, and butter or margarine (optional) to thickened mixture; stir until blended.
STEP 6:
Add drained beets to sauce; heat to a boil.

VARIATION:

1.  BEETS IN ORANGE-LEMON SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, omit vinegar.  Use 6 oz (3/4 cup) lemon juice (1 lb 2 oz - 4½ lemons A.P.), 2/3 oz (3 tbsp) grated lemon rind and 1 lb 11 oz (3 cups) orange juice (3 lb 12 oz - 7½ oranges A.P.) or use 10 oz (1/3 - 32-oz cn) frozen orange juice combined with 1 lb (2 cups) water or 1 lb 9 oz (½ No.3 cyl cn) canned orange juice.  Follow Step 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain beets; reserve 4-1/2 qt liquid for use in Step 2, beets for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Add reserved liquid and water (to make 4½ qt), vinegar, cinnamon, cloves, salt, pepper, and sugars; mix well.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add beets and butter or margarine (optional); heat to serving temperature.

NOTE:  Beets may be served cold.  In Step 4, omit margarine or butter; DO NOT heat.  Serve well chilled.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 to 3 Spears (3 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add frozen broccoli to boiling salted (1-2/3 tablespoons) water; return to a boil; cook, UNCOVERED, 3 minutes.  Cover, reduce heat; cook 7 to 9 minutes or until just tender.  Drain; place an equal quantity in each pan.
STEP 2:
Brown crumbs in butter or melted margarine.  Sprinkle 1 cup crumbs over broccoli in each pan.
STEP 3:
Garnish with hard cooked chopped eggs (1 lb 8 oz is 9 eggs).

NOTE:  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BRUSSELS SPROUTS POLONAISE:  In Step 1, add 20 lb frozen Brussels sprouts to salted water; return to a boil; cook, UNCOVERED, 7 to 9 minutes.  Cover; reduce heat; cook 3 minutes or until tender.  Drain.  Place an equal quantity of mixture in each of 2 pans.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  EACH PORTION: 1/2 Cup (4-6 Brussels sprouts).
2.  CAULIFLOWER POLONAISE:  In Step 1, add 20 lb frozen cauliflower to salted water; return to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat; allow cauliflower to simmer 4 minutes to until tender.  Drain.  Place an equal quantity in 2 pans.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  EACH PORTION: 1/2 Cup (3-4 Flowers or 3 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x4-inches Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add Brussels sprouts to 1-3/4 gallons boiling salted (2-1/2 tsp) water; return to a boil; cook 8 to 10 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain; set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Saute' celery (¼-inch diagonal slices) in margarine or butter 5 minutes until tender.
STEP 4:
Combine soup and 1 qt water; mix well; add celery, pimientos, garlic powder and 2 teaspoons white pepper (optional).
STEP 5:
Add Brussel sprouts to soup mixture, mix lightly.  Simmer 5 minutes or until hot.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb sliced 
celery.
2.  In Step 4, three 7-oz cn canned pimientoes may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Cmrcl Crm Of Mushrm Soup Cond-10.75ozCan

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (2½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  325°F.  Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Divide coarsely shredded cabbage into 2 batches.
STEP 2:
Fry each batch in butter, margarine or salad oil 10 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently to avoid scorching.
STEP 3:
Add 1 tbsp salt and 1½ tsp pepper to each batch.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 25 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 20 lb coarsely shredded cabbage.
2.  Recipe may be prepared in 350°F. oven.  In Step 2, place cabbage in 1 roasting pan (18x24-inches); bake uncovered 1 hour; stir occasionally.
3.  Recipe may be prepared in a tilting fry pan.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CALICO CABBAGE:  In Step 1, use 18 lb (about 8 gal) cabbage (22 lb 8 oz A.P.).  Add 8 oz (2 cups)  fresh shredded carrots (10 oz A.P.), 8 oz (2 cups) fresh celery rings (11 oz A.P.), and 1 lb (3 cups) chopped dry onions (1 lb 2 oz A.P.) to cabbage.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 3½ oz (½ cup) granulated sugar.  Add ¼ cup to each batch.
2.  FRIED CABBAGE WITH BACON:  Cook 2 lb raw bacon until crisp. Drain; crumble bacon.  In Step 2, add 1-2/3 cups crumbled bacon to each batch.  In Step 3, reduce salt to 2/3 oz (1 tbsp).  (Note: 8 oz precooked bacon, chopped, may be used.  Heat with cabbage).

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTIONS:  1/2 Cup (5 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x4-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Arrange 3 qt potatotes and 3 cups apples in alternate layers in each pan.
STEP 2:
Combine brown sugar, melted shortening or salad oil, salt and water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Cook at low heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved.  Pour equal quantity over potatotes in each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 30 minutes or until apples and potatoes are thoroughly heated.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 36 lb (24 No.3 squat cn), 34 lb 7 oz (19 No.2½ cn) or 37 lb 2 oz (5½ No.10 cn) canned sweet potatoes may be used.  Drain potatoes.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (½ cup) ground cinnamon may be added.
3.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 30 minutes on low fan, open vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add carrot strips, 1/2 x 2 inch, to 2 gallons boiling water with 2 teaspoons salt.  Return to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain; set aside carrots for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add brown sugar, orange rind, orange juice, and almonds to melted margarine or butter.  Blend well.
STEP 4:
Add glaze to carrots; mix until carrots are well coated.

NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 20 lb fresh carrots A.P. will yield 16 lb carrots cut in 1/2 by 2 inch strips.
2.  In Step 3, 12 oz (2 oranges) fresh oranges A.P. will yield 1/3 cup juice and 3 tbsp rind.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Freeze Dried Sweet Green Bell Peppers
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Rehydrate onions and peppers 20 to 30 minutes; drain well.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions, peppers and chopped bacon together until bacon starts to brown, about 10 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add cabbage; mix lightly.  Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
STEP 4:
Drain bean sprouts and pimientos; add to cabbage.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle pepper and garlic over cabbage; fold over several times to blend.
STEP 6:
Heat to steaming.  Place in oven.
STEP 7:
Pour whole beaten eggs (1 lb is 10 eggs) onto a greased sheet pan (18x26-inches); bake 6 to 8 minutes or until firm.
STEP 8:
Cut eggs into thin strips, 3 inches long; spread over cabbage.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 2, 12 oz (2¼ cups) chopped dry onions (13 oz A.P.) and 12 oz (2¼ cups) chopped, fresh sweet peppers (14 oz A.P.) or 12 oz frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 20 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 16 lb shredded cabbage.
3.  In Step 4, seven No.300 cn canned beans sprouts may be used.
4.  In Step 4, four 7-oz cn canned pimientos may be used.
5.  In Step 7, 5-oz (¼ No.3 cyl cn) canned, dehydrated egg mix combined with 1½ cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
7.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (1 Pan)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add carrots (cut in ½-inch diagonal slices) and celery (cut in 3/4-inch diagonal slices) to3-3/8 gallons boiling salted (2-1/3 tablespoons) water.  Return to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Drain; reserve carrots and celery for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Spread almonds on pan in a thin layer.  Heat 12 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until almonds are lightly browned. Remove from oven.
STEP 4:
Add almonds, lemon juice and melted margarine to carrot and celery.  Toss or stir lightly.  Mix thoroughly.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 13 lb 1 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 10 lb 11 oz (2½ gal) carrot cut in diagonal slices; 10 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 7 lb 10 oz (2 gal) celery cut in diagonal slices.
2.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, toast at 300°F. 12 to 15 minutes on high fan, open vent.
3.  In Step 4, 14 oz (4 lemons) fresh lemons A.P. will yield 3/4 cup lemon juice.
4.  In Step 4, 3 tbsp frozen lemon juice concentrate and 9 tbsp cold water may be used for juice.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (See Note 6)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add carrots (cut in 1/2 by 2-inch strips) to 2-1/4 gallons boiling water with 1 tablespoon salt.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil; cook 10 minutes.
STEP 3:
Drain; reserve carrots for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Add pepper to melted butter or margarine in steam-jacketed kettle or tilting fry pan.
STEP 5:
Add onions (cut in half lengthwise, sliced thinly); saute' until tender, about 10 minutes.
STEP 6:
Add sugar, salt and reserved carrots to sauteed onions; mix lightly; cook 5 minutes, tossing occasionally.
STEP 7:
Garnish with parsley before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 22 lb fresh carrots A.P. will yield 18 lb carrots cut in 1/2 inch by 2 inch strips.
2.  In Step 2, 26 lb (26 No.303 cn) or 26 lb 4 oz (Four No.10 cn) canned carrots may be used.  Omit Steps 1 and 2.
3.  In Step 1, 18 lb fresh, sliced, ready-to-use carrots or 18 lb frozen, sliced carrots may be used.
4.  In Step 5, 8 oz (2-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  In Step 5, 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb thinly sliced onions.
6.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (8 to 9 Strips) (3 Ounces).

VARIATION:

1.  GLAZED CARROTS:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Omit Steps 4 and 5.  Melt 8 oz (1 cup) butter or margarine in steam-jacketed kettle or tilting fry pan; add 1/2 oz (3 tbsp) ground ginger (optional); stir until well blended.  Add 1 lb 3 oz (2-3/4 cups) granulated sugar; stir (mixture will resemble a thick roux).  In Step 6, toss lightly until well coated; cook 5 minutes, tossing occasionally.  Omit Step 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (5 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add frozen cauliflower to 3 gallons boiling salted (1 tablespoon) water.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil; cover.  Simmer 4 to 8 minutes or until just tender.
STEP 3:
Drain; place about 3-3/4 qt cauliflower in each pan.  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with 4½ qt warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 5:
Blend melted butter or margarine and flour together; stir until smooth.
STEP 6:
Add flour mixture to milk, stirring constantly.  Simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 7:
Add cheese (Cheddar or American) and pepper; stir until blended.
STEP 8:
Pour 1½ qt sauce over cauliflower in each pan.
STEP 9:
Mix crumbs and 1 cup melted butter or margarine.  Sprinkle 1 cup evenly over culiflower in each pan.
STEP 10:
Bake 15 minutes or until crumbs are browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 24 lb fresh cauliflower A.P. may be used.  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Follow Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No.Q-G-3, for cooking directions.  Follow Steps 3 through 10.
2.  In Step 10, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 10 minutes or until crumbs are browned on high fan, open vent.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTIONS:  2 Cakes (3½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add potatoes (white, dehydrated, sliced) and onions (dehydrated, chopped) to 3½ gal boiling water.  Bring to a boil; simmer 15 minutes or until soft but not mushy  DO NOT OVERCOOK.
Drain immediately or mixture will be too moist.
STEP 2:
Beat potato and onion mixture in mixer bowl at medium speed 2 minutes.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute milk; add whole, beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs).  Add to potato mixture; blend at low speed 1 minute.
STEP 4:
Add flour, salt, pepper, nutmeg, thyme and melted shortening or salad oil to mixture; blend at low speed 2 minutes.
STEP 5:
Drop ¼ cup (One No.16 scoop) batter onto lightly greased griddle.  Cook until well browned, about 2½ to 3 minutes on each side.
STEP 6:
Serve with 1 tbsp fresh sour cream (optional).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 10 oz (2½ cups) canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 3 cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.
2.  In Step 6, Sour Cream Sauce Mix may be used for sour cream.  Mix according to instructions on container.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  4 Pieces (3½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Reconstitute dry milk with 4½ cups warm water; add beaten eggs (1¼ lb is 12 eggs).  Mix well.
STEP 2:
Cut large cauliflower pieces in half.  Dip in milk and egg mixture; drain well.
STEP 3:
Combine flour, salt, pepper and cheese.  Dredge cauliflower in flour mixture; shake off excess.
STEP 4:
Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown.  Drain on absorbent paper.  Serve immediately. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)

NOTE: 

1. Fry in small batches.  The product loses crispness if allowed to stand on steam table.

VARIATION:

1.  FRENCH FRIED OKRA:  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2, omit cauliflower; use 18 lb frozen okra, partially thawed.  Break large pieces apart.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, fry 2 minutes or until golden brown.  EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (2 Ounces).
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Calumet Double Acting Baking Powder KFT
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Fritters (2½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Sift together flour, salt, baking powder, sugar, and dry milk into mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Combine warm water, beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs), corn and melted butter or margarine; mix well.
STEP 3:
Add corn mixture to dry ingredients; mix until well blended.
(Batter will not be smooth.)
STEP 4:
Drop 2 tbsp (One No.30 scoop) batter into deep fat.
STEP 5:
Fry 5 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 6:
Drain on absorbent paper. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)

NOTE:

In Step 3, additional water may be added if corn mixture is too thick.

VARIATION:

1.  CORN FRITTERS (PANCAKE MIX):     Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Combine 6 lb 10 oz (One No.10 cn) canned cream style corn, 6 lb 12 oz (1-2/3 No.10 cn) pancake mix and 1½ qt water.  Mix well.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine tomatoes, sugar, salt, crushed basil, thyme, garlic, pepper and 3 whole bay leaves in a stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle.  Stir well.
STEP 2:
Add eggplant (unpeeled, cut into 1 inch cubes), squash (zucchini, unpeeled, quartered, lengthwise, sliced ½-inch thick), sweet peppers and onions.  Bring to a boil stirring constantly.  Cover; simmer 45 minutes or until eggplant is tender.  Stir occasionally.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2-2/3 tbsp (8 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 10 lb 5 oz fresh eggplant A.P. will yield 10 lb unpeeled cubed eggplant; 8 lb 7 oz fresh zucchini squash A.P. will yield 8 lb unpeeled quartered zucchini squash; 3 lb 1 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb 8 oz chopped peppers; and 1 lb 11oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 2, 8 lb frozen zucchini squash may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 6½ oz (1¼ qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb 
8 oz frozen diced green peppers and 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
RecipeItem/9/_ItemName: Sweet Green Bell Peppers Chpd Ckd-Drnd

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x10x4-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  325°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine melted butter or margarine, cracker crumbs, and pepper.  Reserve 3 cups buttered crumbs for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Pour 2-3/4 qt corn into each lightly greased pan.  Stir in 2½ cups buttered crumbs.  Mix until just combined.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute milk with 5-3/4 cups warm water; pour 1½ cups milk evenly over top of mixture in each pan.  Mix until just combined.
STEP 4:
Sprinkle 3/4 cup reserved buttered crumbs over top of corn mixture.
STEP 5:
Bake 45 minutes or until lightly browned.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 30 minutes.
2.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  SCALLOPED WHOLE KERNEL CORN:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 23 lb 3 oz (3½ No.10 cn) canned whole kernel corn or 15 lb 5 oz frozen corn.  Cook frozen corn according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3. Drain corn; reserve 1½ qt liquid.  In Step 3, mix liquid with reconstituted milk.  Pour 3 cups milk and drained liquid mixture over each pan.  Mix until just combined. Follow Steps 4 and 5.  EACH PORTION:  About 1/2 Cup (3½ Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (2 to 3 Stalks with Sauce)
                               (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Blend soup, water and milk together.  Add Parmesan cheese; mix well.
STEP 3:
Add sauteed onions to mixture; heat thoroughly.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Prepare broccoli according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3 (Steps 1 through 5.)  Drain; place an equal quantity in each pan.
STEP 5:
Pour about 3½ qt sauce over broccoli in each pan.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, l lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1. 3 oz (1cup) dehydrated onions may be used..
3.  In Step 5, 8 oz (2 cups) dry bread crumbs browned in 8 oz (1 cup) melted butter or margarine may be sprinkled over broccoli and sauce.  Use 1 cup buttered crumbs for each pan; heat in 350°F. oven for 20 minutes.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BRUSSELS SPROUTS PARMESAN:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, omit broccoli; use 16 lb frozen Brussels sprouts.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3 to 4 Brussels spouts with sauce).
2.  CAULIFLOWER PARMESAN:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, omit broccoli; use 16 lb frozen cauliflower.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1/2 Cup (3 to 4 flowerets with sauce).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (2½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Tilting Fry Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash and trim fresh vegetables.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Add Soup and Gravy base and pepper to boiling water.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Blend cornstarch with water and soy sauce to make a smooth paste.
STEP 4:
Slowly add paste to stock stirring constantly.  Simmer 2 minutes or until lightly thickened and clear, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Saute' vegetables in melted shortening, salad oil, or olive oil as follows:
    carrots - 3 minutes; add celery and green peppers - 2         minutes; add remaining vegetables - 4 minutes.
STEP 6:
Pour sauce over vegetables 15 minutes before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:
  - 4 lb 9 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 3 lb 12 oz sliced carrots
  - 6 lb 3 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb 8 oz sliced celery
  - 5 lb 10 oz fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 4 lb 8 oz cabbage
strips
  - 2 lb 12 oz fresh peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb 4 oz pepper        strips
  - One No.8Z cn canned mushrooms may be used
  - 1 lb 11 oz onions, dry A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz onion wedges
  - 15 oz onions, green A.P. will yield 12 oz green onion pieces
2.  In Step 4, steam-jacketed kettle may be used for tilting fry pan, if desired.
3.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Fresh Sliced Sweet Green Bell Peppers

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (5 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions and celery in margarine or butter until tender.
STEP 2:
Add garlic powder, crushed basil, and ground rosemary to sauteed vegetables; mix well.
STEP 3:
Drain green beans, reserving 2 cups liquid (water substituted in food list above).  Add beans and reserved liquid to onion-herb mixture.
STEP 4:
Simmer about 10 minutes or until flavors are blended.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1: 6 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 6 lb chopped onions; 3 lb 12 oz fresh celery will yield 3 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, 12 oz (1-7/8 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2 lb 15 oz (3 No.2½ cn) canned dehydrated compressed green beans may be used.  Prepare according to Guidelines for Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-5.  Omit margarine or butter.
4.  In Step 3, 24 lb frozen green beans may be used for canned green beans.  Prepare according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3.  Proceed with remainder Step 3.

YIELD: 100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook bacon until crisp.  Drain.  Set bacon aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Drain corn; mix with pepper and finely chopped pimientos.
STEP 3:
Heat; cook at medium heat until hot, stirring constantly.
STEP 4:
Crumble bacon.  Add to corn mixture.  Mix well.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 30 lb frozen whole kernel corn may be used.  Prepare corn according to, Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3.  Drain.  Omit Step 3.  Follow Step 4.
2.  In Step 2, one and a half 7-oz cn canned pimientos may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CORN O'BRIEN:    Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, saute' 3 lb (2¼ qt) chopped sweet peppers (3 lb 11 oz A.P.) and 2 lb 4 oz (6-3/4 cups) chopped dry onions (2 lb 11oz A.P.) in 6 oz (3/4 cup) salad oil, melted shortening, or olive oil until tender.  Add to corn mixture.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  MEXICAN CORN:  In Step 1, omit bacon.  In Step 2, saute' 3 lb (2¼ qt) chopped, fresh sweet peppers (3lb 11 oz A.P.) in 3 oz (6 tbsp) butter or margarine until tender.  Add to corn mixture.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION: 1 Piece (6½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE: 350°F. Deep Fat 
                             350°F Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Set Pizza Sauce aside for use in Step 8.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle eggplant with salt.  Let stand 30 minutes; drain.
STEP 3:
Dredge eggplant in flour; shake off excess.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2-3/4 cups warm water; combine with beaten eggs (1 lb is 10 eggs).
STEP 5:
Dip eggplant in milk and egg mixtrue; drain well.
STEP 6:
Dredge eggplant in crumbs; shake off excess.
STEP 7:
Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening was used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 8:
Place 1 layer eggplant in each pan.  Pour 3 cups sauce evenly over eggplant.
STEP 9:
Add 2nd layer eggplant; cover with remaining sauce (3 cups per pan).
STEP 10:
Sprinkle Parmesan Cheese evenly over sauce in each pan.
STEP 11:
Sprinkle Mozzarella Cheese evenly over sauce in each pan.
STEP 12:
Bake 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2¼ gal Spaghetti Sauce may be used.
2.  In Steps 10 and 11, 3 lb 2 oz canned pizza blend cheese may be used for all cheese.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.  EACH PORTION:  2 to 3 Slices (6½ Ounces).
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add 4 gal boiling water to steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Add 10 lb uncooked ham hocks and onions to water.  Cover; simmer 2½ hours or until tender.  Remove; trim meat and fat from bones.  Cut meat into small pieces.  Add meat and bones to stock.
STEP 2:
Add greens, pepper and 4 gal water to stock.  Bring to a boil; stir   immediately.
STEP 3:
Simmer 1 hour, uncovered, or until greens are tender, stirring occasionally.
STEP 4:
Remove bones; serve greens with cooking liquid (pot liquor).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 11 oz onions, dry A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 lb raw chopped bacon may be used for pork hocks.
3.  In Step 2, 27 lb fresh collard greens A.P. will yield 10 lb greens.
4.  In Step 2, wash greens in several changes of cold water to remove all traces of dirt or sand.
5.  Greens may be garnished with chopped, hard-cooked eggs, finely chopped, fresh tomatoes or chopped dry onions.

VARIATIONS:

1.  SOUTHERN STYLE GREENS (FROZEN COLLARDS, MUSTARD OR TURNIP GREENS):      Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 20 lb frozen greens; increase water to 4½ gal.  In Step 3, break through frozen greens several times to hasten cooking.  Simmer 25 minutes, uncovered, or until greens are tender, stirring occasionally.  Follow Step 4.
2.  SWEET SOUR GREENS:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Saute' 1 lb 4 oz (1 qt) chopped, dry onions (1 lb 6 oz A.P.) in 2 oz (¼ cup) butter or margarine until tender; add 1 lb 12 oz (1 qt) granulated sugar and 3 lb 3 oz (1½ qt) vinegar; stir to mix well.  Cook 3 minutes.  In Step 4, add to cooked greens.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4½ Ounces).
3.  SOUTHERN STYLE GREENS (FRESH KALE):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 12 lb fresh kale (17 lb A.P.); increase water to 5 gal.  In Step 3, simmer 20 minutes, uncovered, or until greens are tender, stirring occasionally.  Follow Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain mushrooms.
STEP 2:
Saute' mushrooms lightly in butter or margarine.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 7 lb 10 oz (9 No.8Z cn) canned mushrooms may be used.
2.  One Size O Ladle may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  SAUTE'ED MUSHROOMS AND ONIONS:  Follow Step 1. In Step 2, use 1 lb 8 oz (3 cups) butter or margarine and 10 lb (2 gal) sliced, dry onions (11 lb 1 oz A.P.).  Saute' onions until tender; add mushrooms.  Heat thoroughly.  EACH PORTION: 1/4 Cup (1 size-1 Ladle) (2 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions and chopped bacon until onions are tender and bacon is crisp.
STEP 2:
Add thawed, cut okra to onions and bacon.  Cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
STEP 3:
Add flour, sugar, salt, chili powder, and pepper; stir until blended.
STEP 4:
Add tomatoes and boiling water; mix well.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes or until okra is tender.
STEP 6:
Add Garlic or Parmesan croutons as a garnish just before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 16 lb (16 - No.303 cn) canned okra, drained may be used.  If okra is whole, cut into ½-inch rings.
4.  In Step 6, 1/2 Recipe Garlic Croutons or Parmesan Croutons may be used. (Recipe Croutons, Variation 1 or 2).
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/3 Cup
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Dredge okra in mixture of cornmeal, flour, salt and pepper.
STEP 2:
Fry on well-greased griddle 10 minutes or until golden brown.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  4 to 6 Pieces (5½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cover potatoes (fresh, white, peeled, cut in 1½x1½x1-inch pieces) with 4 gallons water salted with 1/2 cup salt; bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Drain; reserve 2 cups liquid for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Place an equal quantity of potatoes in 4 steam table pans (12x20x2½-inches).
STEP 4:
Combine melted butter or margarine and reserved liquid; pour 1 cup over potatoes in each pan.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle 1/2 cup parsley over potatoes in each pan.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 43 lb 1 oz  fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 35 lb peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 5, ½ cup dehydrated parsley may be used for fresh parsley.  Sprinkle 2 tbsp over potatotes in each pan.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  PAPRIKA BUTTERED POTATOES:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, omit parsley.  Use 1 oz (¼ cup) ground paprika.  Sprinkle 1 tbsp paprika over potatoes in each pan.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook quartered onions in 3 gallons boiling water with 5 tbs salt added for 15 minutes or until tender; drain.
STEP 2:
Spread about 1¼ gal onions in each pan.
STEP 3:
Combine tomatoes, peppers, celery, sugar, and pepper.  Heat to boiling; simmer until vegetables are tender.
STEP 4:
Blend salad oil or melted shortening and flour together; stir until smooth; add to tomatoes, stirring constantly.  Cook 10 minutes or until slightly thickened.
STEP 5:
Pour about 3 qt tomato mixture over onions in each pan.  Bake 15 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 16 lb 10 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 15 lb quartered onions; 4 lb 14 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped peppers; 4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 2, 18 lb 15 oz (3 - No.10 cn) canned whole onions may be used.  Drain.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
RecipeItem/7/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Fresh White Onions Lrg Slice-1/4" Thick
RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2½ Ounces
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Separate onion slices into rings.  Cover with cold water.  Let stand 10 to 15 minutes.  Drain.
STEP 2:
Dredge onion rings in mixture of flour, salt and pepper; shake off excess.  Reserve remaining seasoned flour for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with 3-3/4 qt warm water; dip floured onion rings into milk.  Drain well. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)

STEP 4:
Dredge onion rings in seasoned flour until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Fry 2 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 6:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

In Step 1, 22 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 20 lb sliced onions.

VARIATIONS:

1.  FRENCH FRIED ONION RINGS (FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 through 5.  Use 25 lb frozen breaded onion rings.  Fry according to directions on package.  Follow Step 6.  EACH PORTION: 3 Ounces.
2.  TEMPURA FRIED ONION RINGS:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Prepare 2 recipes Tempura Batter.  Dip individual onion rings into batter.  In Step 5, drop onion rings gently into deep fat; fry about 1½ minutes or until golden brown.  Follow Step 6.
3.  FRENCH FRIED ONION RINGS (ONION RING MIX):  Omit Steps 1 through 5.  Use 6 lb 14 oz (2-3/4 No.10 cn) canned onion ring mix.  Place mix in automatic French fry extruder with onion ring slicer.  Mix; dispense and fry mix according to manufacturer's directions.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/4 Cup (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Heat about 1½ cups salad oil, shortening, olive oil in each pan.
STEP 2:
Place 12 lb 8 oz thinly sliced onions in each pan.  Cook 40 minutes or until tender and lightly browned, stirring occasionally to prevent burning.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 27 lb 12 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 25 lb thinly sliced onions.
2.  In Step 2, onions may be cooked on preheated greased 350°F. griddle.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.16 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Rehydrate onions in 4 gal warm water 1 hour; drain well.
STEP 2:
Blend salad oil or melted shortening, salt and pepper with onions in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 3:
Cover; bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 20 minutes or until tender and slightly browned, stirring occasionally.
STEP 4:
Drain well.

NOTE: 
1.   In Step 1, 7 lb 8 oz (6-1/3 No.2½ cn) canned, dehydrated, compressed onions may be used.
2.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain beans.  Reserve beans for use in Step 2; liquid for use in Step 3.  
STEP 2:
Place beans in mixer bowl; beat at low speed until mashed.
STEP 3:
Add chili powder, garlic, 2 lb shredded cheese (Cheddar or American), onions (minced), hot sauce and 1½ qt bean liquid.  Whip at medium speed, adding more bean liquid to obtain consistency of mashed potatoes.
STEP 4:
Spread an equal quantity of bean mixture in greased pans; bake 30 minutes.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle an equal quantity of cheese (Cheddar or American, shredded) over bean mixture in each pan.

NOTE: 

1.  In Step 3, dehydrated garlic may be increased if stronger garlic flavor is desired.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb minced onions.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  Refried Beans may be used as a dip for corn chips or tortilla chips.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  REFRIED BEANS (CANNED REFRIED BEANS):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 24 lb 1 oz (3½ No.10 cn) canned Refried Beans.  Follow Step 4.  Omit Step 5.  If desired, mashed bean mixture may be fried on greased 350°F. griddle.
2.  REFRIED BEANS WITH CHEESE (CANNED REFRIED BEANS):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, omit onions and bean stock.  Use 24 lb 1 oz (3½ No.10 cn) canned Refried Beans.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook chopped bacon until partially done.  Drain fat; set aside ¼ cup bacon fat for use in Step 2; bacon for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions in bacon fat until tender. Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add beans to 3 quarts water salted with 1 tablespoon salt; bring to a boil; cover; simmer 10 minutes.  Drain; reserve 2½ qt liquid and beans.
STEP 4:
Combine beans, bacon, onions, red pepper, reserved liquid and corn.  Cover; continue cooking 15 minutes.
STEP 5:
Serve with cooking liquid (pot liquor).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb sliced onions.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  GREEN BEANS WITH CORN (BEANS, GREEN, CANNED):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 18 lb 15 oz (3 - No.10 cn) canned green beans. Drain beans.  Reserve 2½ qt liquid.  In Step 4, add reserved liquid.  Follow Step 5.
2.  GREEN BEANS WITH CORN (BEANS, GREEN DEHYDRATED, COMPRESSED):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 1 lb 9 oz (1½ - No.2½ cn) canned, dehydrated, compressed green beans.  Prepare according to Guidelines for Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-5; omit butter or margarine.  Drain beans.  Reserve 2½ qt liquid.  In Step 4, add reserved liquid.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1/3 Cup (3½ Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add chopped bacon to1-1/2 gallons boiling water; simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 2:
Add 2 tbsp salt, pepper and pared, sliced ¼-inch crosswise, halved turnips to bacon and water.
STEP 3:
Cover; bring to a boil.  Remove cover; simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until just tender.

NOTE:

1.  In Setp 2, 24 lb 10 oz turnips A.P. will yield 20 lb pared sliced turnips.
2.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Green Peas Ckd f/Fzn Drnd-10oz Pkg
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (4½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add peas to 2 gallons boiling water salted with 1 tablespoon salt.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil; cover; cook gently, 6 to 8 minutes or until tender.  Drain; set peas aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Saute' mushrooms in margarine or butter.
STEP 4:
Combine hot peas and mushrooms; mix gently.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 9 lb 6 oz (12 - 8Z cn) canned mushrooms, drained may be used.
2.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  PEAS WITH CARROTS:  In Step 1, use 22 lb 5 oz frozen peas.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, omit mushrooms; use 15 lb diced fresh carrots (18 lb 6 oz A.P.).  Place carrots and 2/3 oz (1 tbsp) salt in 6 lb (3 qt) boiling water; cook 15 minutes or until tender; drain.  In Step 4, combine hot peas and carrots with melted margarine or butter.
2.  PEAS WITH CELERY:  In Step 1, use 22 lb 8 oz frozen peas.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, omit mushrooms; use 12 lb 12 oz (12-3/4 qt) fresh celery (17 lb 8 oz A.P.) cut in 1/2-inch pieces.  Place celery in 6 lb (3 qt) boiling water; cook 10 to 15 minutes or until tender; drain.  In Step 4, combine hot peas with melted butter or margarine.
3.  PEAS WITH ONIONS:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, omit mushrooms.  Saute' 6 lb (4½ qt) chopped, dry onions (6 lb 11 oz A.P.) in margarine or butter or until tender.  In Step 4, combine hot peas with sauteed onions.
4.  PEAS WITH MUSHROOMS (CANNED PEAS):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 39 lb 6 oz ( 6 - No.10 cn) canned peas.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, heat peas; drain and combine with mushrooms.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 2:
Blend soup, water and Worcestershire sauce into onion mixture.
STEP 3:
Drain beans; add beans to mixture; mix lightly.
STEP 4:
Place about 6¼ qt mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Combine bread crumbs and melted butter or margarine.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle about 1 cup over mixture in each pan.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle 1 cup cheese over crumb mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 20 minutes or until sauce is bubbling and cheese is melted.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 2¼ oz (2/3 cup plus 4½ tsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb 4oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 2 oz sliced onions.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
5.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 minutes on high fan, open vent.

VARIATION:
1.  GREEN BEANS PARISIENNE (FROZEN GREEN BEANS):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 16 lb frozen green beans.  Cook according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3 or Guidleines for Steam Cooking Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-6.  Follow Steps 3 through 8.
RecipeItem/5/_ItemName: Green Giant Cut Green Beans-Cnd PLB

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 1¼ cups melted butter or margarine in each18x24-inch roasting pan (2 pans).
STEP 2:
Add 9 lb (11¼ qt) cabbage and 1 lb (5½ cups) diced apples to each pan.  Mix thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Cook at low heat 30 minutes, stirring frequently to avoid scorching.
STEP 4:
Combine vinegar, brown sugar, salt, cloves, and 7 bay leaves.
STEP 5:
Pour half of vinegar mixture over hot cabbage and apples in each pan.
STEP 6:
Simmer 2 to 3 minutes to blend seasonings.  Remove bay leaves.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 22 lb 8 oz fresh red cabbage A.P. will yield 18 lb finely chopped red cabbage; 2 lb 6 oz fresh apples A.P. will yield 2 lb diced unpared apples.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
3.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Potato (6½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Scrub potatoes well; remove any blemishes.  Place on sheet pans.  Prick skin several times with fork to allow steam to escape.
STEP 2:
Bake 50 minutes or until done.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 35 to 40 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.
2.  In Step 2, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 6 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).  Bake at 450°F. 30 to 35 minutes with 80% microwave power throughout.
3.  Potatoes are done when 208°F. to 211°F. internal temperature is reached.  When done, a fork will easily pierce potato.
4.  Potatoes may be baked a few at a time in a microwave oven as needed.

VARIATION:

1.  QUICK BAKED POTATO HALVES:  Omit Step 1.  Scrub potatoes well; remove any blemishes.  Cut potatoes in half lengthwise.  Dry cut sides on paper towels.  Place cut side down, in rows 5 by 6, on well-greased sheet pans (6 pans).  Bake 30 minutes or in 400°F. convection oven 20 minutes or until done and cut sides are evenly browned on high fan, closed vent.  EACH PORTION: 2 Potato Halves (7 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (3½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  365°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Hold potatoes 37 lb  (white, fresh, peeled, French fry cut) in cold water to cover until needed to prevent discoloration.
STEP 2:
Drain; dry well.
STEP 3:
Fill fryer basket about 2/3 full; fry about 7 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 4:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.  DO NOT cover fries.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 45 lb 8 oz fresh, white potatoes A.P. will yield 37 lb French fry cut potatoes.  If automatic cutter is not available, cut peeled, eyed potatoes into strips 3 to 4 inches long, 3/8 to 1/2-inch thick.
2.  In Step 1, 37 lb fresh, peeled, French style, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.
3.  In Step 3, fry in small batches.  Potatoes lose crispness if allowed to stand on steam table.

VARIATIONS:

1.  FRENCH FRIED POTATOES (FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 35 lb frozen French fried potatoes.  In Step 3, fry about 4 minutes at 375°F. or until golden brown.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  FRENCH FRIED POTATOES (FROZEN) (OVEN METHOD):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Lightly grease 9 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Use 35 lb frozen French fried potatoes.  In Step 3, place about 3 lb 14 oz potatoes on each sheet pan; bake in 475°F. oven 40 to 45 minutes or until golden brown or in 450°F. convection oven 20 to 25 minutes on high fan, open vent.  Omit Step 4.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1 Cup (3 Ounces).
3.  FRENCH FRIED SHOESTRING POTATOES (FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 and 2, use 30 lb frozen shoestring potatoes.  In Step 3, fry about 3 minutes at 365°F. or until golden brown.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (3 Ounces).
4.  FRENCH FRIED SHOESTRING POTATOES (FROZEN) (OVEN METHOD):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 30 lb frozen shoestring potatoes.  Lightly grease 12 sheet pans (18x26 - inches).  In Step 3, place 2 lb 8 oz potatoes on each sheet pan; bake at 450°F. oven 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown or in 400°F. convection oven 7 to 10 minutes on high fan, open vent.  Omit Step 4.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1 Cup (3 Ounces).
5.  FRENCH FRIED POTATOES (DEHYDRATED POTATO MIX):  In Step 1, use 8 lb dehydrated potato mix.  Rehydrate, dispense and fry according to manufacturer's directions.
6.  BAKED POTATO ROUNDS (PRECOOKED POTATO ROUNDS):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 25 lb frozen potato rounds.  Use 5 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  In Step 3, place about 5 lb potatoes on each pan.  Bake at 475°F. 30  minutes or in 450°F. convection oven 8 minutes or until golden brown on high fan, open vent.  NOTE:  If microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 450°F. 6 minutes with 70% microwave power for first 4 minutes.  Omit Step 4.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (2½ Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (3½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cover 31 lb diced potatoes with boiling water salted with 1 tsp salt; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes or until tender.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Spread a layer of potatoes over well-greased griddle, using approx 3 cups.  Cook 10 minutes or until golden brown on one side.
STEP 3:
Turn potatoes; cook 10 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 4:
Sprinkle with 3 tbsp salt and 2 tsp pepper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 38 lb 2 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 31 lb peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 1, 31 lb fresh, peeled, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.  Quarter potatoes.  Dice ¼-inch.
3.  In Step 1, 31 lb fresh, peeled, diced, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.  Boil 15 minutes or steam cook potatoes 5 minutes until just tender.

VARIATIONS:

1.  COTTAGE FRIED POTATOES:  In Step 1, cut potatoes in half lengthwise.  Slice ¼-inch thick.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.
2.  HASHED BROWN POTATOES (FROZEN, SHREDDED, 3 OUNCES):  Omit Step 1.  Use 18 lb potatoes, white, frozen, shredded.  In Step 2, place layer of potatoes on well-greased griddle; cook 15 minutes; turn; brown on other side.  Omit Step 3.  Follow Step 4.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (Breakfast Portion).  NOTE:  TO COOK TO ORDER, thaw layer of potatoes on greased sheet pan in 350°F. oven.  Brown on greased griddle, 3 minutes per side.
3.  LYONNAISE POTATOES:  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 38 lb pared fresh white potatoes (46 lb 12 oz A.P.).  Cut potatoes in half lengthwise.  Slice 1/2 inch thick; mix with 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) sliced dry onions (1 lb 11 oz A.P.).  Place mixture in 2 greased roasting pans (18x24-inches).  Add 1 lb 4 oz (2½ cups) shortening or salad oil, 2 oz (3 tbsp) salt and 2 tsp pepper.  Mix lightly.  Bake at 450°F. 1 hour 30 minutes or in 350°F. convection oven 1 hour 15 minutes or until tender on high fan, closed vent.
4.  HASHED BROWN POTATOES (FROZEN, SHREDDED, 2½ OUNCES):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 16 lb frozen hashed brown potatoes.  DO NOT THAW.  Place patties on 4 ungreased sheet pans (18x26-inches).  DO NOT allow patties to touch each other.  Bake 15 to 18 minutes at 450°F. or in 400°F. convection oven 15 to 17 minutes or until lightly browned on high fan, open vent.  EACH PORTION:  1 Pattie (2 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (3 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Spread a layer of potatoes (white, fresh, peeled, 1/8-inch slices) on well-greased griddle.
STEP 2:
Cook about 25 minutes, turning occasionally to ensure even browning.
STEP 3:
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 43 lb 1 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 35 lb peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 1, 35 lb fresh, peeled, ready-to-use, whole potatoes may be used.  Slice potatoes 1/8 inch thick.
3.  In Step 1, potatoes may be browned in shallow fat in roasting pans or in tilting fry pay or lightly browned in 350°F. deep-fat fryer.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cover potatoes (quartered) with water adding 2 tbsp salt; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 25 minutes or until tender.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Beat potatoes in mixer bowl at low speed until broken into smaller pieces, about 1 minute.
STEP 3:
Add softened margarine or butter and pepper (white or black). Beat at high speed 3 to 5 minutes or until smooth.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; heat to a simmer; blend into potatoes at low speed.  Beat at high speed 2 minutes or until light and fluffy.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 27 lb 1 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 22 lb peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 1,   22 lb fresh, peeled, whole, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.  Quarter potatoes.
3.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  GRILLED POTATO PATTIES:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, beat at high speed 1 minute.  In Step 4, reduce nonfat dry milk to 4 oz (1 cup) and water to 2 lb (1 qt).  At low speed, blend in 14 oz (1-2/3 cups (9 eggs)) beaten whole eggs.  Beat at high speed 1 minute.  Shape into 200 2-oz patties (1 No.16 scoop).  Dredge patties in 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) bread crumbs.  Shake off excess.  Grill on lightly greased 350°F. griddle 3 minutes per side or until golden brown.  EACH PORTION: 2 Patties (4 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (3½ Ounces)
THEMPERATURE:  365°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' finely chopped peppers in salad oil, melted shortening, or olive oil 5 minutes or until tender.  Add finely chopped pimientos; saute' until heated through.  Keep hot for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Fry potatoes in 25-portion batches 7 minutes or until lightly browned and tender in deep fat. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 3:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
STEP 4:
Combine about 1 lb (2-1/3 cups) sauteed vegetables with each batch of potatoes.
STEP 5:
Combine salt and pepper.  Sprinkle about 2 tsp salt-pepper mixture over each batch of potatoes.  Stir lightly but thoroughly.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 10 oz fresh sweet pepper A.P. will yield 3 lb finely chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 8 oz (1½ qt) dehydrated green peppers; or 3 lb (2¼ qt) frozen diced green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 1 lb 5 oz (3 - 7-oz cn) canned pimientos may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 38 lb 2 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 31 lb peeled potatoes.
5.  In Step 2, 31 lb fresh, peeled, diced, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.
6.  In Step 2, 35 lb frozen, diced white potatoes may be used. Fry in 400°F. deep fat 5 minutes, loading fryer basket 1/3 full.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.
7.  In Step 5, potatoes and vegetables may be heated in oven. Place  about 5 lb 12 oz (1-1/8 gal) potato-vegetable mixture in each steam table pan (four 12x20x2½-inches).  Sprinkle salt-pepper mixture over potatoes in each pan.  Bake in 350°F. convection oven 8 to 10 minutes until thoroughly heated on high fan, open vent.
8.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3 to 4 Wedges) (2½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  450°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 8 lb (5-3/4 qt) potatoes (pared, cut in wedges 3x1½x1 inch) in each pan.
STEP 2:
Drizzle 2/3 cup melted butter or margarine over potatoes in each pan; stir gently to coat potatoes well.
STEP 3:
Mix salt, pepper and paprika together.  Sprinkle about 1½ tbsp mixture over potatoes in each pan.
STEP 4:
Bake 1 hour or until browned and done.  Turn potatoes once during cooking.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 1, 29 lb 8 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 24 lb pared potatoes.
2.  In Step 1, 24 lb fresh, peeled, whole, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.  Cut potatoes into wedges.
3.  In Step 4, in convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 25 to 30 minutes on high fan, open vent or until browned and done.
4.  In Step 1, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 6 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).  Place 4 lb (about 3 qt) potatoes on each pan.  In Step 2, drizzle 1/3 cup margarine or butter over each pan.  In Step 3, sprinkle about 2 tsp mixture over each pan.  In Step 4, bake at 350°F. 25 to 30 minutes with 100% microwave power throughout or until browned and done.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  FRANCONIA POTATOES:  In Step 1, partially cook potatoes in 16 lb (2 gal) water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot 10 minutes or partially cook potatoes in 15 lb PSI steam cooker 5 to 7 minutes or 5 lb PSI steam cooker 12 to 15 minutes.  Drain.  Place about 7 lb 15 oz (5-3/4 qt) partially cooked potatoes in each pan.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, bake potatoes 40 minutes or until browned and done or in 400°F. convection oven 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
2.  OVEN-GLO POTATOES:  In Step 1, partially cook potatoes in 16 lb (2 gal) water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot 10 minutes or partially cook potatoes in 15 lb PSI steam cooker, 5 to 7 minutes or 5 lb PSI steam cooker, 12 to 15 minutes.  Drain.  Use 3 steam table pans (12x20x4-inches). Place about 7 lb 15 oz (5-3/4 qt) partially cooked potatoes in each pan.  Thoroughly combine ingredients in Steps 2 and 3; omit paprika; add 1 lb (½ No.2½ cn) tomato paste or 1 lb 2 oz (36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate, 4 lb (2 qt) hot water and ¼ oz (2½ tsp) garlic powder; blend thoroughly.  Pour 2 lb 2 oz (1 qt) mixture over potatoes in each pan.  In Step 4, bake 40 minutes or in 400°F. convection oven 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3 to 4 Wedges) (4 Ounces).

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (5½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cover potatoes with 2-1/4 gallons water with 2 tbsp salt added; bring to a boil; cook 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Drain well.  Place about 8 lb 2 oz (1½ gal) potatoes in each pan.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Blend melted butter or margarine and flour together using wire whip; stir until smooth.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; bring to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.  Add milk to flour mixture stirring constantly.  Add salt and pepper.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 5:
Add cheese (Cheddar or American) and mustard flour to sauce.  Stir until cheese is melted.
STEP 6:
Pour about 2-1/3 qt sauce evenly over potatoes in each pan.
STEP 7:
Mix crumbs and melted butter or margarine.  Sprinkle about 1-1/3 cups crumbs over potatoes in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 45 minutes or until browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 31 lb 6 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 25 lb 8 oz peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 1, 25 lb 8 oz ready-to-use fresh peeled whole potatoes may be used.  Slice potatoes ¼-inch thick.
3.  In Step 1, potatoes may be cooked in steam cooker.  See Guidelines for Steam Cooking Vegetables,  Recipe Q-G-6.
4.  In Step 5, 8 oz (2 cups) canned dehydrated American cheese combined with 8 oz warm water may be used.
5.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until browned on low fan, open vent.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
7.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  POTATOES AU GRATIN  (POTATOES, WHITE, DEHYDRATED, SLICES):  In Step 1, use 5 lb 8 oz (3½ gal) dehydrated potato slices.  Bring 4½ gal water to a boil; add 2 oz (3 tbsp) salt; pour over potatoes.  Cover; bring to a boil; simmer until tender.  In Step 2, place about 6 lb 8 oz (4½ qt) cooked, drained potatoes in each pan.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, increase nonfat dry milk to 1 lb 7 oz (5-1/8 cups) and water to 6½ qt.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, pour about 2-3/4 qt sauce over potatoes in each pan.  Follow Steps 7 and 8.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (4 Pieces) (4 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  360°f. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook potatoes (peeled, cut in wedges 3x1½x1 inch) in steamer 5 to 7 minutes at 15 PSI or 12 to 15 minutes at 5 PSI. Drain.
STEP 2:
Fry until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 3:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
STEP 4:
Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 43 lb 1 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 35 lb peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 1, 35 lb fresh, peeled, whole, ready-to-use potatoes may be used.  Cut potatoes into wedges.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (5½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cover potatoes (white, fresh, peeled, ¼ in slices) with 2-1/4 gallons water salted with 2 tbsp salt; bring to a boil; cook 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Drain well.  Place about 8 lb 2 oz (1½ gal) potatoes in each greased pan.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Blend melted butter or margarine and flour together using wire whip; stir until smooth.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; bring to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.  Add milk to roux stirring constantly.  Add salt and pepper (black or white).  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 5:
Pour about 2-3/4 qt sauce over potatoes in each pan.  
STEP 6:
Bake 1 hour or until browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 31 lb 6 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 25 lb 8 oz peeled potatoes.
2.  In Step 1, potatoes may be cooked in steam cooker.  See Guidelines for Steam Cooking Vegetables, Recipe Q-G-6.
3.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until browned, on low fan, open vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
5.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

VARIATION:

1. SCALLOPED POTATOES AND ONIONS:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 2 lb 8 oz (2½ qt) thinly sliced dry onions (2 lb 
12 oz A.P.) or 5 oz (1-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions.  Place in layers with potatoes.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, reduce nonfat dry milk to 1 lb 7 oz (5¼ cups) and water to 13 lb (6½ qt).  In Step 5, pour 2½ qt sauce over potatoes and onions in each pan.  Follow Step 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (3½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Griddle

1.  Add potatoes to 6 gal boiling water salted with 3 tbsp salt.  Cover.  Bring quickly to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain well. (2 gallons water used for nutritional analysis.)
2.  Spread 1/3 layer of potatoes on greased griddle (salad oil or melted shortening).  Sprinkle with mixture of salt and pepper.  Cook 10 minutes or until golden brown.  Turn potatoes; continue to cook 10 minutes or until golden brown.  Preceed with remaining layers.

NOTE:

In Step 2, additional melted shortening or salad oil may be added to griddle, if needed, after turning potatoes.

VARIATIONS:

1.  LYONNAISE POTATOES:  In Step 1, rehydrate 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions.  Add to cooked potatoes.  Follow Step 2.
2.  O'BRIEN POTATOES:  In Step 1, rehydrate 2 oz (1½ cups) dehydrated green peppers.  Add peppers and 1 lb 15 oz (3 - 7-oz cn or 3/4 No.2½ cn) canned, chopped, drained pimientos to cooked potatoes.  Follow Step 2.
3.  HASHED BROWN POTATOES (POTATOES, WHITE, DEHYDRATED, SHREDDED HASH BROWN):  Omit Step 1. Use 5 lb 10 oz (2½ No.10 cn) dehydrated hashed brown potatoes.  Add 3-3/4 gal hot water and 2-3/4 oz (¼ cup) salt.  Stir.  Let stand 20 minutes; drain.  In Step 2, use 1 lb (2 cups) melted shortening or salad oil; cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (2 Ounces).  NOTE:  In Step 1, potatoes may be soaked covered in cold, salted water 8 hours refrigerated.  PRODUCT DOES NOT HOLD UP WELL ON STEAM TABLE.  PREPARE AS PROGRESSIVE COOKERY ITEM.
4.  HASHED BROWN POTATOES (POTATOES, WHITE, DEHYDRATED, DICED):  In Step 1, use 7 lb 8 oz (3-1/3 No.10 cn) dehydrated diced potatoes.  Simmer 15 minutes.  Follow Step 2.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (5½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add sliced potatotes and onions to5 gallons boiling water salted with 3 tbsp salt..  Cover.  Bring quickly to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 to 25 minutes or until tender.  Drain well. (2.5 gallons water used for absorbtion by potatoes and onions.)
STEP 2:
Place about 7 lb 4 oz (4-3/4 qt) potato mixture into each greased pan.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Blend melted butter or margarine and flour together; stir until smooth using wire whip.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.  Add milk to roux stirring constantly.  Add pepper (black or white).  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 5:
Pour about 3 qt sauce over potatoes in each pan.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle 1 tsp paprika over mixture in each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 45 minutes or until lightly browned.

NOTE:  

1.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
2.  One No.6 scoop may be used.
3.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until lightly browned on low fan, open vent.

VARIATIONS:

1.  SCALLOPED POTATOES (DEHYDRATED SLICED POTATOES):  In Step 1, use 5 lb 8 oz (3½ gal) dehydrated sliced potatoes; reduce water to 4½ gal.  Omit onions.  In Step 2, place about 6 lb 8 oz (4½ qt) cooked, drained potatoes in each pan.  Follow Steps 3 through 7.
2.  SCALLOPED POTATOES (DEHYDRATED DICED POTATOES):  In Step 1, use 5 lb 1 oz (2¼ - No.10 cn) dehydrated diced potatoes; reduce water to 4 gal; omit onions.  In Step 2, place about 7 lb (4-3/4 qt) cooked, drained potatoes in each pan.  Follow Steps 3 through 7.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3 Balls (3 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Rehydrate onions in 1 qt warm water 15 minutes.  Drain; set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Combine potatoes, dry milk, flour, salt, nutmeg, and thyme; mix well.
STEP 3:
Pour 6¼ qt boiling water into mixer bowl.
STEP 4:
At low speed, rapidly add dry ingredients.  Mix 1 minute or until well blended.
STEP 5:
Add onions.  Mix until well blended.
STEP 6:
Shape mixture into balls about 1 oz each.  Roll in potato granules.
STEP 7:
Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 8:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Blend potatoes and dry milk together.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Blend boiling water, butter or margarine, salt and pepper (black or white) in mixer bowl.
STEP 3:
At low speed, using wire whip, rapidly add potato and milk mixture to liquid; mix ½ minute.  Scrape down sides and bottom of bowl.
STEP 4:
Whip at high speed about 2 minutes or until light and fluffy.  DO NOT OVERWHIP.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 3, consistency may be controlled by reserving 2 qt hot liquid before adding potato mixture.  In Step 4, add liquid during whipping, until proper consistency is obtained.
2.  If potatoes become dry while standing on steam table, add hot milk or hot water; mix well.
3.  Overwhipping in Step 4 of basic recipe and variation will result in an excessive over yield.

VARIATION:

1.  GRILLED POTATO CAKES:  In Step 1, use 6 lb 2 oz (3¼ qt - 1 No.10 cn) instant potato grandules and 12 oz (2½ cup) nonfat dry milk.  In Step 2, use 2 gal boiling water, 12 oz (1½ cups) butter or margarine and 1¼ oz (2 tbsp) salt.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, whip at high speed 1 minute.  At low speed, blend 1 lb 3 oz (2¼ cups - 12 eggs) slightly beaten whole eggs into potatoes 1 minute.  Whip at medium speed ½ minute.  DO NOT OVERWHIP.  Chill mixture.  Shape into 4 oz cakes using 1 No.8 scoop.  Dredge cakes in 1 lb (1 qt) sifted general purpose flour.  Grill on well-greased 375°F. griddle about 3½ to 4 minutes per side or until golden brown.  EACH PORTION: 1 Cake (3 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine tomatoes, onions, peppers, celery, and pepper.  Mix well.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil to blend flavors.

NOTE: 

1.  In Step 1:  5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 oz chopped onions; 3 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2½ oz finely chopped peppers; and 5 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 oz finely chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, ½  oz (3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and ½ oz
(½ cup) dehydrated green peppers or 2½ oz (½ cup) frozen, diced green peppers may be used.
3.  Stewed tomatoes may be served chilled.

VARIATION:

1.  STEWED TOMATOES WITH CROUTONS:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Combine 1 lb 8 oz bread, cut in ½-inch cubes, with 
8 oz (1 cup) melted butter or margarine.  Toast in 325°F. oven 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.  Add to stewed tomatoes just before serving.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine sauerkraut, raw bacon, onions, apples, caraway seed, and brown sugar; cook 1½ hours, stirring occasionally.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions and 1 lb 4 oz fresh apples A.P. will yield 1 lb pared, chopped apples.
2.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain spinach; chop coarsely; place about 7 lb 8 oz (3-3/4 qt) in each pan.
STEP 2:
Cover spinach in each pan with 1 lb 4 oz (1¼ qt) cheese.  
STEP 3:
Combine cracker crumbs and melted butter or margarine; sprinkle about 10 oz (3 cups) crumbs over cheese in each pan.
STEP 4:
Cook bacon; drain fat.  Finely chop bacon.  Sprinkle about
1½ oz (1/3 cup) bacon over mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 45 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 27 lb frozen spinach may be used.  Cook spinach according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3; place about 3 qt chopped, drained spinach in each pan.
2.  In Step 3, DO NOT substitute bread crumbs for cracker crumbs.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
5.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated on low fan, open vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cut squash in half; remove seeds.  Cut into 4½ oz pieces.
STEP 2:
Place squash cut side up in pans.
STEP 3:
Add 1½ cups warm water to each pan.  Cover pans.
STEP 4:
Bake 1 hour or until tender.
STEP 5:
Combine melted butter or margarine, 1 cup water, brown sugar, 1 tbsp cinnamon (optional), and salt; mix well.  Simmer about 5 minutes or until heated thoroughly in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  
STEP 6:
Pour brown sugar sauce over squash in each pan.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 32 lb 8 oz fresh hubbard squash A.P. will yield 29 lb squash.
2.  In Step 1, 34 lb 12 oz acorn squash (40 lb A.P.) may be used.  Cut in half, lengthwise; remove seeds.  In Step 2, place cut side up in 10 steam table pans.  Follow Steps 3 through 6. EACH PORTION:  1 Squash Half (5 Ounces).
3.  In Step 4, in convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 1 hour or until tender on high fan, closed vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (4½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter, margarine or salad oil until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine sauteed onions, squash, and water.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add tomatoes, salt, sugar, pepper, garlic, and parsley.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 21 lb fresh summer squash A.P. will yield 20 lb sliced summer squash.
3.  In Step 2, 20 lb frozen sliced summer squash may be used. In Step 3, simmer 5 minutes.
4.  In Step 4, 3 tsp (3 cloves) dry garlic, minced may be used.
5.  In Step 4, ¼ cup dehydrated parsley may be used.
6.  In Step 4, 3 oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 2 oz chopped parsley.
7.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
