1.  NEW ENGLAND BOILED DINNER (PRECOOKED FROZEN CORNED BEEF):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, place 30 lb thawed precooked corned beef on 2 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  In Step 5, bake 45 to 50 minutes or in 300°F. convection oven 30 to 35 minutes or until meat thermometer registers 140°F. on high fan, closed vent.  Follow Step 6.  In Step 7, reconstitute 8 oz (1¼ cups) ham Soup and Gravy base with 8 gal water to make reserve liquid.  Follow Steps 8 through 10.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Potatoes Ckd In Skin Peeled Unsalt-2.5"

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  3 to 4 Thin Slices (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  325°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 43.5 lb raw, whole pieces of corned beef in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; cover with water.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat; simmer 2½ hours.  Remove scum as it rises to surface.
STEP 3:
Remove corned beef from liquid.
STEP 4:
Place corned beef in roasting pans.
STEP 5:
Bake 1 hour or until tender.
STEP 6:
Let stand 15 to 20 minutes before slicing.  Slice into 3/16-inch slices.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, meat may be simmered 5 hours or until tender.  Omit Steps 4 and 5.  After 3 hours, test each piece of meat with fork to determine tenderness.
2.  Because the grain of brisket varies within a cut, turn meat while carving to ensure cutting across grain to prevent shredding.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 5, corned beef may be placed on racks.

VARIATIONS:

1.  APPLE GLAZED CORNED BEEF:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, combine 4-1/3 qt (3 - No.3 cyl cn) canned apple juice, ½ cup soy sauce, 3/4 cups Worcestershire sauce, 2 cups vinegar, 1 oz (5 tbsp) mustard flour, and 1 lb (2-1/8 cups) packed brown sugar; blend well; pour over meat in roasting pans.  In Step 5, base every 15 minutes.  Follow Step 6.
2.  BAKED CORNED BEEF (PRECOOKED FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, place 30 lb thawed precooked corned beef on 2 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Bake 45 to 50 minutes or in 300°F. convection oven 30 to 35 minutes or until meat thermometer registers 140°F. on high fan, closed vent.  Follow Step 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Frankfurters Plus
                              ½ Cup Sauerkraut (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Heat sauerkraut to a simmer.  Drain excess liquid.
STEP 2:
Place 3 qt sauerkraut in each pan.  Arrange 50 frankfurters on top of sauerkraut in each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until frankfurters reach an internal temperature of 170°F.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 20 to 25 minutes or until frankfurters reach an internal temperature of 170°F. on low fan, open vent.
2.  Sauerkraut and frankfurters may be layered.  Place 1½ qt sauerkraut in each pan; arrange frankfurters on top; cover with remaining sauerkraut.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  BAKED KNOCKWURST WITH SAUERKRAUT:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 20 lb (100 each) knockwurst.  Arrange 25 knockwurst to top of sauerkraut in each pan.  Follow Step 3.  EACH PORTION:  1 Knockwurst and ½ cup sauerkraut.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan (3)
                    18x26-inch Sheet Pan (6)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Make one recipe Teriyaki Marinade (7604.28 g).
(3.125 lb sauce used for nutritional anaysis.)
STEP 3:
Place 27 lb 6 oz chicken in each roasting pan.
STEP 4:
Pour 3 qt marinade over chicken in each pan; cover; refrigerate 45 minutes.  Turn chicken after 20 minutes.
STEP 5:
Arrange chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 6:
Bake 70 minutes or until done (180°F.).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths), or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered, may be used.
2.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.).
3. Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  4½ Ounces Fish plus
                              ¼ Cup (2½ Ounces) Sauce
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Separate fillets or steaks, cut into 4½ oz portions, if necessary. Arrange single layers of fish on lightly greased pans.
STEP 2:
Saute onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil in stock pan or steam-jacketed kettle until tender.
STEP 3:
Add Barbecue Sauce, mushrooms, and lemon juice to sauteed onions.  Bring sauce to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Pour 7½ cups sauce evenly over fish in each pan.  Cover.
STEP 5:
Bake 20 minutes; uncover; bake 10 minutes or until done.
STEP 6:
Serve fish with ¼ cup (1 - Size-1 ladle) sauce.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 3, Barbecue Sauce Mix may be used.  Prepare 4½ qt sauce according to instructions on container.
3.  In Step 3, 4½ Barbecue Sauce (Recipe No. O-2) may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 12 oz fresh lemons A.P. (3 lemons) will yield ½ cup juice.
5.  In Step 5, baking time will vary depending upon type and thickness of fish.
6.  In Step 5, fish is done when it easily flakes with a fork.
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Light Tuna Fish w/Water Drnd-12.5oz Can
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (5½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add 1-2/3 tbsp salt and 1-1/3 tbsp salad oil to 5 gallons water; heat to a rolling boil.
STEP 2:
Add macaroni slowly while stirring constantly until water boils again.  Cook about 8 to 10 minutes or until tender.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Drain thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Drain tuna and flake.  Thoroughly mix tuna and macaroni.
STEP 4:
Add chopped eggs (2.5 lb is 24 eggs), celery, onions, pickle relish, pimientos, and pepper to tuna-macaroni mixture.  Toss lightly until well blended.
STEP 5:
Add Salad Dressing to tuna-macaroni mixture.  Toss lightly.
STEP 6:
Garnish with parsley and paprika.
STEP 7:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, rotini, shell macaroni or tortellini may be used.
2.  In Step 3, 16 - 12½ oz or 13 oz cn tuna may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb diced celery.
4.  In Step 4, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
5.  In Step 4, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
6.  In Step 5, 5 lb (2½ qt) fat-free Salad Dressing may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN-ROTINI SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 3 lb 12 oz rotini.  In Step 3, use 12 lb 1 oz (6-2/3 - 29 oz cn)
canned chicken.  Drain and flake chicken.  Thoroughly mix chicken and rotini.  Follow Steps 4 through 7.  Note:  30 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole, thawed may be used.  Follow Steps 1 through 3 of Recipe No. L-151.  Reduce water to 34 lb (4¼ gal); bay leaves to 1/64 oz (4 leaves).

YIELD :  100 Portions (8 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Slices (3 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cut canned luncheon meat into 1-3/4 oz slices.
STEP 2:
Place 27 slices luncheon meat on each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 5 minutes on low fan, open vent.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  GRILLED LUNCHEON MEAT:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Use 10 oz (1¼ cups) salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil.  Grill on lightly greased 350°F. griddle 1 minute per side or until lightly browned.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (7 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  325°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place hot water and salt in a steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Add 50 lb ready-to-cook, cut-up, thawed rabbit; cook 30 minutes.  Drain thoroughly.  Cool.
STEP 2:
Dredge each piece in mixture of flour, salt, pepper, and garlic; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; add beaten eggs.
STEP 4:
Dip each piece in milk and egg mixture; drain.
STEP 5:
Dredge each piece in dry bread crumbs; shake off excess.
STEP 6:
Fry 2 to 3 minutes or until done.
STEP 7:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

VARIATION:

1.  FRIED MARINATED RABBIT:  In Step 1, use 4 gal water and 1 cup vinegar.  Place 25 lb rabbit in each roasting pan 
(2 -18x24-inches); pour sufficient marinade to cover rabbit.  Cover; refrigerate 4 hours.  Drain thoroughly.  Follow remainder Step 1 and Steps 2 through 7.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  4 Ounces
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Separate thawed fillets or steaks; cut into 4½ oz portions, if necessary.  Arrange single layers of fish on lightly greased pans.
STEP 2:
Combine lemon juice, margarine or butter, salt and paprika.  Mix well.  Drizzle 3/4 cup mixture over fish in each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 4:
Garnish with parsley before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, if flounder/sole fillets are used, place fillets on 5 pans.  In Step 3, bake 15 minutes or in 325°F. convection oven 7 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
2.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz lemons A.P. (9 lemons) will yield 1½ cups juice.
3.  In Step 2, 3-3/4 oz (3/8 cup) frozen lemon juice concentrate and 9 oz (1-1/8 cups) cold water may be used for juice.
4.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 to 20 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
5.  In Step 3, if microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 425°F. 5 minutes with 80% microwave power throughout.  Use 8 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).
6.  In Step 3, fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork.
7.  In Step 3, baking time will vary with type and thickness of fish.
8.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED FISH WITH GARLIC BUTTER:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, reduce lemon juice to 4 oz (½ cup) (3 lemons -- 12 oz A.P.); increase melted margarine or butter to 1 lb 8 oz (3 cups); reduce salt to 2/3 oz (1 tbsp); omit paprika; add 3/4 oz (3 tbsp) garlic powder.  Follow remainder of Step 2.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  ONION-LEMON BAKED FISH:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, combine lemon juice with 12 oz (1½ cups) melted margarine or butter, salt and paprika.  Saute 2 lb (1½ qt) chopped onions 
(2 lb 4 oz A.P.) in 4 oz (½ cup) melted margarine or butter until tender.  Follow remainder of Step 2.  Distribute 1 cup sauteed onions over fish in each pan.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
3.  LEMON BAKED FISH:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 1 lb (2 cups) lemon juice (12 lemons -- 3 lb A.P.).  Combine lemon juice, 12 oz (1½ cups) margarine or butter, salt and paprika.  Follow remainder of Step 2.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
4.  HERBED BAKED FISH:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit paprika; combine lemon juice, margarine or butter and salt.  Add 1/32 oz (1 tsp) crushed basil, 1/20 oz (1 tsp) ground thyme, 1/18 oz (1 tsp) ground tarragon, 1/50 oz (1 tsp) ground marjoram and 1/27 oz (1 tsp) whole dillweed.  Follow remainder of Step 2.  Follow Step 3.  Omit Step 4.
5.  MUSTARD-DILL BAKED FISH:     Follow Step 1.  Omit Step 2.  Combine 1 lb (2 cups) lemon juice (12 lemons -- 3 lb A.P.), 1 lb (2 cups) melted margarine or butter, 9 oz (1 cup) prepared mustard, 3½ oz (½ cup) granulated sugar, ¼ oz (2 tbsp) whole dillweed and 1/8 oz (1¼ tsp) garlic powder.  Mix well.  Drizzle about 1-1/3 cups sauce mixture over fish in each pan.  Follow Step 3.  Omit Step 4.
6.  FISH AMANDINE:  Spread 1 lb (3 cups -- ½ No.5 cn) shelled slivered almonds in 1 sheet pan (18x26-inches) in a thin layer.  Heat in 350°F. oven about 12 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until almonds are lightly browned or in 300°F. convection oven 12 to 15 minutes on high fan, open vent.  Remove from oven.  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Sprinkle 4 oz (3/4 cup) toasted almonds over fish in each pan.  Omit Step 4.
7.  CAJUN BAKED FISH:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit paprika; follow remainder of Step 2.  Combine ½ oz (2 tbsp) onion powder, 1/8 oz (2 tbsp) crushed oregano, ½ oz (2 tbsp) ground paprika, 1/3 oz (1 tbsp) garlic powder, 1/64 oz (1 tbsp) ground red pepper and ¼ oz (1 tbsp) black pepper; mix thoroughly.  Sprinkle 2 tbsp mixture evenly over fish in each pan.  Follow Step 3.  Omit Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  4½ Ounces Fish plus
                              ¼ Cup Dressing
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute celery and onions in melted butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine cracker crumbs, pepper, and thyme; add to vegetables.
STEP 3:
Add water to vegetable-crumb mixture; toss mixture but DO NOT pack.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Separate thawed fillets; cut into 2¼ oz pieces.  Place 50 pieces on each greased pan.
STEP 5:
Place ¼ cup (1 No.16 scoop) vegetable-crumb mixture on each piece.  Cover with second fish piece.
STEP 6:
Combine lemon juice and melted butter or margarine; pour over fish in each pan.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle salt and paprika over fish.
STEP 8:
Bake about 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 6, 1 lb fresh lemons A.P. (4 lemons) will yield 3/4 cup juice.  
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (5½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Rinse shrimp; drain.  Place 7 lb 8 oz shrimp on each pan.
STEP 2:
Add 15 oz (1-7/8 cups) diced tomatoes to each pan.
STEP 3:
Combine melted margarine or butter, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, parsley, and pepper.  Blend well; mixture will separate.
STEP 4:
While stirring, ladle about 14 oz (1-3/4 cup) scampi sauce over the shrimp and tomatoes in each pan.  Toss lightly but thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Cover, bake 20 minutes; uncover, stir; bake 10 minutes or until shrimp are done.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Remove from oven.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle 4 oz (1 cup) bread crumbs evenly over the top of each pan.  Stir to blend crumbs with liquid to thicken sauce.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, other sizes and types of pans may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 37 lb 3 oz IQF shrimp A.P. will yield 30 lb thawed shrimp.
3.  In Step 1, dehydrated shrimp may be used.  See Guidelines for Using Shrimp, L-G-2.
4.  In Step 2, 3 lb (8-3/4 cups) chopped fresh tomatoes (3 lb
1 oz A.P.) may be used.
5.  In Step 2, 2 lb 8 oz fresh lemons A.P. (10 lemons) will yield 2 cups lemon juice.
6.  In Step 3, 5-7/8 oz (1¼ cups) garlic powder may be used.
7.  In Step 3, 8 oz (1 qt) chopped fresh parsley (8½ oz A.P.) may be used.
8.  In Step 5, if a convection oven is used, cover; bake at 350°F. 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  Uncover; stir, bake 5 minutes or until shrimp are done.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Remove from oven.
9.  Shrimp Scampi may be served with steamed pasta, Recipe No.E-4 or steamed rice, Recipe No.E-5.
10.  No.6 Scoop may be used.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  4 Ounces

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Separate thawed fillets or steaks; cut into 4½ oz portions, if necessary.
STEP 2:
Dredge fish in mixture of crumbs, flour, salt, and pepper; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Use 1 qt salad oil to fry in hot shallow fat (1/8-inch deep).  Brown 2 to 4 minutes on each side; turn carefully.
STEP 4:
Drain well on absorbent paper. (2 cups corn oil used for nutritional analysis.)

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) cornmeal may be used for bread crumbs.
2.  In Step 3, fish may be cooked on well greased 350°F. griddle.
3.  In Step 3, frying time for fish will vary with type and thickness of fish.

VARIATIONS:

1.  TEMPURA FISH:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Use 3/4 recipe Tempura Batter (Recipe No.D-38).  For flounder/sole fillets, use 1 recipe Tempura Batter.  Dip fish into batter.  Drain.  Fry in 365°F. deep fat 2 to 4 minutes or until golden brown.  Follow Step 4.
2.  DEEP FAT FRIED FISH:    Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Fry in 365°F. deep fat 2 to 4 minutes or until golden brown.  Follow Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  4 Ounces
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Separate thawed fish fillets; cut into 4½ oz portions, if necessary.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.
STEP 3:
Dip fillets into milk mixture.  Drain.
STEP 4:
Dredge fillets in crumb mixture; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Place fillets in a single layer on each well-greased pan.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle 3/4 cup salad oil, melted shortening or margarine over fillets in each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 7, baking time will vary depending upon type and thickness of fish.
2.  In Step 7, fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork.
3.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F., 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown on high fan, open vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
5.  To avoid overwetting crumbs, dredge in small batches.
6.  For thinner fish, use 6 sheet pans.  Drizzle ½ cup salad oil, melted shortening or margarine over fillets in each pan.

VARIATION:

1.  OVEN FRIED FISH (DEHYDRATED FISH SQUARES):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 5 lb (8 - No.10 cn) canned, dehydrated fish squares.  Stack squares not more than 3 layers deep in roasting pans (18x24 inches).  Cover with 3 gal cool water.  Soak until all portions are moistened (3 to 8 minutes).  Drain.  Cover; let stand 30 minutes or longer to equalize moisture.  Reconstitute 2½ oz (½ cup) nonfat dry milk in 1¼ cups water; add 2 lb (1 qt) whole beaten eggs, 3½ oz (5 tbsp) salt, and 1 tbsp black pepper.  Dip fillets into mixture; drain well.  Follow Steps 4 through 7.  EACH PORTION:  1½
Squares.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Mrs. Paul's Breaded Fish Portions  CAM
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  3½ Ounces
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place precooked, frozen, breaded fish on ungreased pans.
STEP 2:
Bake 24 to 26 minutes or until browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, portions should not touch each other while baking.
2.  In Step 1, DO NOT thaw fish portions before baking.
3.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 20 to 22 minutes or until browned on high fan, open vent.
4.  In Step 2, if microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 425°F. 15 minutes with 100% microwave power first 3 minutes.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED FISH PORTIONS (BATTER DIPPED):  In Step 1, use 37 lb 8 oz frozen battered dipped fish portions.  In Step 2,
bake 35 minutes.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces.
2.  FRENCH FRIED FISH PORTIONS:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 25 lb frozen breaded fish portions.  Fry in 350°F. deep fat 4 to 4½ minutes or until lightly browned.  Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.  NOTE:  DO NOT overcook or overbrown.  Portions will rise to surface when cooked.
3.  FRENCH FRIED FISH PORTIONS (BATTER DIPPED):
Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 37 lb 8 oz frozen batter dipped fish portions.  Fry in 350°F. deep fat 4 to 4½ minutes or until lightly browned.  Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces.
4.  FISH AND CHIPS: Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Follow Variation 1. Prepare Recipe Nos. Q-45-1 or Q-45-5, French Fried Potatoes.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces Fish and 1 Cup (4 Ounces) potatoes.
5.  BAKED FISH NUGGETS:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 34 lb fish nuggets, breaded, frozen.  Place about 5 lb 10 oz nuggets on each sheet pan (6 pans).  Bake in 450°F. oven 16 to 18 minutes or in 425°F. convection oven 14 to 16 minutes on high fan, closed vent or until lightly browned.  EACH PORTION:  6 Nuggets (About 4 Ounces).
6.  FRENCH FRIED FISH NUGGETS:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 34 lb fish nuggets, breaded, frozen.  Fry in 350°F. deep fat 4 minutes or until lightly browned.  Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.  EACH PORTION:  6 Nuggets (4½ Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  4½ Ounces
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Separate thawed fillets; cut into 4½ oz portions, if necessary. Dip fillets in French dressing; place fillets in single layer on sheet pans.
STEP 2:
Crush potato chips and combine with cheese.  Sprinkle about 1 qt mixture over fish in each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 10 minutes or until done.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 recipe French Dressing (Recipe No.M-58) may be used.
2.  In Step 2, other types of fish fillets may be used.  Baking time will vary with type and thickness of fish.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 3, fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork.
5.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake 7 minutes, or until done on high fan, closed vent.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  6 Oysters
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Dredge oysters in mixture of flour, salt, and pepper; shake off excess.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; add beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs).
STEP 3:
Dip floured oysters in milk and egg mixture; drain.
STEP 4:
Dredge oysters in cracker crumbs until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Fry about 5 minutes or until lightly browned. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutrtional analysis.)
STEP 6:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, other types of oysters may be used.  See Guidelines of Using Oysters (Recipe No.L-G-1).
2.  In Step 1, 24 lb oysters A.P. will yield 14 lb oysters E.P.
3.  In Step 3, 10 oz (2½ cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with 3 cups water may be used.
4.  In Step 4, 5 lb (1 gal) dry bread crumbs or 5 lb (13-3/4 cups) cornmeal may be used for cracker crumbs.

VARIATION:

1.  FRIED OYSTERS (BREADED, FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 25 lb oysters, breaded, frozen.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, fry 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned.  Follow Step 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Lobster

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Plunge first batch (25 live lobsters) head first individually into 7 gallons fast boiling water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot add 1-1/3 tbsp salt per gallon water. Bay leaves may be added if desired.  (Using tongs, grasp each lobster firmly by middle of back with claws held away; plunge head first into water.)  Water must cover lobsters.
STEP 2:
Cover.  Bring water to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes or until lobsters turn a brilliant red.  Remove lobsters.
STEP 3:
Follw Steps 1 and 2 for remaining batches.  Replenish water as needed to ensure lobsters are covered.
TO PREPARE FOR SERVING:
STEP 4:
Place lobster on back.  Using a sharp knife, make quick incision at mouth; draw knife quickly down entire length of body and tail.  Be careful not to break the stomach or "lady" (a mall sac just back of head).  
STEP 5:
Spread body flat.  Remove, with your hand, black colored intestinal vein which runs from head to tail.  Remove and discard lobster's stomach or "lady" and spongy tissue.  Leave green liver and red "coral" roe, if any.
STEP 6:
Crack claws with a mallet.

NOTE:

1.  Cook 100 lobsters in batches of 25.  Be sure each lobster is alive.  When picked up, if the tail is stretched out flat, it should snap back.
2.  Serve lobster with melted or drawn butter or margarine in side dish.  Allow about 3 tbsp per serving.  DRAWN BUTTER OR MARGARINE:  Melt 10 lb butter or margarine at low heat. When melted, remove from heat; let stand a few minutes to allow milk solids to settle to bottom.  Pour off butter or margarine fat from milk solids; place in a container.  This is drawn butter or margarine ready for use.
3.  Serve with lemon wedges (13 lemons (3 lb 4 oz A.P.) sliced in eights) and parsley garnish.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BOILED SPINY LOBSTER TAIL:  Omit Steps 1 through 3. Use 50 lb frozen Spiny Lobster tail, 100 - 8 oz tails or 200 - 4 oz tails.  Drop frozen tails in boiling salt water to cover (allow
1-1/3 tbsp salt per gal water).  Return water to a boil; simmer 15 minutes or until tails turn a brilliant red or bright orange.  Drain.  Slit underside of tail lengthwise; remove membrane.  Serve with drawn butter or margarine (about 3 tbsp) and lemon wedges.  Garnish with parsley.
2.  BOILED LOBSTER (FROZEN WHOLE LOBSTER):  In Step 1, use 100 lb frozen whole lobsters.  Follow Steps 2 through 6.
3.  BOILED KING CRAB LEGS (GRAB LEGS, ALASKAN KING, FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 50 lb (100) Alaskan King Crab Legs.  Drop legs in about 7 gal boiling water in steam-jacketed kettle or larger stock pot.  Add 6 bay leaves (optional) and 4 oz (½ cup lemon juice (12 oz (3 lemons) fresh lemons A.P.).  Bring water to boil; reduce heat. Cover.  Simmer 10 minutes.  Remove legs.  Serve with drawn butter or margarine (about 3 tbsp) and lemon wedges.  Garnish with parsley.  EACH PORTION:  1 Leg (5 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Cakes (5 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  360°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain salmon; reserve liquid for use in Step 3.  Remove; discard skin.  Flake salmon and mash bones.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Combine instant potatoes, dry milk and salt.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Heat water, salmon liquid and butter or margarine to boiling; pour into mixer bowl.
STEP 4:
Add potato mixture rapidly to hot mixture.  Whip unil smooth.
STEP 5:
Cool potato mixture.
STEP 6:
Combine salmon, cooled potato mixture, beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs), onions, and pepper.  Mix thoroughly.  Chill.
STEP 7:
Shape into 3 inch diameter cakes 1½ inches thick, weighing about 2½ oz each.
STEP 8:
Dredge each cake in flour; shake off excess.
STEP 9:
Fry 2 to 3 minutes or until browned. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 10:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  In Steps 2 through 4, fresh potatoes may be used for instant potatoes.  Omit ingredients; prepare ½ recipe Mashed Potatoes (Recipe No. Q-48).  Use salmon liquid for part of water.
2.  In Step 6, 13 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 6, 1½ oz (½ cup) dehydrated onions may be used.  
4.  In Step 9, cakes may be cooked on greased, preheated 350°F. griddle 3 to 5 minutes per side.
RecipeItem/9/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Slice (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain salmon; reserve 1½ qt juice.  Remove and discard skin and bones.  Flake salmon.  Set salmon and juice aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Saute celery and onions in melted butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 3:
Combine salmon, salmon juice, and sauteed vegetables with bread crumbs, beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs), and pepper.  Mix lightly but thoroughly.
STEP 4:
Shape into 8 - 3 lb 4 oz loaves; place 4 loaves crosswise in each lightly greased pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 45 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 6:
Cut 13 slices per loaf.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 13 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 5 oz chopped celery; 1 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yeild 1 lb 5 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 2½ oz (2/3 cup plus 3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. about 35 minutes or until lightly browned on high fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 2½ qt salmon (drained, without skin or bones, flaked) in each greased pan.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 3:
Blend flour, salt, and melted butter or margarine together; stir until smooth.
STEP 4:
Add flour mixture to milk, stirring constantly.  Cook 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 5:
Add onions and paprika to sauce; cook 5 minutes.
STEP 6:
Place 1½ qt peas over salmon.  Mix carefully.  Pour 2 qt sauce over mixture; stir until lightly mixed.
STEP 7:
Combine bread crumbs and melted butter or margarine.  Sprinkle 3 cups buttered crumbs over mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 30 minutes or until browned.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 5, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 5, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F., 20 minutes or until browned, on low fan, open vent.

VARIATION:

1.  SCALLOPED TUNA AND PEAS:  In Step 1, omit salmon; use 18 lb (23 - 12½ to 13 oz cn or 4½ - 66.5 oz cn) canned tuna.  Follow Steps 2 through 8.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Chunk Light Tuna Fish w/Wtr-Cnd DLM-SK
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain tuna; discard liquid.  Flake tuna; combine with celery, onions, nuts and chow mein noodles.
STEP 2:
Combine soup with tuna mixture.
STEP 3:
Pour an equal quantity of tuna-soup mixture into each pan.
STEP 4:
Sprinkle about 2 qt noodles over mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until heated thoroughly.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 18 -12½ to 13 oz cn canned tuna may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 14 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 10 lb 8 oz sliced celery; 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb thinly sliced onions.
3.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: S&W Chunk Light TunaIn Water-Cnd  SWF
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4-3/4 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain tuna and flake.  Discard liquid.
STEP 2:
Add chopped, hard cooked eggs, celery and chopped pickles to tuna.  Toss lightly until well blended.
STEP 3:
Add Salad Dressing to tuna mixture.  Toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add tuna salad.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 26 - 12½ to 13 oz cn tuna may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 10 lb 15 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 lb chopped celery.
3.  In Step 2, 4 oz (½ cup) chopped pimiento may be used.
4.  In Step 4, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.

VARIATION:

1.  SALMON SALAD:  In Step 1, omit tuna; use 19 lb 6 oz (20 - No.15½ cn) canned salmon.  Drain; remove and discard skin and bones.  Flake.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.

RecipeItem/0/_ItemName: Chunk Light Tuna Fish w/Wtr-Cnd DLM-SK
RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Drain tuna; flake.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 2:
Cook egg noodles in 2-1/4 gallon boiling water with 1-1/3 tbsp salt. 8 minutes or until tender.  Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 3:
Blend flour, salt, and melted shortening or salad oil together using a wire whip; stir until smooth.
STEP 4:
Reconstitue dry milk with warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 5:
Add milk to roux, stirring constantly.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 6:
Add celery and onions to sauce; bring to a boil; stirring constantly.
STEP 7:
Combine tuna, noodles and pimientos with sauce.  Mix well.
STEP 8:
Pour about 13 lb 12 oz (6½ qt) mixture into each greased pan.
STEP 9:
Combine crumbs, melted butter or margarine and paprika.  Sprinkle about 4½ oz (2 cup) over mixture in each pan.
STEP 10:
Bake about 45 minutes or until lightly browned and bubbly.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 35 - 6½-7 oz cn or 19 - 12-1/3 -13 oz cn canned tuna may be used.
2.  In Step 6, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A. P. will yield 4 lb celery, sliced thin; 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 10 oz finely chopped onions.
3.  In Step 6, 1¼ oz (7tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 10, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 35 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  BAKED TUNA AND NOODLES (SOUP, CONDENSED, CREAM OF MUSHROOM):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Steps 3 through 5.  In Step 6, use 18 lb 12 oz (6 - No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed cream of mushroom soup.  Reconstitute 12 oz (2-3/4 cups) nonfat dry milk with 3½ qt warm water.  Add milk, celery and onions.  Blend; cover, heat to a simmer.  Follow Step 7.  In Step 8, pour about 13 lb 10 oz (6½ qt) mixture into each greased pan.  Follow Steps 9 and 10.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  6 to 12 Scallops (5 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed scallops thoroughly; cut large ones in half.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Dredge scallops in mixture of flour, salt, pepper & paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute milk; add beaten eggs.
STEP 4:
Dip floured scallops in milk and egg mixture.  Drain.
STEP 5:
Dredge scallops in crumbs until well coated.
STEP 6:
Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 7:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 6 oz (1½ cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with scant 2 cups warm water may be used.

YIELD:  100 Poritons
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare 2 recipes Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Keep hot for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Wash thawed scallops thoroughly; cut large ones in half.  Drain well.
STEP 3:
Cook scallops in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot using 3-1/2 gallons water for 3 to 4 minutes.  DO NOT OVERCOOK. Drain well immediately.
STEP 4:
Add cooked scallops to sauce; bring to simmer; cook 2 to 3 minutes.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CREOLE FISH:  In Step 1, prepare 3/4 recipe Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Omit Steps 2 through 5.  Use 25 lb fish portions, frozen, raw, breaded.  Fry in 350°F. deep fat 3 minutes or until lightly browned.  Drain well on absorbent paper.  Ladle 2 oz (¼ cup - 1 Size-1 ladle) over each fish portion just before serving.  EACH PORTION:  1 Fish Portion (3½ Ounces) plus ¼ Cup Sauce (2 Ounces).
2.  CREOLE FISH FILLETS:  In Step 1, prepare 3/4 recipe
Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Omit Steps 2 through 5.  Use 30 lb fish fillets, thawed.  Separate fillets; cut into 4½ ounces. Arrange in single layer in 7 (12x20x2½-inch) steam table pans. Ladle 2 oz (¼ cup - 1 Size-1 ladle) over each fish fillet.  Bake in 375°F. oven 25 minutes or in 325°F. convection oven 15 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.  NOTE: if flounder, sole or cod fillets are used, bake 15 minutes or in convection oven 7 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  EACH PORTION:  1 Piece with Sauce (5 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8 Ounces) plus
                              3/4 Cup (4½ Ounces) Rice

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place shrimp in 3 gallons boiling water; cover; return to boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes; drain.  Refrigerate for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Prepare 2-1/3 recipes Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine rice, 2-3/4 gallons cold water, salt and salad oil; bring to a boil.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 4:
Cover tightly; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.  DO NOT STIR.
STEP 5:
Add shrimp to sauce; simmer until shrimp are heated through.
DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 6:
Serve over rice.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, other types of unbreaded shrimp may be used.
2.  In Step 1, if shrimp is steam cooked, omit water.  See Recipe No.L-G-5.
3.  One Size 3 ladle may be used.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD: 100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  4 to 8 Shrimp
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash shrimp; drain well.
STEP 2:
Dredge shrimp in mixture of flour, salt, pepper and paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Combine beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs) and water.  Dip shrimp in egg mixture; drain well.
STEP 4:
Dredge shrimp in crumbs until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Fry 2 minutes or until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 6:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, other types of shrimp may be used.  See Guidelines of Using Shrimp, Recipe No.L-G-2.
2.  In Step 3, 10 oz (2½ cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with 3 cups warm water may be used.  

VARIATIONS:

1.  TEMPURA SHRIMP:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Prepare 1½ gal Tempura Batter (Recipe No.D-38). Dip shrimp into batter.  In Step 5, deep fat fry 2½ minutes or until golden brown.  Follow Step 6.
2.  FRENCH FRIED SHRIMP (BREADED, FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 38 lb shrimp, breaded, frozen.  DO NOT allow frozen breaded shrimp to thaw before cooking.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, fry 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown. Follow Step 6.  EACH PORTION:  7 to 10 Shrimp.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Sweet Green Bell Peppers Chpd Ckd-Drnd
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place shrimp in 3 gallons boiling water; cover, return to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 3 to 5 minutes; drain.
STEP 2:
Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 3:
Saute onions and peppers in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 4:
Add flour to salad oil or melted shortening; blend thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Cook until well browned, stirring frequently.
STEP 6:
Gradually add hot water to flour mixture; cook until thick and smooth, stirring constantly.
STEP 7:
Add sauteed vegetables.
STEP 8:
Add apples, celery, curry powder, ginger, red pepper, garlic, horseradish and salt; simmer 20 minutes.
STEP 9:
Add shrimp, mushrooms and lemon juice; simmer 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 14 oz (3½ - No.10 cn) canned, dehydrated, cooked shrimp may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No.L-G-2.
2.  In Step 1, 25 lb shrimp, raw, unpeeled may be used.  See Guidelines for Steam Cooking Shellfish, Recipe No.L-G-4.
3.  In Step 3, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
4.  In Step 3, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions and 5¼ oz (1 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb (1½ qt) frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
5.  In Step 8, 5 lb 2 oz fresh apples A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped pared apples; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
6.  In Step 8, 10 tbsp (30 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.  Saute with onions and pepper.
7.  In Step 9, 3 - 8Z cn canned mushrooms may be used.
8.  In Step 9, 1 lb 2 oz lemons A.P. (4 lemons) will yield 3/4 cup juice.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (3½ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place shrimp in 3 gallons boiling water; cover; return to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 3 to 5 minutes; drain.  Chill.
STEP 2:
Cut shrimp into halves or quarters depending on size.
STEP 3:
Combine shrimp, celery, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
STEP 4:
Cover; refrigerate to chill thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Just before serving, add Salad Dressing; toss lightly.
STEP 6:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add salad, cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 14 oz (3½ - No.10 cn) canned, dehydrated, cooked shrimp may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No.L-G-2.
2.  In Step 1, 25 lb shrimp, raw, unpeeled, may be used.  See Guidelines for Steam Cooking Shellfish, Recipe No.L-G-4.
3.  In Step 3, 10 lb 15 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 8 oz lemons A.P. (6 lemons) will yield 1 cup juice.
4.  In Step 6, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lett

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (6 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Add partially thawed fish fillets, thawed scallops, and thawed shrimp to 4 gallons boiling water in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Return to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain.  Reserve liquid for use in Step 3.  Place 6 lb 12 oz ( 1 gal) fish, scallops and shrimp in each pan (3 - 12x20x2½-inch steam-table pans).  Set aside for use in Step 7.  Keep hot.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with reserved liquid (8½ qt).  Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Blend butter or margarine and flour to make roux; stir until smooth.  Add milk to roux stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Add salt, paprika and nutmeg.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 6:
Add about 1 qt sauce to beaten egg yolks while constantly stirring.  Pour egg mixture slowly back into remaining sauce.  Stir to blend well.
STEP 7:
Pour 3¼ qt sauce over seafood in each pan.  Stir gently.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 6, 1 lb 11 oz (15) whole eggs A.P. will yield 8 oz egg yolks.
2.  In Step 7, if sauce is too thick, add 1 cup heated reserved liquid in each pan before serving.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Cakes (5 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Remove any shell or cartilage from thawed, cooked, shredded crab meat.
STEP 2:
Add soft bread crumbs, mustard, Salad Dressing, butter or melted margarine, beaten eggs, salt and pepper; mix lightly.
STEP 3:
Measure ¼ cup (1 - No.16 scoop) mixture for each cake.  Form into cakes 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick (about 2 oz each).  Chill.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with water, add beaten eggs; mix well.
STEP 5:
Dip chilled crab cakes in milk and egg mixture, then in dry  bread crumbs; shake off excess.
STEP 6:
Fry 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown; drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  To prepare soft bread crumbs, tear or cut slices of bread into small pieces.
2.  In Steps 3 and 4, 1 lb 4 oz (1¼ qt) canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 1½ qt warm water may be used for whole eggs.  See Recipe No.A-8.  Use 1 qt egg mixture in Step 3; 1 qt in Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  ½ Hen (6 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Remove necks and giblets from thawed hens.  Wash hens (inside and out) thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well; pat dry.
STEP 2:
Split hens in half lengthwise.
STEP 3:
Place hens, skin side up, on pans.
STEP 4:
Bake 1 hour.
GLAZE:
STEP 5:  
Heat brown sugar, honey and orange juice until sugar is melted.  
STEP 6:
Remove hens from oven; brush tops with glaze.
STEP 7:
Return to oven; bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown or done (180°F.).
STEP 8:
Brush remaining glaze over hens in each pan before serving.

NOTE:

1.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
2.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes on high fan, closed vent; in Step 7, 15 to 20 minutes on high fan, closed vent or until golden brown and done (180°F.).
3.  In Step 4, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 11 half-sheet pans (13x18-inches).  Bake at 400°F. 14 minutes with 90% microwave power for first 7 minutes.  In Step 7, bake at 400°F. 3 minutes with 90% microwave power throughout.

VARIATIONS:

1.  ROCK CORNISH HENS WITH SYRUP GLAZE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Omit Step 5.  In Step 6, use 4 lb 6 oz (1½ qt) blended syrup.  Follow Steps 7 and 8.
2.  HERBED CORNISH HENS:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 5 pans; brush hens with 2 cups lemon juice (2 lb 12 oz - 11 lemons A.P.).  Omit Steps 4 through 8.  Combine 2½ oz (¼ cup) salt, 3/4 oz (2½ tbsp) garlic powder, ½ oz (2 tbsp) black pepper, ½ oz (2 tbsp) ground paprika, ½ oz (2 tbsp) onion powder, ½ oz (2 tbsp) celery seed, ¼ oz (2 tbsp) ground poultry seasoning, 1/3 oz (2 tbsp) ground thyme, and 1/3 oz (3 tbsp) crushed sweet basil; mix well.  Sprinkle about 3 tbsp mixture evenly over hens in each pan.  Bake 1 to 1¼ hours or in 325°F. convection oven 40 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, closed vent.  Baste with cooking juices before serving.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Orange Juice Unswtnd Fzn Conc-6 floz Can

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash cut-up, thawed chicken pieces thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken, skin side up, in each pan.
STEP 3:  
Sprinkle with mixture of salt and pepper.
STEP 4:
Bake 70 minutes or until done (180°F.).  If convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole or 82 lb chicken, boiler-fryer, quartered may be used.  Cut in quarters or eights, bake 1½ hours in 350°F. conventional oven or 45 minutes in convection oven on high fan, closed vent.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
3.  If desired, racks may be used in pans.

VARIATIONS:

1.  MEXICAN BAKED CHICKEN:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, omit pepper; combine salt with 2-2/3 oz (10 tbsp) chili powder, 2½ oz (10 tbsp) ground cumin, 2/3 oz (10 tbsp) crushed oregano and 1-3/4 oz (6 tbsp) garlic powder; sprinkle about 1-2/3 oz (4-2/3 tbsp) mixture evenly over chicken in each pan.  Follow Step 4.
2.  HERB BAKED CHICKEN:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, combine salt and pepper with 3/4 oz (3/4 cup) crushed oregano, 3/4 oz (6 tbsp) ground marjoram and ½ oz (¼ cup) ground rosemary; sprinkle about 1 oz (2-2/3 tbsp) mixture evenly over chicken in each pan.  Follow Step 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Remove netting and skin from boneless, tempered turkey.  Cut into 3/4 to 1 inch pieces.
STEP 2:
Place turkey in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; add water, onions and 9 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 35 to 40 minutes.  Remove turkey.  Keep hot for use in Step 9.
STEP 3:
Skim fat off stock.  Remove bay leaves.  Keep reserved stock hot (3-3-4 gallons) for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Cook noodles in 3 gallons boiling water with 1-1/3 tbsp salt for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender.  Drain.  Keep hot for use in Step 9.
STEP 5:
Blend flour and cold water together; mix until smooth.
STEP 6:
Gradually add flour mixture to stock; stirring constantly; heat to boiling.  Cook 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring frequently to prevent sticking.
STEP 7:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Add salt, pepper (black or white), garlic powder and basil.  
STEP 8:
Add milk mixture to thickened stock, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; simmer 2 minutes.
STEP 9:
Add turkey and noodles.  Mix thoroughly.  Heat to a simmer.  Pour about 14 lb (6½ qt) turkey mixture into each pan.
STEP 10:
Combine crumbs, melted butter or margarine and cheese.  Sprinkle 7 oz (2 cups) over mixture in each pan.
STEP 11:
Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until lightly browned and thoroughly heated.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 2, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb oinion wedges.
2.  In Steps 2 and 3, refrigerate stock and turkey if not used immediately.
3.  In Step 11, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 20 to 25 minutes on high fan, open vent.
4.  In Step 11, if microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 minutes or until lightly brpwned and thoroughly heated with 60% microwave power throughout.
5.  Two No. 8 scoops may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED CHICKEN AND NOODLES (CHICKEN, CANNED): Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 14 lb 8 oz (8 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  In Step 6, use 10 oz (1½ cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 2½ gal water for stock.  See Recipe No. A-12.  Add 3 lb (3 qt) onion wedges (2 lb 5 oz A.P.).  Bring to a boil; cover; simmer 10 minutes.  In Step 6, drain chicken and onions.  Reserve 2½ gal stock.  Follow Steps 7 through 11.
2.  BAKED CHICKEN AND NOODLES (CHICKEN, DEHYDRATED, COOKED, DICED):  Omit Steps 1 through 3. Use 4 lb (3-1/5 - No.10 cn) canned dehydrated diced chicken, 6 oz (1-3/4 cups) dehydrated chopped onions and 3¼ gal water.  Bring water to a boil.  Remove from heat.  Add 12 oz (about 2 cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken, chicken and onions.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  Stir; cover; let stand 20 minutes or until rehydrated.  In Step 6, drain chicken and onions.  Reserve 2½ gal stock.  Follow Steps 7 through 11.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION;  2 Pieces (9 Ounces) plus
                              ½ Cup Rice (6 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan (6)
                    12x20x4-inch Steam Table Pan (10)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash cut-up, thawed chicken pieces thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.  Place chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 2:
Bake at 400°F. 70 minutes; remove from pans.  Keep hot for use in Step 8.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Add Soup and Gravy base and onion soup to milk; stir.
STEP 5:
Blend flour and cold water together; mix until smooth.
STEP 6:
Add flour mixture gradually to seasoned milk mixture; simmer 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.  Keep hot for use in Step 9.
STEP 7:
Place 1 lb (2-1/3 cups) uncooked rice in each steam table pan.  Pour 2 lb 6 oz (4-3/4 cups) water over rice in each pan; stir well.
STEP 8:
Place 5 lb 6 oz (about 20-25 pieces) of prebaked chicken over rice in each pan.
STEP 9:
Pour 2 lb 11 oz (1¼ qt) sauce evenly over chicken in each pan.
STEP 10:
Cover; bake 40 minutes or until rice is tender.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 10, bake 35 minutes or until rice is tender on high fan, closed vent.
3.  Two No.10 scoops may be used to serve rice.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: FS Chicken Flavor Soup Base 0131  CFP
RecipeItem/5/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven
                              375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash cup-up, thawed chicken pieces thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Place 13 lb 10 oz chicken, skin side up, on each sheet pan.
STEP 2:
Bake at 400°F. 70 minutes or until internal temperature is 180°F.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 3:
Combine chili sasuce, catsup, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, red pepper, black pepper, and salt.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes.
STEP 4:
Dip chicken in sauce to coat well; place chicken skin side up in pans.  Keep remaining sauce hot (180°F.) for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Bake at 375°F. 25 minutes or until done (180°F.).
STEP 6:
Brush with remaining hot sauce.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 35 to 40 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 5, bake at
350°F. 10 to 15 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, closed vent.
3.  In Step 3, Barbecue Sauce Mix may be used for all ingredients.  Prepare 2 gal sauce according to instructions on container.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION

1.  BARBECUED CHICKED (PREPARED BARBECUE SAUCE):  Follow Steps 1 and 3.  Omit Step 3.  Use 18 lb (2 gal) Prepared Barbecue Sauce.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed chickens thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; add 6 gallons water, salt and 9 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 hour or until done (180°F.).
STEP 3:
Remove chicken; strain stock; reserve stock for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Remove bones and skin; cut chicken into 1 inch pieces.  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk; add to reserved stock or 3-3/4 quarts water; mix thoroughly.  Heat to a simmer in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 6:
Blend salad oil, or melted shortening and flour together to form a roux; using a wire whip, stir until smooth.
STEP 7:
Gradually add milk and stock mixture to roux, stirring constantly.  Simmer 10 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 8:
Add pepper, onions, and celery; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Cool until tender.
STEP 9:
Add chicken, peppers, and pimientos to sauce; heat to serving temperature.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 50 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 8, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 6 lb 14 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 5 lb chopped celery.
3.  In Step 8, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 9, 1 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped peppers.
5.  In Step 9, 2½ oz (1½ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb frozen, diced, green peppes may be used.  Thaw peppers.
6.  In Step 9, 2 - 7 oz cn canned pimientos may be used.
7.  On Size 3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHICKEN A LA KING (CHICKEN, CANNED):      Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 18 lb 2 oz (10 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken; drain; dice into 1 inch pieces.  In Step 5, use 12 oz (1-7/8 cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 3 gal water for stock.  Follow Steps 6 through 9.
2.  TURKEY A LA KING (TURKEY, BONELESS, FROZEN, RAW):  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2 use 26 lb turkey, boneless, frozen, raw; simmer 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Follow Steps 3 through 9.
3.  TURKEY A LA KING (TURKEY, READY-TO-COOK, FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 45 lb turkey, RTC.  In Step 2, simmer 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Follow Steps 3 through 9.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces) plus
                              ½ Cup Sauce (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan (6)
                    18x24-inch Roasting Pan (3)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine tomatoes, tomato paste, onions, sweet peppers, water, 6 bay leaves, sugar, salt, garlic, basil, oregano, thyme and pepper in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; cover.  Simmer 1 hour.  Remove bay leaves.  Keep hot for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.  Place chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 3:
Bake 70 minutes or until done (180°F.); remove from pans; place chicken, skin side up, in roasting pans.
STEP 4:
Pour 13 lb 6 oz (6¼ qt) sauce over chicken in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 35 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.).
STEP 6:
Serve with ½ cup sauce.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions and 7 oz (5¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb 11 oz (2 qt) frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb ¼-inch sliced onions and 3 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers will yield 2 lb 11 oz ¼-inch pepper strips.
3.  In Step 1, if convection oven is used, increase water to 
1½ gal; in Step 3, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 4, pour 15 lb 14 oz (7½ qt) sauce over chicken in each pan.  In Step 5, bake at 350°F. 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.) on high fan, closed vent.
4.  In Step 2, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut in quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Sweet Green Bell Peppers Chpd Ckd-Drnd

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces plus ¼ Cup Gravy
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan (5)
                   18x24-inch Roasting Pan (3)
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken pieces thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle pieces of chicken with mixture of salt and pepper; arrange on sheet pans.
STEP 3:
Pour salad oil or melted shortening evenly over chicken.
STEP 4:
Bake 1 hour or until done (180°F.).
STEP 5:
Remove chicken; place an equal quantity of chicken in each roasting pan.  Drain or skim off fat from drippings.  Reserve drippings for use in Step 6.  Reserve fat for use in Step 8.
STEP 6:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 2 gal drippings plus boiling water; mix well.
STEP 7:
Reconstitute dry milk with 7½ cups water; add to stock mixture.  Heat to a simmer.
STEP 8:
Combine fat and flour; cook at low heat until light brown, about 5 minutes.
STEP 9:
Stir browned fat and flour mixture into stock mixture; cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 10:
Pour 3½ qt gravy evenly over chicken in each pan.  Sprinkle with paprika.
STEP 11:
Bake 30 minutes or until chicken and gravy are heated.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
3.  One Size 1 ladle may be used to serve gravy.

VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED CHICKEN WITH MUSHROOM GRAVY:  Follow Steps 1 through 9.  In Step 10, add 1 lb 14 oz (1 - jumbo cn) canned mushrooms, drained, chopped to gravy.  Follow Step 11.
2.  BAKED CHICKEN WITH MUSHROOM GRAVY (SOUP, CONDENSED, CREAM OF MUSHROOM):  Follow Step 1.  Omit salt in Step 2.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.  Discard fat and drippings in Step 5.  Omit Steps 6 through 9.  Combine 17 lb 3 oz (5½ - No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed cream of mushroom soup and 2-3/4 qt water.  Bring soup mixture to a boil.  Follow Steps 10 and 11.
RecipeItem/9/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup plus Topping (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, ready-to-cook turkey thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place turkey in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; add 9 gallons water, 9 tbsp salt, and 9 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 3 to 4 hours or until tender.
STEP 3:
Remove turkey; strain stock; reserve stock (3 gallons) for use in Step 7.
STEP 4:
Remove bones and skin; cut turkey into 1 inch pieces.  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 5:
Cook potatoes, celery and carrots in 1-1/2 qt boiling water salted with 1-2/3 tbsp salt until tender.  Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 6:
Blend melted butter or margarine and flour together; stir until smooth.
STEP 7:
Gradually add butter or margarine and flour mixture to stock, stirring to prevent sticking. (3 gallons water used in nutritional analysis.)
STEP 8:
Add pepper; heat slowly until smooth and thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 9:
Add cooked potatoes, celery, carrots, peas and turkey to sauce.
STEP 10:
Place an equal quantity of mixture in each pan.
THIN BATTER TOPPING:
STEP 11:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; combine with beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs) and sugar.  Mix thoroughly.
STEP 12:
Sift together flour, baking powder and salt; combine with liquid mixture.
STEP 13:
Add salad oil or melted shortening; mix well
STEP 14:
Pour an equal quantity of batter over top of turkey mixture in each pan.
STEP 15:
Bake 20 to 30 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 5, 4 lb 15 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 4 lb diced potatoes; 4 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 4 lb sliced carrots; 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 5, 4 lb 5 oz (2/3 No.10 cn) canned sliced carrots, drained or 3 lb 5 oz frozen carrots may be used.  Add carrots to sauce in Step 9.
3.  In Step 7, 12 oz (1-3/4 cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken combined with 3 gal hot water may be used.  In Step 1, omit salt.
4.  In Step 9, 1 lb 3 oz (1 - No.2½ cn) peas, dehydrated, compressed or 4 lb 15 oz (3/4 - No.10 cn) canned peas, drained may be used.
5.  In Step 14, batter will be very thin.  DO NOT add additional flour.
6.  Baking Powder Biscuits may be used for topping.  Omit Steps 11 through 15.  Prepare 1 Recipe No.D-1 or D-1-1; place baked biscuits over top before serving.  EACH PORTION: 1 Cup and 1 Biscuit.
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHICKEN POT PIE (CHICKED, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.  In Step 7, use 12 oz (1½ cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken, and 3 gal water for turkey stock.  See Recipe No. A-12.  Follow Step 8.  In Step 9, use 18 lb 2 oz (10 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken.  Follow Steps 10 through 15.
2.  CHICKEN POT PIE (CHICKEN, DEHYDRATED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 4 lb 8 oz (3-3/5 - 20 oz cn) canned dehydrated chicken.  Add 12 oz (1½ cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken, to 3¼ gal boiling water; stir; add chicken.  Cover; let stand 20 minutes.  Drain; reserve stock for use in Step 7.  Add hot water to bring stock to 3 gal.  Follow Steps 5 through 15.
3.  TURKEY POT PIE (TURKEY, BONELESS):  Omit Step 1. In Step 2, use 26 lb turkey, boneless, frozen, thawed.  Follow Steps 3 through 15.

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (4½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed chicken thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; add 7-1/8 gallons water, 2 tbsp salt and 6 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1½ hours or until done (180°F.).
STEP 3:
Remove chicken.  Remove bones and skin; cut chicken into ½ to 1 inch pieces.  Cover; chill.
STEP 4:
Add celery, chopped pickles and onions to chilled chicken; mix thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Add lemon juice, Salad Dressing, salt and pepper; mix lightly but thoroughly.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 6:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on serving dish; add 3/4 cup (2 - No.10 scoops) chicken salad just before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 45 lb quartered chicken may be used.
2.  In Step 4, 12 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 9 lb chopped celery.  7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 6 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 5, 1 lb 2 oz lemons A.P. (4½ lemons) will yield 3/4 cup juice.
4.  In Step 5, 3 lb 12 oz (4½ cups) fat-free Salad Dressing may be used.
5.  In Step 6, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHICKEN SALAD (CHICKEN, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 18 lb 2 oz (10 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken.  Drain; dice into 1 inch pieces.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.
2.  TURKEY SALAD (TURKEY, BONELESS):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 23 lb 4 oz turkey, boneless, frozen, thawed. Follow Steps 1 through 3 of Recipe No.L.144.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Stir broken spaghetti into 3 gallons boiling water with 1-2/3 tablespoons salt.  Cook about 15 minutes stirring frequently.  Drain; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Saute onions and peppers in melted butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 3:
Add flour to sauteed vegetables.  Stir until well mixed.
STEP 4:
Combine boiling water with soup and gravy base.  Add to sauteed vegetable mixture; stirring constantly.  Cook 10 minutes or until smooth and thickened.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; add gradually to vegetable-sauce mixture, stirring constantly.  Bring to a simmer.
STEP 6:
Add spaghetti, chicken, mushrooms, pimientos, nutmeg and black pepper to vegetable-sauce mixture.  Combine thoroughly.
STEP 7:
Pour about 13 lb 12 oz (1½ gal) mixture into each pan.  Sprinkle 4 oz (1 cup) parmesan cheese over mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 30 minutes or until lightly brown.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1 oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions; 1¼ oz (1 cup) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz (1½ cups) frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
2.  In Step 2, 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions; 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz 
chopped peppers.
3.  In Step 2, 6 lb drained (12 - 8 oz cn) canned mushrooms may be used.
4.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 minutes or until lightly browned on high fan, open vent.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  TUNA TETRAZZINI:       Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 6, use 12 lb 8 oz (3 - 66.5 oz cn) drained canned turna.
In Step 6, omit nutmeg.  In Step 7, use 13 lb 4 oz (1½ gal) mixture per pan.  Follow Step 8.

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. OVen

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Combine soy sauce, onions, garlic powder and ginger, cinnamon, cloves, pepper and fennel; mix well.  Pour over chicken.  Refrigerate 30 minutes turning frequently.  Drain.
STEP 3:
Place chicken, skin side up on sheet pans.
STEP 4:
Bake 70 minutes or until done, (180°F.).


NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered, may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
3.  In Step 1, 2-2/3 oz (½ cup (24 cloves - 3 oz A.P.)) dry, minced garlic may be used.
4.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, open vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces) plus
                              1/3 Cup Sauce (2½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan (6)
                   18x24-inch Roasting Pan (3)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare 1½ recipes Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 3:
Place chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 4:
Bake 70 minutes or until done (180°F.) remove from pans; place chicken, skin side up, in roasting pans.
STEP 5:
Pour 9 lb (4¼ qt) Creole Sauce over chicken in each pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 35 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1/7 oz (2¼ tsp) ground red pepper may be added to Creole Sauce, if desired.  For convection oven use 1/5 oz (3¼ tsp) ground red pepper.
2.  In Step 1, if convection oven is used, prepare 2¼ recipes Creole Sauce (Recipe No. O-5).  In Step 4, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes on high fan, closed vent, or until done (180°F.).  In Step 5, pour 15 lb 7 oz (6½ qt) Creole sauce over chicken in each roasting pan.  In Step 6, bake at 350°F. 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.) on high fan, closed vent.
3.  In Step 2, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  325°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Dredge chicken in mixture of flour, salt, pepper, and paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Fry until golden brown or until done (180°F.). (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 4:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights, or 82 lb chicken, broiler, quartered may be used.
2.  Frying should be scheduled to allow fried chicken to be served immediately.  If necessry, fried chicken may be held in a roasting pan uncovered in 200°F. oven, until serving time.
3.  Meatier pieces may require longer cooking.  Test for doneness.  Fried chicken should be fork-tender; the fork will pierce the thickest piece easily.
4.  Approximate frying time for cut-up chicken is:  Wings - 5 to 7 minutes; Legs - 10 to 13 minutes; Thighs - 10 to 15 minutes; Breasts - 10 to 15 minutes.

VARIATIONS:

1.  SOUTHERN FRIED CHICKEN:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, brown chicken in batches in 325°F. deep fat.  For each type, fry according to minimum times in Note 4.  Place chicken on 6 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Bake uncovered in 350°F. oven about 45 minutes or in 350°F. convection oven 15 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, open vent.  EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (7 ounces).
2.  FRIED CHICKEN (PRECOOKED, BREADED CHICKEN, FROZEN, FOR DEEP FAT FRYER):  Omit Steps 1 through 3. Use 65 lb precooked, breaded chicken, frozen.  Fry chicken in 350°F. deep fat 5 to 6 minutes or until browned and heated throughly (165°F.).  Follow Step 4.  EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (1 piece breast and wing or leg or 1 piece each leg and thigh).

YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION: 2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Dredge chicken pieces in mixture of bread crumbs, salt, pepper and paprika; shake off excess.  Place on well-greased pans, skin side up.  Bake 1 hour or until done (180°F.).

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights) or 82 lb chicken broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 30 minutes or until done (180°F.), on high fan, open vent.
3.  In Step 2, 7 lb (2-1/3 gal) corn flake crumbs may be used for bread crumbs.

VARIATION:

1.  FRIED CHICKEN (PRECOOKED, BREADED CHICKEN, FROZEN FOR OVEN):  Omit Steps 1 through 2.  Use 65 lb precooked, breaded chicken, frozen.  Place on 5 pans.  Heat in 400°F. oven 10 minutes.  Turn chicken; heat additional 15 minutes or until heated through.  EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (1 piece breast and wing or leg; or 1 piece each leg and thigh).  NOTE:  Chicken may be cooked in 350°F. convection oven 25 to 30 minutes on high fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces) plus
                              ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Sauce
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan (6 Pans)
                    18x24-inch Roasting Pan (3 Pans)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 3:
Bake 70 minutes or until done (180°F.).
STEP 4:
Combine crushed pineapple, pineapple juice, soy sauce, and sugar.  Bring to a simmer (about 5 minutes).  Keep hot.
STEP 5:
Place 18 lb chicken in roasting pans.  Pour 9 lb (1 gal) sauce over top of chicken in each pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 35 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 6, bake 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.) on high fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions (6 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Combine pepper, garlic powder, Worestershire sauce, soy sauce and salad oil; mix well.  Pour over chicken.  Marinate 45 minutes, turning frequently.
STEP 3:
Place chicken, skin side up, in pans.  Pour about 9 oz (1 cup) of marinade over chicken in each pan.
STEP 4:
Bake 1 hour or until done (180°F.).  Baste occasionally.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.), on high fan, open vent.  Baste after 20 minutes.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (6 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water; drain well.  Place in 3 roasting pans (18x24-inches); cover; set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Prepare 1 recipe (2 gal) Szechwan Sauce (Recipe No. O-10).
STEP 3:
Pour sauce over chicken; cover; marinate 45 minutes under refrigeration.
STEP 4:
Drain chicken.  Reserve marinade for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Place chicken, skin side up, on lightly greased sheet pans.
STEP 6:
Bake 1 hour or until done (180°F.).  Bring marinade to a boil.  Boil 1 minute.  Baste with marinade at 20 and 40 minute intervals.  Discard any unused marinade.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered, may be used.
2.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 45 minutes or until done (180°F.) basting at 15 and 30 minute intervals with boiled marinade.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (9½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed chicken thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; cover with 6 gallonswater; add salt and 9 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 hour or until done (180°F.).
STEP 3:
Remove chicken; strain stock; reserve stock (1-1/2 gallons prepared chicken stock used for nutritional analysis) for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Remove bones and skin; cut chicken into 1 inch pieces.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Saute sliced onions, celery and coarsely cut cabbage in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 5 minutes.
STEP 6:
Add chicken and sauteed vegetables to stock; cover; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 7:
Drain bean sprouts; set sprouts aside for use in Step 10 and liquid for use in Step 8.
STEP 8:
Combine reserved liquid with cornstarch to make a smooth paste; add ginger, pepper, soy sauce and molasses (optional).
STEP 9:
Add liquid mixture slowly to hot meat mixture, stirring constantly.  Cook 5 to 8 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 10:
Add bean sprouts; mix well; bring to a simmer.
STEP 11:
Serve chow mein over 1/3 cup noodles.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 50 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 5: 13 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. wil yield 12 lb sliced onions; 11 lb fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 lb celery pieces; 7 lb 8 oz fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 6 lb cabbage, coarsely cut.
3.  In Step 5, 1 lb 8 oz (7-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 7, 7 - No.303 cn, canned bean sprouts may be used.
5.  Two No.8 scoops may be used.
6.  Chicken Chow Mein may be served over Steamed Rice (Recipe No.E-5).  Omit Step 11.

VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN CHOW MEIN (CHICKEN, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, use 6 oz (7/8 cup) Soup and Gravy base, chicken, combined with 1½ gal water for chicken stock.  See Recipe No.A-12.  Add sauteed vegetables to stock.  Use 18 lb 2 oz (10 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken; drain; dice into 1 inch pieces; add to vegetables and stock.  Cover; simmer 10 minutes.  Follow Steps 7 through 11.

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
Each Portion:  3 Slices (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  325°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Ready-to-cook, thawed turkeys:  Remove bands from legs; open turkey cavity.  Cut off wing tips.
STEP 2:
Wash turkey thoroughly inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  
STEP 3:
Rub cavity with salt (optional) using approximately 3/4 cup total.
STEP 4:
Tuck legs and tail into cavity.  Place in roasting pans, breast side up.  Turkeys should not touch each other.
STEP 5:
Rub skin with salad oil or melted shortening.  DO NOT ADD WATER.
STEP 6:
Insert meat thermometer in center of inside thigh muscle of smallest bird.
STEP 7:
Roast uncovered until meat thermometer registers 180°F. to 185°F.  (See timetable.)
STEP 8:
Baste frequently with drippings.

NOTE:

1.  If desired, wing tips may be used in making stock for gravy, dressing or soup.  
2.  Place frozen turkey in refrigerator to permit gradual thawing:  large turkeys, 16 lb and over - 2 to 3 days; small turkeys, under 16 lb - 1 to 2 days.
3.  If V-shaped racks are available, place in roasting pans to support birds.
4.  If no thermometer is available, to test for doneness, move the leg by grasping bone; if joint moves easily, the ligaments are tender and meat is done.
5.  If turkey begins to brown too quickly, cover with loose tent of food service aluminum foil.
6.  Omit Steps 5 and 8 if self-basting turkeys are used.

TIMETABLE FOR ROASTING TURKEYS (UNSTUFFED):
Weight          Oven      Cooking       Convection   Convection
of Turkeys     Temp.    Time (hrs)     Oven Temp   Oven Time

8-12 lb           325°F.        3 - 4               300°F.      2¼ - 3 hrs
12-16 lb         325°F.      3½ - 4½            300°F.     2-3/4 - 3½
16-20 lb         325°F.        4 - 5               300°F.     3 - 3-3/4
20-24 lb         325°F.      4½ - 5½            300°F.      3½ - 4¼
For best results in slicing, allow to stand 30 minutes. 

SERVINGS PER TURKEY:
Ready-to-Cook Weight                   Number of Servings
       8 to 12 lb                                        10 to 20
      12 to 15 lb                                       20 to 32
      16 to 24 lb                                       33 to 50
                                                   (about 2 servings per pound)

YIELD:  100 Portions (2 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 to 2 Slices (3½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Remove casing; place netted, thawed turkey in pans.
STEP 2:
Roast 3 to 4½ hours (baste occasionally with drippings) uncovered or until meat thermometer registers a temperature of 170°F. to 175°F.

NOTE:
