1.  Arrange roasts with similar diameters together.  Cooking time will vary depending on diameter of roasts.
2.  When roasted, remove from oven; let stand 15 to 20 minutes to absorb juices and for ease in slicing.
3.  Remove netting or bag.  Skin may be removed before slicing.  Slice turkey about ¼-inch thick.  Cover slices until served.
4.  Frozen turkeys will require 1 to 2 hours longer cooking time.
5.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, roast at 325°F. 2½ to 3½ hours or until meat thermometer registers 170°F. to 175°F. on high fan, closed vent.  Allow 15 to 17 minutes per pound.
6.  In Step 1, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 4 half sheet pans (13x18-inches) with racks.  Place 1 roast on each rack.  Cap ends of each roast with food service aluminum foil covering 3 inches of sides.  In Step 2, roast at 325°F. 70 minutes with 50% microwave power.  Roast 50 minutes without microwave power or until meat thermometer registers 170°F. to 175°F.  Insert meat thermometer; remove foil.  Allow 10 minutes per pound with 6 minutes per pound for microwave power.

VARIATION:

1.  ROAST TURKEY WITH BARBECUE SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Use 15 lb 12 oz (1-3/4 gal) prepared Barbecue Sauce or 1 recipe Barbecue Sauce (Recipe No.0-2).  Bring sauce to a boil; reduce heat; cover; simmer about 5 minutes or until heated thoroughly.  Follow Note 3.  Serve ¼ cup (1 Size-1 ladle) sauce over turkey slices.  EACH PORTION:  1 to 2 Slices Turkey (3½ Ounces) plus ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Barbecue Sauce.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  8 to 10 Nuggets (3½ Ounces)
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Deep Fat

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook turkey according to Step 2, Recipe No. L-147 except simmer turkey 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Drain.  Remove netting.  Dice into 1-inch pieces.
STEP 2:
Dredge turkey in mixture of flour, salt, pepper and paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Add beaten eggs (1½ lb is 14 eggs).  Mix well.
STEP 4:
Dip floured turkey in milk and egg mixture.  Drain well.
STEP 5:
Roll in crumbs until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 6:
Fry 2 minutes or until well browned. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 7:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 7 oz (1-3/4 cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with 1-3/4 cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.  
2.  Serve with sweet and sour sauce, barbecue sauce, mustard sauce or Chicken Gravy (Recipe No. O-16-2).

YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Duck (7 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan
TEMPERATURE:  325°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed, ready-to-cook duck thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Rub cavity of duck with pepper.
STEP 3:
Place duck, breast side up, in pans without crowding.  Prick skin of duck.
STEP 4:
Roast 2 hours or until done.
STEP 5:
Pour off fat frequently during roasting period.

NOTE:

1.  Use V-shaped racks in roasting pans, if available ( 7 Roasting pans and 13 racks).  
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  HAWAIIAN BAKED DUCK:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, blend 1 tbsp ground ginger with pepper.  Follow Step 3.  Combine 2 qt orange juice (9 lb (18 oranges A.P.)) with 2 qt (3/4 No.3 cyl cn) canned pineapple juice.  In Step 4, baste frequently with juice mixture.  Follow Step 5.
2.  ROAST DUCK WITH APPLE JELLY GLAZE:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, roast duck 1½ hours.  Melt 2 oz (¼ cup) butter or margarine.  Add 2 lb (3 cups) apple jelly and 1½ cups (¼ - No.3 cyl cn) canned apple juice.  Stir to break up jelly; contine stirring until jelly is melted.  Remove from heat. Add ¼ cup lemon juice (6 oz (1½ lemons A.P.)), ½ cup orange juice (9½ oz (1¼ oranges A.P.)), 7 oz (3/4 cups) catsup, and 2 tbsp vinegar.  Stir until well blended.  During last 30 minutes of roasting, increase oven temperature to 375°F.  Follow Step 5. Brush skin of ducks evenly with ½ of glaze; roast 15 minutes.  Repeat with remaining glaze; roast an additional 15 minutes or until tender.
3.  HONEY GLAZED DUCK:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, roast duck 1½ hours.  Combine 3 lb (1 qt) honey, 1 cup soy sauce, 1½ tbsp ground ginger, 1-1/3 tbsp salt and 2 tsp black pepper.  Stir until well blended.  Increase oven temperature to 375°F.  Follow Step 5.  Brush skin of ducks evenly with ½ of glaze.  Roast 15 minutes.  Repeat with remaining glaze.  Roast an additional 15 minutes or until tender.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (3 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  475°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare 1 recipe (1 gal) Pizza Sauce (Recipe No. O-12).  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle yeast over warm water (105°F to 110°F.).  DO NOT USE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 110°F.  Mix well.  Let stand 5 minutes; stir.
STEP 3:
Place cold water, flour, salt, sugar and salad oil or melted shortening in mixer bowl in order listed.  Add yeast solution.
STEP 4:
Using dough hook, mix at low speed about 8 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic.  Dough temperature should be 86°F. to 88°F.
STEP 5:
Divide dough; shape into 4 (2 lb 7 oz) balls.  Cover; let rise in warm place (80°F.) 1½ to 2 hours or until double in bulk.
STEP 6:
Coat bottom and sides of each pan with 1 tbsp salad oil or melted shortening.
STEP 7:
Place dough balls on lightly floured working surface.  Roll out each ball to 1/8-inch thickness.  Transfer dough to pans, pushing dough slightly up edges of each pan.  Using 1 tbsp oil per pan, lightly brush dough.  Gently prick dough to prevent bubbling.
STEP 8:
Bake 20 minutes or until slightly browned.
STEP 9:
Spread 1 qt sauce evenly over dough in each pan.
STEP 10:
Sprinkle 1 qt shredded cheese over each pan.
STEP 11:
Sprinkle ½ cup grated cheese over mixture in each pan.
STEP 12:
Bake about 25 minutes or until crust is browned and cheese starts to turn golden.  
STEP 13:
Cut 5 by 5.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 6 lb 9 oz (1 - No.10 cn) canned pizza sauce may be used.  If desired, 1/5 oz (2 tbsp) crushed sweet basil, 1/8 oz (2 tbsp) crushed oregano, 1/5 oz (2½ tsp) garlic powder and 1/6 oz (2 tsp) black pepper may be used.  In Step 9, use 3 cups per pan.
2.  In Step 8, if desired, crusts may be prebaked and refrigerated for later use.
3.  In Step 8, if a convection oven is used, bake at 450°F. 7 minutes on high fan, closed vent; in Step 12, bake 8 minutes.
4.  In Step 10, 4 lb 8 oz (1-1/8 No.10 cn) pizza blend cheese may be used.
5.  In Step 12, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 8 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).  Omit Step 1.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, divide dough and shape into 8 (about 1 lb 4 oz) balls.  Cover; let rise in warm place (80°F.) 1½ to 2 hours or double in bulk.  In Step 6, use 1½ tsp salad oil or melted shortening per pan.  In Step 7, use 1 tbsp salad oil or melted shortening per pan.  In Step 8. bake at 475°F. 3 minutes with 100% microwave power throughout or until slightly browned.  In Step 9, use 6 lb 9 oz (1 No.10 cn) pizza sauce.  Spread 12½ oz (1½ cups) sauce evenly over crust in each pan. In Step 10, use 2 cups shredded cheese per pan.  In Step 11, sprinkle 1 oz (¼ cup) grated cheese over mixture in each pan.  In Step 12, bake at 475°F. 2 minutes with 100% microwave power throughout or until crust is browned and cheese starts to turn golden.  In Step 13, cut 3 by 4.
6.  If desired, extra cheese may be used.  In Step 10, use 9 lb (2 gal) Mozzarella cheese.  Sprinkle 2 qt cheese over sauce in each pan.  In Step 12, bake 30 minutes or until cheese starts to turn golden.      EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (3½ Ounces).
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (13 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  450°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 2, frozen crusts on each greased sheet pan.
STEP 2:
Pour 6 oz (3/4 cup) sauce over each crust.
STEP 3:
Sprinkle about 2-3/4 oz (2/3 cup) cheese over each pizza.
STEP 4:
Sprinkle about 1¼ tbsp grated cheese over mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake about 20 minutes or until crust is browned and crisp.
STEP 6:
Cut each pizza into 4 wedges.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1½ recipes pizza crust (Recipe No. L-165 (Steps 2 through 5)) may be used.  Divide dough into 25 - 7½ oz pieces.  Roll into 12 inch diameter crusts.
2.  In Step 2, 1¼ recipes (1¼ gal) Pizza Sauce (Recipe No. O-12) may be used.
3.  In Step 2, if desired, 1/5 oz (2 tbsp) crushed basil, 1/8 oz (2 tbsp) crushed oregano, 1/10 oz (1 tsp) garlic powder and 1/6 oz (2 tsp) black pepper may be added to sauce.
4.  In Step 3, 5 lb (1¼ No.10 cn) pizza blend cheese may be used.
5.  In Step 3, 4 lb 8 oz (1 gal) low fat shredded Mozzarella cheese may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  PIZZA (CHEESE, PREPARED, FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 29 lb 6 oz (25 - 12-inch) or 25 lb (50 -6-inch) frozen, prepared cheese pizzas.  Place pizzas on ungreased sheet pans.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, bake 15 to 18 minutes or in 350°F. convection oven 8 to 12 minutes on high fan, open vent.  In Step 6, cut 12-inch pizzas into 4 wedges or 6-inch pizzas in half.  Note: If microwave-convection oven is used, use 25 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).  For 12-inch pizzas, bake at 425°F. 5 minutes with 100% microwave power throughout.  For 6-inch pizzas (2 per pan), bake at 425°F. 4 minutes with 100% microwave power throughout.  EACH PORTION:  4 ounces (1 Piece -- ¼ 12-inch pizza) or 3½ ounces (1 Piece -- ½ 6-inche pizza).
2.  FAST FOOD PIZZA:  Omit Steps 1 through 6.  Use 29 lb 4 oz (104 - 4x6-inch) prepared, frozen pizzas.  Place pizzas on well-greased pans.  Bake at 425°F. 16 to 18 minutes or in 350°F. convection oven 16 minutes.  NOTE:  PEPPERONI PIZZA: Use 1 lb diced or thinly sliced cooked pepperoni.  Sprinkle an equal quantity over cheese.  SAUSAGE PIZZA: Saute 3 lb pork sausage.  Sprinkle an equal qauntity over cheese.  COMBO PIZZA:  Cook 8 lb thawed beef pattie mix, bulk or ground beef in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain well.  Rehydrate 1 oz (3/4 cup) dehydrated green peppers in 1 lb (2 cups) water and 1½ oz (7¼ tbsp) dehydrated onions in 8 oz (1 cup) water; drain well.  Sprinkle peppers, onions and beef over cheese in each pan.  Note:  6½ oz (1-2/3 cups) fresh sweet peppers, chopped
(8 oz A.P.) and 12 oz (2¼ cups) dry onions, chopped (13-1/3 oz A.P.) may be used for dehydrated peppers and onions.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Sweet Green Bell Peppers Chpd Ckd-Drnd
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1¼ Cups (11½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook l5 lb thawed beef in its own fat with onions and peppers until it loses its pink color, stirring to break apart in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add catsup and beans to beef, onion and pepper mixture.  Stir well.  
STEP 3:
Simmer 20 minutes

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 6 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 6 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 12 oz (4 cups) dehydrated, chopped onions may be used.  
3.  In Step 1, 3 lb 11 oz peppers, sweet A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped sweet peppers.
4.  In Step 1, 8 oz (6 cups) peppers, green, dehydrated may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  6 to 12 Scallops (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed scallops thoroughly; cut large ones in half.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Marinate scallops in lemon juice 5 to 10 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Mix bread crumbs, salt, pepper, paprika, basil and garlic.
STEP 4:
Drain scallops.  Dredge scallops in seasoned bread crumbs.  Place an equal quantity of scallops in each pan.
STEP 5:
Drizzle ½ cup melted butter or margarine over scallops in each pan.  Bake 30 minutes.
STEP 6:
Remove from oven; sprinkle each pan with 2 tbsp parsley.  Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 2 lb lemons A.P. (8 lemons) will yield 1-1/3 cups juice.
2.  In Step 2, 1/3 cup frozen lemon juice concentrate and 1 cup cold water may be used for juice.
3.  In Step 4, other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 20 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
5.  In Step 6, 4¼ oz (2 cups) chopped fresh parsley A.P. may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (9 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  10 Ounces
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place single layer of thawed fish on well-greased pans, in rows, 2 by 6.
STEP 2:
Combine melted butter or margarine, dill weed, and pepper; add lemon juice.  Use 1 cup lemon-butter mixture for each pan.  Lightly brush inside and top of each fish.
STEP 3:
Combine bread crumbs and salt.  Use 1 cup bread crumbs per pan; evenly sprinkle on inside and outside of fish.
STEP 4:
Bake 15 minutes.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  Since trout does not hold well in serving lines for long periods of time, prepare by progressive cooking methods in small batches.
2.  Heads may be removed in Step 1, if desired.
3.  In Step 2, 6 lb (24 lemons) fresh lemons A.P. will yield 1 qt juice.
4.  In Step 2, 1 cup frozen lemon juice concentrate and 3 cups cold water may be used for juice.

VARIATION;

1.  BAKED TROUT FILLETS:  In Step 1, use 32 lb (100 - 5 oz fillets) trout, thawed; place in rows 2 by 9, on 6 greased sheet pans, skin side down.  In Step 2, use 1 lb 11 oz (3-1/3 cups) butter or margarine, melted; 1½ tsp black pepper; and 2-2/3 cups lemon juice (4 lb - 16 lemons A.P.).  Evenly brush top of fish with 1 cup lemon-butter mixture per pan.  In Step 3, use 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) bread crumbs, dry and 3/4 oz (1-1/3 tbsp) salt; evenly sprinkle 1 cup mixture per pan over top of each fish.  In Step 4, bake 9 minutes.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1 Fillet (5½ Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions (6¼ Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cook 30 lb beef in its own fat until it loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, onions, chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, salt, red pepper, garlic and water.  Stir.  Bring to a simmer; cook 1 hour, stirring occasionally.  DO NOT BOIL.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 1-1/3 oz (¼ cup) dry, minced garlic may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
3.  In Step 2, 5-2/3 oz (1-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 6 lb 1 oz (3 - 36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
5.  One Size 3 ladle may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Pita Pizza (2½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  450°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place 15 pitas on each sheet pan.
STEP 2:
Spread about 2 tbsp (1 - Size-0 ladle) pizza sauce evenly on each pita.
STEP 3:
Sprinkle about 1 oz (¼ cup) cheese over sauce on each pita.
STEP 4:
Bake 15 minutes or until cheese starts to turn golden.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 2 tbsp crushed sweet basil, 2 tbsp crushed oregano, 2 tsp dehydrated garlic and 2 tsp black pepper may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 3/4 recipe Pizza Sauce (Recipe No. O-12) may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 4 lb 8 oz (1-1/8 - No.10 cn) canned pizza blend cheese may be used.
4.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 450°F. 5 minutes on high fan, closed vent.

VARIATION:

1.  MUSHROOM, ONION AND GREEN PEPPER PITA PIZZA:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 5 lb 5 oz (1½ qt - 3 jumbo cn) canned drained sliced mushrooms, 2 lb (1½ qt) dry chopped onions (2 lb 4 oz A.P.) and 2 lb (1½ qt) chopped sweet peppers (2 lb 7 oz A.P.); evenly distribute 1 tbsp mushrooms, 1 tbsp onions and 1 tbsp peppers over cheese on each pita.  EACH PORTION:  1 Pita Pizza (4 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place canned, drained beef chunks (raw beef substituted above), pepper and garlic in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Add water, tomatoes, thyme and 4 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.
STEP 3:
Add carrots to beef mixture.  Cover; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add celery, onions and potatoes to beef mixture.  Mix well.  Cover; simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 5:
Thicken gravy, if desired.  Combine flour and 1½ qt cold water.  Add to stew while stirring; cook 5 minutes or until thickened.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 9 lb 12 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 8 lb carrot rings.
2.  In Step 4, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb celery cut into 1 inch pieces; 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb onions cut in quarters.
3.  In Step 4, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.  
4.  In Step 4, 12 lb 5 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 10 potatotes cut into 1 to 1½ inch pieces.
5.  In Step 4, 8 lb (1¼ - No.10 cn) canned, drained whole potatoes may be used.  Quarter potatoes.  Simmer potatoes 10 minutes.
6.  One Size 3 ladle may be used.
_description: Stew, beef chunks, w/juices & veg, cnd
RecipeItem/10/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare 3/4 recipe Marinara Sauce (Recipe No. O-4).  Keep hot for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Add tortellini slowly to 7 gallons boiling salted water; stirring constantly until water boils again.  Cook 25 minutes; stir occasionally.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Drain thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Add tortellini to sauce.  Stir gently but thoroughly.
STEP 4:
Simmer 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 1, 30 lb 8 oz (4-2/3 - No.10 cn) canned pizza sauce may be used.
2.  One Size 3 ladle may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  SPINACH TORTELLINI MARINARA (FROZEN):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 14 lb (11½ qt) frozen spinach filled tortellini.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
2.  CHEESE TORTELLINI MARINARA (DEHYDRATED):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 9 lb 3 oz (9¼ qt) dehydrated cheese filled tortellini.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.
3.  SPINACH TORTELLINI MARINARA (DEHYDRATED):
Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 9 lb 3 oz (9¼ qt) dehydrated spinach filled tortellini.  Follow Steps 3 and 4.

YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (11 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine rice, 1-1/4 gallons water, salt and salad oil.  Bring to a boil.  Stir occasionally.  Cover tightly; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.
STEP 3:
Combine diced tomatoes, cheese, mushrooms, peppers, onions, and rice.  Mix well.  Place 8 lb (5¼ qt) in each well greased pan.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.
STEP 5:
Combine milk, thawed egg whites, thawed eggs, pepper (white or black), and salt.  Mix well.
STEP 6:
Pour 3 lb 6 oz (1½ qt egg mixture over rice mixture in each pan.  Stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 7:
Bake 1 hour 40 minutes or until eggs are set.  Cut 3 by 5.

NOTES:

1.  In Step 3, 15 lb 12 oz tomatoes A.P. will yield 15 lb 7 oz diced tomatoes; 6 lb 2 oz green peppers A.P. will yield 5 lb diced green peppers; 5 lb 9 oz onions A.P. will yield 5 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 3, shredded American or Monterey Jack cheese may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 11 lb low fat or reduced fat chedder cheese may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 10 oz (3 cups) dehydrated onions and 10 oz (7½ cups) dehydrated green peppers, or 5 lb (3-3/4 qt) frozen diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
5.  In Step 3, 25 lb 6 oz (4 - No.10 cn) canned diced tomatoes may be used.  Drain thoroughly.
6.  In Step 5, 17 lb 2 oz (2 gal - 172 eggs) whole eggs may be used or 2 gal reduced cholesterol eggs.
7.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 45 minutes or until completely set on low fan, closed vent.
RecipeItem/6/_ItemName: Sweet Green Bell Peppers Chpd Ckd-Drnd

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (12 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No.A-31.
STEP 2:
Add ½-inch diced potatoes to 2 gallons boiling water salted with 1-1/2 tablespoons salt, bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 8 minutes or until tender.  Drain, well.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add broccoli to 2-1/2 gallons boiling water salted with 2-1/3 teaspoons salt.  Return to a boil; reduce heat.  Simmer 5 minutes until just tender; cool.
STEP 4:
Combine potatoes, broccoli, tomatoes, onions, and Parmesan cheese.  Toss lightly.  Place 8 lb 6 oz (1½ gal) mixture in each well-greased pan.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 3½ qt warm water.
STEP 6:
Combine milk, thawed eggs, parsley, salt, pepper (white or black), garlic, paprika and basil.  Mix well.
STEP 7:
Pour 4 lb 4 oz (2 qt) egg mixture over potato mixture in each pan.  Stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 8:
Bake 1 hour 50 minutes or until eggs are set.  Cut 3 by 5.

NOTES:

1.  In Step 2, 19 lb 11 oz white potatoes A.P. will yield `6 lb diced potatoes.
2.  In Step 3, 27 lb 1 oz fresh broccoli A.P. will yield 16 lb 8 oz fresh, chopped broccoli.  In Step 3, 16 lb 8 oz frozen chopped
broccoli may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 19 lb 8 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 19 lb 
1 oz diced tomatoes; 6 lb 11 oz oniona A.P. will yield  6 lb chopped onions.
4.  In Step 4, 12 oz (3-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.  
5.  In Step 4, 30 lb 5 oz (4-3/4 - No.10 cn) drained, canned diced tomatoes may be used.
6.  In Step 6, 21 lb 7 oz (2½ gal - 215 eggs) whole eggs may be used or 2½ gal reduced cholesterol eggs.
7.  In Step 6, 5¼ oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 5 oz chopped parsley.
8.  In Step 6, ½ oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated parsley may be used.
9.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 45 to 50 minutes or until set, low fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions (14 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pepper Haves (13 Ounces) plus
                              2 tbsp Sauce (1 Ounce)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No.A-13.
STEP 2:
Prepare 2 recipes Tomato Sauce (Recipe No. O-15).  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 3:
Cut each pepper in half lengthwise; remove core.
STEP 4:
Place peppers in 10 gallons boiling water.  Return to a boil; cook 1 minute.  Drain well.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 5:
Drain corn and beans.  Rinse beans.  Drain well.
STEP 6:
Combine corn, beans, cooked rice, ½-inch diced tomatoes, onions, garlic powder, parsley, salt, peppers (black and red), cumin, chili powder, oil and cheese (chedder or American). Mix lightly.
STEP 7:
Fill each pepper with ½-cup (1 - No.8 scoop) vegetable-rice mixture.  Place peppers in pans.
STEP 8:
Pour 4 oz (½-cup) water around peppers in each pan.
STEP 9:
Pour 1 lb 14 oz (3½ cups) tomato sauce over peppers in each pan.  Cover.
STEP 10:
Bake about 1 hour 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated (160°F.).

NOTES:

1.  In Step 2, Sauce Mix, Tomato, Basic may be used.  Prepare 3½ gal according to directions on container.
2.  In Step 3, 42 lb fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 34 lb 8 oz fresh sweet peppers, cored and cut in half lengthwise.
3.  In Step 5, 12 lb (5¼ qt - 12 - No.300 cn) canned pinto beans or black beans may be used.  Drain beans.
4.  In Step 5, 9 lb 2 oz frozen corn may be used.  Cook according to Q-G-3.  Drain.
5.  In Step 6, 3 lb (1-3/4 qt) long grain rice will yield 9 lb (1½ gal) cooked rice.  Cooking according to Recipe No. E-5 or E-6.
6.  In Step 6, 9 lb cooked brown rice may be used.  Use about 3 lb 2 oz (2 qt) parboiled brown rice.  Cook according to Recipe No.E-5-5.
7.  In Step 6, 2 lb 13 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 2 lb 12 oz diced tomatoes.
8.  In Step 6, 3 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb 10 oz chopped onions.
9.  In Step 6, 5-1/3 oz (1½ cups) dehydrated chopped onions may be used.  
10.  In Step 6, 4¼ oz parsley A.P. will yield 4 oz chopped parsley.
11.  In Step 6, low fat or reduced fat cheddar or American cheese may be used.
12.  In Step 10, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 40 minutes or until thoroughly heated (160°F.) on high fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces) plus
                              1-2/3 Tablespoons (1 Ounce) Sauce
PAN SIZE:  12x20x½-inch Steam Table Pan (5)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven
                               375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine honey, lime juice and curry powder.  Mix well.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Wash chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Place 13 lb 10 oz chicken, skin side up on each sheet pan.
STEP 3:
Bake at 400°F. 70 minutes or until done (180°F.).
STEP 4:
Place about 8 lb 3 oz drained chicken, skin side up, in each
steam table pan.
STEP 5:
Pour 1 lb 11 oz (2-2/3 cups) sauce over chicken in each pan.
STEP 6:
Bake at 375°F. 25 minutes or until chicken reaches serving temperature.  Baste with sauce once during baking and just before serving.  Serve with 1-2/3 tbsp sauce.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes on high fan, closed vent or until done (180°F.).  In Step 6, bake at 350°F. 10 to 15 minutes or until chicken reaches serving temperature, on high fan, closed vent.  Baste with sauce once during baking and just before serving.  Serve with 1-2/3 tbsp sauce.
3.  7 lb 13 oz lime A.P. (50 limes) will yield 6-3/4 cups lime juice.
4.  3 lb 6 oz (6-3/4 cups) thawed unsweetened lime juice may be used.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (6½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables and fruit as directed on Recipe No.A-31.
STEP 2:
Drain pineapple.  Reserve juice for use in Step 3 and pineapple for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Blend salad dressing, 1 cup reserved pineapple juice and curry powder together.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Combine chicken, pineapple, coconut, almonds and apples.
STEP 5:
Add salad dressing mixture; blend well.
STEP 6:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add 1 cup (2 - No.8 scoops) salad mixture, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTES:

1.  In Step 3, 6 lb 8 oz (3 qt) low fat plain yogurt may be used.
2.  In Step 6, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
3.  In Step 4, 13 lb apples A.P. will yield 11¼ qt diced apples.

VARIATIONS:

1.  TROPICAL CHICKEN SALAD (CHICKEN CANNED):  Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 4, use 12 lb 11 oz (7 -  29 oz cn, or 6 - 34 oz or, 4¼ - 50 oz cns) canned chicken.  Drain; dice into 1 inch pieces.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.

YIELD:  100 Portions (4 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (3 Ounces) plus
                              2 Tbsp (1 Ounce) Sauce
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Place 25 breasts in each lightly greased pan.
STEP 2:
Combine honey, soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic powder, onion powder and ginger.  Mix thoroughly.  Pour about 1 lb 3 oz (2 cups) sauce over chicken in each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 1 hour or until done (170°F.).  Remove chicken.  Keep hot for use in Step 5.  Drain sauce.
STEP 4:
Combine cornstarch and water.  Add slowly to hot sauce, stirring constantly.  Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 5:
Pour 1 lb 7 oz (2½ cups) hot sauce mixture over chicken in each pan.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 3 lb lemons A.P. (12 lemons) will yield 2½ cups juice.
2.  In Step 2, 5 oz frozen lemon juice concentrate and 1 lb (2 cups) cold water may be used for fresh lemon juice.
3.  In Step 2, 1 lb 9 oz (2½ cups) lite soy sauce may be used.
4.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until done (170°F.) on low fan, open vent.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (5 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Pattie (2 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Place thawed ground turkey in mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Combine bread crumbs, poultry seasoning, salt, pepper, garlic powder and crushed basil.  Add to turkey.
STEP 3:
Mix on low speed 3 to 4 minutes or until thoroughly blended.
STEP 4:
Shape into 2½ oz balls (1- No.16 scoop).  Place 20 balls on each pan.  Flatten each ball into a 4-inch pattie.
STEP 5:
Bake 23 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 170°F.

NOTE:  

1.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used bake at 325°F. 9 minutes on high fan, closed vent or until internal temperature reasches 170°F.

VARIATION:

1.  GRILLED TURKEY SAUSAGE PATTIE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Omit Step 5.  Grill patties on 350°F., ungreased griddle, 3 minutes on each side or until internal temperature reaches 170°F.

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Orange Juice Unswtnd Fzn Conc-6 floz Can
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (4 Ounces) plus
                              3 Tbsp (1½ Ounces) Sauce
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute onions in salad oil or olive oil until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Combine thawed orange juice concentrate (3 plus 1) with water.
STEP 3:
Blend flour and sugar with 1 lb (2 cups) orange juice to form paste; add remaining juice.
STEP 4:
Add onions, stir well.
STEP 5:
Place 14 chicken breasts in each pan, DO NOT OVERLAP (100 breasts total, 4 to 5 ounces each).
STEP 6:
Pour 1 lb 7 oz (2-2/3 cup) orange mixture over each pan.
STEP 7:
Combine salt, paprika, pepper, rosemary and garlic powder.  Sprinkle about 1 tbsp mixture over chicken in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 170°F.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 3 oz onions.
2.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 20 
to 50 minutes on high fan, closed vent or until internal temperature reaches 170°F.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
RecipeItem/4/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

RecipeItem/2/_ItemName: Sweet Green Bell Peppers Chpd Ckd-Drnd
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (3¼ Gallon)
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (6½ Ounces) with
                           3/4 Cup Tossed Green Rice (No.20 Scoop)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Cut chicken breasts into ½-inch by 2-inch strips.  Keep refrigerated for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute green peppers and onions in oil 3 minutes in steam jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 3:
Add water, tomatoes, tomato paste, orange juice concentrate, pimientos, sugar, salt, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, oregano, red pepper, and black pepper.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat; cover; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add chicken.  Return to a boil.  Reduce heat; cover; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 5:
Blend flour and water to make a smooth paste.  Add to chicken mixture.  Stir well.  Simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 6:
Serve over 1 recipe Tossed Green Rice (Recipe No.E-5-2).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb diced peppers.
2.  In Step 2, 5 lb 15 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb 5 oz chopped onions.
RecipeItem/7/_ItemName: Orange Juice Unswtnd Fzn Conc-6 floz Can
RecipeItem/18/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions 
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Sheet Pan (6)
                    12x2½-inch Steam Table Pan (7)
TEMPERATURE:  400°F. Oven
                              350°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed chicken (8 piece cut) thoroughly under cold running water; drain well.
STEP 2:
Place 13 lb 10 oz chicken skin side up, on each lightly greased sheet pan.  Bake at 400°F. 70 minutes or until done (180°F.).  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Combine catsup, vinegar, red pepper, mix well.
STEP 4:
Dip and coat chicken completely in hot sauce.  Place 33 pieces of dipped chicken skin side up in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake at 375°F. 25 minutes or until done chicken reaches serving temperature.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole, cut into quarters, or eighths; or 82 lb chicken broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.)  In Step 5, bake at 350°F. 10 minutes or until chicken reaches serving temperature.
3.  For "RED HOT BUFFALO CHICKEN"  incease pepper to 6-3/4 oz (2¼ cups).
4.  Chicken may be prepared in small batches and served immediately after dipping.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Pattie (4½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine thawed turkey, bread crumbs, onions, parsley, salt, garlic powder, white pepper and mustard; mix thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Shape into oval patties ½-inch thick weighting approximately
5 oz each.
STEP 3:
Grill patties on lightly greased griddle 8 minutes on each side or until an internal temperature of 170°F. is reached.

NOTES:

1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 2 oz A.P. dry onions will yield 2 lb 13 oz finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 3-3/4 oz A.P, fresh parsley A.P. will yield 3½ oz chopped parsley.  In Step 1, ½ oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated parsley may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  BAKED TURKEY PATTIE (OVEN METHOD):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 4 sheet pans.  Place 25 patties on each pan.  Bake at 375°F. 30 minutes or in a 325°F. convection oven 20 to 25 minutes or until an internal temperature of 170°F. is reached on high fan, open vent.

Optional:  Lime rind, grated - 5 Tbsp YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Fillet (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan (5)
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Saute green peppers and onions in butter or margarine, 10 minutes or until onions are transparent.
STEP 2:
Combine onion mixture with bread cubes, lime juice, cilantro,
garlic powder, red pepper and oregano; mix well.
STEP 3:
Place 1¼ oz (1 - No.30 scoop) filling in center of each catfish fillet, skin side up.  Roll up and place, seam side down in staggered rows, 4 by 5, in steam table pans.
STEP 4:
Combine melted butter or margarine with lime juice.  Add garlic powder and red pepper.  Brush evenly over fish in each pan.  Sprinkle 1 tbsp grated lime rind over fish in each pan if desired.
STEP 5:
Bake 35 minutes or until done (150°F.).

NOTES:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers; 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 13 fresh limes (1 lb 12 oz) will yield 13 oz (1½ cups) lime juice.
3.  In Step 2, 2 cups fresh chopped cilantro may be used, (5-1/3 oz fresh cilantro will yield 2 cups chopped cilantro).
4.  In Step 4, 13 fresh limes (1 lb 12 oz) will yield 13 oz (1½ cups) lime juice.
5.  In Step 5, if a convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 25 to 30 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.
6.  In Step 5, fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork or when it reaches an internal temperature of 150°F.
7.  In Step 5, baking time will vary with thickness of fish.

VARITATION:

1.  CARIBBEAN FLOUNDER:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 30 lb (100) flounder fillets.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  In Step 6, bake 25 to 30 minutes or in a 350°F. convection oven 17-19 minutes or until done (150°F.) on high fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (4-5 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan (6)
                    12x20x½-inch Steam Table Pan (4)
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash thawed chicken thoroughly under cold running water; drain well.
STEP 2:
Combine soft bread crumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper and ginger.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Combine yogurt, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper and ginger in shallow pan; mix well.
STEP 4:
Dip chicken in yogurt, then in bread crumb mixture; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Place chicken breasts on each lightly greased pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until internal temperature is 170°F.  Immediately remove from pan.  Shingle in line pan, with bottom side up.

NOTES:

1.   Place chicken breasts at least 1 inch apart to assure a crisp coating.
2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 to 20 minutes or until internal temperature is 170°F. on high fan, open vent.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (7 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (8 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x26-inch Sheet Pan
TEMPERATURE:  425°F. Oven

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Wash cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Combine nonfat dry milk and warm water.  Set aside.
STEP 3:
Combine flour and spices.  Mix thoroughly.
STEP 4:
Dip chicken in milk.  Drain.  Dredge chicken in flour mixture.  Shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Place chicken skin side up on 7 lightly greased sheet pans. Bake 45 minutes; turn chicken.  Bake an additional 15 minutes or until done (180°F.).

NOTE:

1.  If convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 20 minute, turn chicken.  Bake an additional 10 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, closed vent.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Steak
TEMPERATURE:  375°F. Griddle

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Preheat grill; lightly grease with shortening.  Grill tempered steaks to desired degree of doneness:  

Beef, Top Sirloin, butt, boneless, tempered: (375°F.)
Rare............6 minutes
Medium.......7½ minutes
Well done...9½ minutes

Beef, Ribeye roll, boneless, tempered: (400°F.)
Rare...........3½ minutes
Medium.......4 minutes
Well done...5 minutes

Beef, Strip Loin, boneless, tempered: (400°F.)
Rare...........5 minutes
Medium......6 minutes
Well done..7 minutes

NOTES:  

1.  See Recipe No. A-2 for tempering guidelines.
2.  When grilling tempered steaks, use only half of grill space to permit heat recovery.
3.  A broiler may be used instead of a grill.  Follow manufacturers' directions for cooking.
4.  DO NOT hold steaks in ovens, warming cabinets, or on grills after cooking. This will cause steaks to dry out and be tough.
5.  Only approximate times are given.  Slight variations in thickness and grill temperature variations affect timing.
6.  Steaks may be prepared in oven.  Use 1 lb (2 cups) salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil.  Brush both sides of tempered steaks with oil.  Arrange in rows 3 by 5 on rack (19-1/4x13-1/4x1-3/8-inches).  Place racks on sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Cook in 450° to 500°F. oven to desired degree of doneness (see chart below).  DO NOT TURN STEAKS.  If convection oven is used, omit brushing with oil or shortening.  Cook in 400°F. oven to desired degree of doneness.

OVEN TEMPERATURE CHART:

Beef, Top Sirloin, butt, boneless, tempered:
Conventional Oven: (450° to 500°F.)
Rare.............20 minutes
Medium........22 minutes              
Well done....24 minutes
Convection Oven:  (400°F)
Rare............14 minutes
Medium.......16 minutes
Well done...17 minutes

Beef, Ribeye roll, boneless, tempered:
Conventional Oven:  (450° to 500°F.)
Rare............16 minutes
Medium.......18 minutes
Well done....20 minutes
Convection Oven (400°F.)
Rare............ 12 minutes
Medium....... 14 minutes
Well done... 16 minutes

Beef, Strip Loin, boneless, tempered:
Convectional Oven: (450° to 500°F.)
Rare............ 18 minutes
Medium....... 20 minutes
Well done....23 minutes
Convection Oven (400°F.)
Rare........... 14 minutes
Medium...... 15 minutes
Well done... 16 minutes

VARATION:

1.  GRILLED TENDERLOIN STEAKS:  In Step 1, use 44 lb thawed beef tenderloin.  Trim excess fat to ¼-inch; slice tenderloins into 6 oz steaks, about 3/4-inch thick.  Grill on 400°F. griddle 3 to 6 minutes for rare, 4 to 7 minutes for medium, and 5 to 9 minutes for well done.  NOTE:  The narrow tail section may be butterflied or flattened to produce steaks of more uniform thickness.  Cooking time varies due to size and variations of tenderlions.

RecipeItem/1/_ItemName: Enrich All Purpose Bleached White Flour
memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions (6-3/4 Quarts)
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup (2 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  18x24-inch Roasting Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Blend salad oil or melted shortening and sifted flour together until smooth.
STEP 2:
Cook at low heat 2 minutes.  Add tomato paste, chili powder, and ground cumin; blend well.  
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with water.  Add stock to roux, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 4:
Add pepper.  Stir to blend.

NOTE:

One Size 1 ladle may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  2½ Ounce

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine pineapple juice, soy sauce, water, ginger, garlic and pepper.  Mix well.

NOTE:

1.  4 oz (11-1/3 tbsp - 34 cloves) garlic, dry, chopped, may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables and fruits.
STEP 2:
Combine Salad Dressing and diced apples.
STEP 3:
Drain pineapple chunks or tidbits.
STEP 4:
Add pineapple and celery to apple mixture; mix lightly.
STEP 5:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add ½ cup salad mixture.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 10 lb 10 oz fresh eating apples A.P. (26 apples) will yield 9 lb unpared, diced apples; 4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 2, ½ recipe Quick Fruit Dressing (Recipe No. M-56) may be used for salad dressing.  In Step 3, reserve 1-1/3 cups pineapple liquid.  Use pineapple liquid for pineapple juice.
3.  In Step 2, 2 lb (1 qt) fat free Salad Dressing may be used.
4.  In Step 5, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CABBAGE, APPLE AND CELERY SALAD:  Follow Step 1. In Step 2, decrease apples to 3 lb 8 oz (1 gal) (4 lb 2 oz A.P.). Omit Steps 3 and 4.  Use 4 lb (3 qt) fresh, chopped celery (5 lb 8 oz A.P.) and 12 lb (5¼ gal) fresh shredded cabbage (15 lb A.P.).  Combine with apple mixture.  Cover; refrigerate at least 2 to 3 hours or until ready to serve.  Omit Step 5.
2.  CABBAGE, APPLE AND RAISIN SALAD:   Follow Variation 1 except omit celery.  Add 2 lb 9 oz (2 qt) raisins.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe A-31.  Tear spinach leaves into small pieces.
STEP 2:
Combine eggs, onions, mushrooms and spinach. Toss lightly to mix ingredients.
STEP 3: 
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 4:
Cook bacon until crisp; drain, chop.
STEP 5:
Add bacon just before serving.  Toss lightly.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 8 lb 12 oz fresh spinach A.P. will yield 8 lb trimmed spinach; 3 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb 11 oz sliced onions; and 3 lb 5 oz fresh mushrooms A.P. will yield 3 lb sliced mushrooms.
2.  In Step 4, 7 oz (1-3/4 cups) imitation bacon bits may be used.
3.  In Step 5, serve with 6 lb 4 oz (12½ cups) prepared fat free Red Wine Vinaigrette Dressing or 1 recipe Vinaigrette Dressing (Recipe No. M-55) or 1 recipe Red Wine Vinaigrette Dressing (Recipe No. M-3).

VARIATIONS:

1.  SPINACH AND APPLE SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2 omit eggs, onions, and mushrooms.  Use 6 lb (about 1-3/4 gal) ½ inch diced red tart apples (7 lb 1oz A.P.), 2 lb 12 oz (8¼ cups) chopped onions  (3 lb 1 oz A.P.) and 1 lb 15 oz (1½ qt) raisins.  Follow Step 3.  Omit Steps 4 and 5.  EACH PORTION: 1-1/3 Cups (3 Ounces).
2.  SPINACH AND MUSHROOM SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit eggs; increase mushrooms to 4 lb 8 oz (7¼ qt) (4 lb 15 oz A.P.).  Follow Step 3.  Omit Steps 4 and 5.  EACH
PORTION:  1-3/4 Cups (2½ Ounces).

YIELD:  2 Quarts
EACH PORTION:  1 Tablespoon (½ Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine sugar, mustard flour, paprika, pepper, vinegar and water; blend well.
STEP 2:
Mix at medium speed 2 minutes using a wire whip.
STEP 3:
Add oil gradually while mixing at low speed 3 minutes; scrape down bowl.
STEP 4:
Mix at medium speed 2 minutes or until well blended.
STEP 5:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 6:
Whip or stir well before serving.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Drain beans, rinse well; drain.
STEP 3:
Combine beans and French Dressing.
STEP 4:
Cover; refrigerate at least 6 hours.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.
STEP 5:
Add cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumbers just before serving. Mix lightly.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  10 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 8 lb shredded cabbage.  6 lb 2 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 6 lb diced tomatoes.  4 lb 2 oz fresh cucumbers A.P. will yield 3 lb 8 oz pared, sliced cucumbers.
2.  In Step 2, 7 lb (7- No.303 cn) canned kidney beans may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 1 recipe French Dressing (Recipe No. M-58) may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine carrots, celery, and raisins.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute milk; combine with Salad Dressing, salt, sugar, and lemon juice (optional).  Blend well.
STEP 4:
Add to vegetables; toss together lightly.
STEP 5:
Place 1 lettuce leaf (optional) on each serving dish; add salad mixture.  Cover; refrigerate at least 2 to 3 hours.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  12 lb 3 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 10 lb shredded carrots.  4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb diced celery.  6 oz lemons A.P. (1½ lemons) will yield ¼ cup juice.
2.  In Step 2, 2 lb 8 oz (1¼ qt) fat-free Salad Dressing may be used.
3.  In Step 5, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CARROT AND PINEAPPLE SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit celery and raisins.  Use 6 lb 12 oz (1-No.10 cn) canned, drained, pineapple chunks or tidbits.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.
2.  CARROT, CELERY, AND APPLE SALAD:  Follow Step 1. In Step 2, omit raisins.  Use 8 lb (2 gal) shredded carrots (9 lb 12 oz A.P.), 3 lb (2¼ qt) chopped celery (4 lb 2 oz A.P.) and 4 lb 8 oz (1¼ gal) diced unpared apples (5 lb 5 oz A.P.).  Follow Steps 3 through 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORITON:  2 Pieces (1½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare celery as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Place 200 pieces celery (cut in 2 to 3 inch pieces) in ice water (to cover) 1 hour or until crisp.  Drain.  Place on sheet pans lined with waxed paper.  Refrigerate for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Combine cheese (Cheddar or American), pimientos, Salad Dressing, red pepper and Worcestershire sauce; blend well.
STEP 4:
Fill hollow section of each celery piece with mixture.
STEP 5:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 8 lb 4 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 6 lb trimmed celery cut into 2 to 3 inch pieces.
2.  In Step 2, 1 lb (1/3-No.10 cn) canned cheese, American, dehydrated combined with 1 cup warm water may be used.
3.  In Step 2, two 7 oz cn canned pimientos may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  COTTAGE CHEESE STUFFED CELERY:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Combine 2 lb (1 qt) cottage cheese, 2¼ oz (¼ cup) tomato catsup, 1-1/3 oz (2 tbsp) prepared horseradish and 2 tsp grated dry onions; blend thoroughly.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (1 Ounce)
2.  PEANUT BUTTER STUFFED CELERY:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Combine 1 lb 2 oz (2 cups) peanut butter with 1 lb (1½ cups - 1 lb jr) honey; blend thoroughly.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  EACH PORITON:  2 Pieces (1 Ounce)
3.  CREAM CHEESE STUFFED CELERY:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 2 lb (1 qt) cream cheese, softened. Follow Steps 4 and 5.  EACH PORTION:  2 Pieces (1 Ounce)

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  See Step 6.

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Tear or cut prepared lettuce into large pieces.
STEP 3:
Combine lettuce with cabbage, peppers, celery and cucumbers; toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Cover; refrigerate for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Cut cold meat and cheese (American or Swiss) into thin strips; eggs and tomatoes into 8 wedges each.  
STEP 6:
Place about 1 cup salad vegetables in salad bowls.  Add 2 thin strips meat, 4 thin strips cheese, 2 wedges eggs and 2 wedges tomatoes.
STEP 7:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  7 lb 9 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 7 lb trimmed lettuce.  1 lb 4 oz fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 1 lb shredded cabbage.  2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb diced pepeprs.  4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb diced celery.  2 lb 6 oz fresh cucumbers A.P. will yield 2 lb sliced, pared cucumbers.  8 lb 5 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 8 lb 2 oz tomato wedges.
2.  In Step 2, 1 lb 4 oz fresh, red cabbage A.P. will yield 1 lb shredded cabbage.
3.  In Step 5, suggested cold meats are beef, ham, and/or turkey.

VARIATIONS:

1.  CHEF'S SALAD WITH CROUTONS:  Follow Steps 1 through 6.  In Step 7, prepare 3/4 recipe Garlic Croutons (Recipe No. D-16-1).  Serve 6 croutons with each salad.
2.  CHEF'S SALAD (ENTREE):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 10 lb 5 oz lettuce (11 lb 6 oz A.P.).  In Step 3, use 1 lb 8 oz (2-2/3 qt) fresh cabbage (1 lb 14 oz A.P.), 3  lb (3 qt) fresh sweet peppers (3 lb 11 oz A.P.) and 3 lb (2¼ qt) fresh cucumbers (3 lb 9 oz A.P.).  Follow Step 4.   In Step 5, use 6 lb cold meat, 6 lb cheese, 2 lb 10 oz (25) hard cooked eggs cut in wedges and 12 lb 3 oz (300 wedges) fresh tomatoes.  Follow Step 7.  EACH PORTION:  1½ cups salad vegetables, 6 strips meat, 12 strips cheese and 3 wedges eggs.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare cabbage as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Chill finely shredded cabbage in covered container until crisp.
STEP 3:
Combine Salad Dressing, salt, sugar and vinegar.
STEP 4:
Add to cabbage; mix well.
STEP 5:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.  Optional: Just before serving, sprinkle lightly with 2 tablespoons paprika to garnish.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 15 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 12 lb finely shredded cabbage.
2.  In Step 1, 2 lb 8 oz shredded red cabbage A.P. may be used for 2 lb cabbage.

VARIATION:

1.  MEXICAN COLE SLAW:   Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 6 lb (2-3/4 gal) shredded fresh cabbage (7 lb 8 oz A.P.).  In Step 3, add 3 lb (3 qt) diced fresh celery (4 lb 2 oz A.P.), 4 lb (2-3/4 qt) diced fresh tomatoes (4 lb 1 oz A.P.), 8 oz (1-1/3 cups) finely minced dry onions (9 oz A.P.) and 3 lb (3 qt) finely shredded fresh sweet peppers (3 lb 10 oz A.P.).  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, omit paprika.  EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3 Ounces)

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare cabbage as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute milk with warm water; add Salad Dressing, pepper, mustard, salt and sugar; mix well.
STEP 3:
Add vinegar gradually; blend well.
STEP 4:
Pour dressing over cabbage; toss lightly until well mixed.
STEP 5:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 15 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 12 lb finely shredded cabbage.
2.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  COLE SLAW WITH VINEGAR DRESSING: Follow Step 1.
Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Combine 2 tsp black pepper, 1 oz (1-2./3 tbsp) salt, 1 lb 12 oz (1 qt) granulated sugar, 1 qt vinegar and 1 cup water; mix well.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  CABBAGE AND CARROT SLAW WITH CREAMY DRESSING:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 10 lb (4¼ gal) finely shredded cabbage (12 lb 8 oz A.P.) and 3 lb (3 qt) finely shredded carrots (3 lb 11 oz A.P.).  Follow remainder of Steps 4 and 5.
3.  PINEAPPLE COLE SLAW:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit pepper; reduce mustard to 2 tsp.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, use 10 lb (4¼ gal) finely shredded cabbage (12 lb 8 oz A.P.) and 6 lb 12 oz (1-No.10 cn) canned, drained pineapple chunks or tidbits.  Follow remainder of Steps 4 and 5.
4.  PINEAPPLE MARSHMALLOW COLE SLAW:   Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit pepper; reduce mustard to 2 tsp.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, use 10 lb (4¼ gal) finely shredded cabbage (12 lb 8 oz A.P.) and 6 lb 12 oz (1-No.10 cn) canned, drained pineapple chunks or tidbits.  Follow remainder of Steps 4 and 5.  Just before serving, add 1 lb 5 oz (3 qt) miniature marshmallows.  EACH PORTION:  2/3 Cup (3½ Ounces).
5.  VEGETABLE SLAW WITH CREAMY DRESSING:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 10 lb (4¼ gal) finely shredded cabbage (12 lf 8 oz A.P.), 2 lb (2 qt) finely shredded carrots (2 lb 7 oz A.P.), 6 oz (1 cup) minced dry onions (7 oz A.P.) and 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) diced sweet peppers (1 lb 13 oz A.P.).  Follow remainder of Steps 4 and 5.

YIELD:  6¼ Cups
EACH PORTION:  1 Tablespoon (½ Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine water, honey and vinegar in mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Add garlic powder, mustard, onion powder and salt to mixture.
STEP 3:
Using a wire whip, mix at medium speed 3 minutes or until well blended.
STEP 4:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 5:
Whip or stir well before serving.

NOTE:  In Step 1, 1 tbsp (3 cloves) dry, minced garlic may be used.

YIELD:  1 Gallon
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Mix together yogurt, onions, minced parsley, celery leaves (celery substituted above), sugar, vinegar, salt and garlic.  Stir well to blend
STEP 2:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 4 oz onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 2 oz minced onions; 3-1/8 oz parsley A.P. will yield 3 oz minced parsley; 6 lb 7 oz fresh celery A.P. will yeild 3 oz minced celery leaves.
2.  In Step 1, 2¼ oz (3/4 cup) dehydrated chopped onions and 1/8 oz (6 tbsp) dehydrated parsley may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare lettuce as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add ¼ cup (1-No.16 scoop) cottage cheese.
STEP 3:
Garnish with paprika.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 2, 2 lb 2 oz (2-No.10 cn) canned dehydrated cottage cheese may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No. A-28.
3.  In Step 3, salads may be garnished with 8 oz (2½ cups) shredded fresh carrots (9-3/4 oz A.P.) or 8 oz (2 cups) chopped fresh green onions (10 oz A.P.)  including tops, or 3 oz (1½ cups) minced fresh parsley, or 12 oz (2 cups) finely chopped fresh sweet peppers (15 oz A.P.), 14 oz (½ No.2½ oz cn) canned chopped pimientos, or 1 lb (1 qt) thinly sliced fresh radishes (1 lb 2 oz A.P.).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Cottage Cheese, plus
                              1 Peach Half (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare lettuce as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Separate lettuce leaves.  Place 1 leaf on each serving dish.
STEP 3:
Drain peaches.  Add peach half, hollow side up.
STEP 4:
Place ¼ cup (1-No.15 scoop) cottage cheese in each peach hollow.
STEP 5:
Garnish with paprika.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 3, 20 lb 4 oz (3-No.10 cn) canned peaches, sliced, drained may be used.  Place 3 peach slices on lettuce leaf.
3.  In Step 4, 2 lb 2 oz (2-No.10 cn) canned dehydrated cottage cheese may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No. A-28.

VARIATIONS:

1.  COTTAGE CHEESE AND APRICOT SALAD:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 13 lb 8 oz (2-No.10 cn) canned apricots, drained.  Place 2 apricot halves on lettuce leaf.  In Step 4, place 2 tbsp (1-No.30 scoop) cottage cheese in each apricot half.  Follow Step 5.
2.  COTTAGE CHEESE AND PEAR SALAD:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 19 lb 14 oz (3-No.10 cn) canned pear halves, drained.  Place 1 pear half on lettuce leaf, hollow side up.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
3.  COTTAGE CHEESE AND PINEAPPLE SALAD:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 13 lb 8 oz (2-No.10 cn) canned sliced pineapple, drained.  Place 1 slice pineapple on lettuce leaf.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Cottage Cheese
                              plus 3 Tomato Wedges (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Cut each tomato into 8 wedges; set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish.
STEP 4:
Place ¼ cup (1-No.16 scoop) cottage cheese in center of lettuce leaf.
STEP 5:
Arrange 3 tomato wedges around cottage cheese.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle with paprika.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 1, 12 lb 12 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 12 lb 8
oz tomato wedges.
3.  In Step 2, 11 lb 3 oz (34) slicsed tomatoes (11 lb 7 oz A.P.) may be used.  Cut each tomato in 6 slices.  In Step 4, place 2 slices on each lettuce leaf.  EACH PORTION:  ¼ Cup Cottage Cheese (2 Ounces) plus 2 Tomato Slices (1½ Ounces).
4.  In Step 4, 2 lb 2 oz (2-No.10 cn) canned dehydrated cottage cheese may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No.A-28.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine sliced cucumbers and onions.
STEP 3:
Combine salt, pepper, sugar, vinegar and water; blend well.
STEP 4:
Pour over cucumbers and onions.
STEP 5:
Cover; refrigerate at least 1½ hours.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  17 lb 14 oz fresh cucumbers A.P. will yield 15 lb sliced, pared cucumbers.  3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb sliced onions.
2.  In Step 2, 6 oz (1-3/4 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.

YIELD:  1 Gallon
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine chili sauce, mustard, onions, vinegar and salt; blend well.
STEP 2:
Add yogurt; stir until well blended.
STEP 3:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 14 oz minced onions may be used (1 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 14 oz minced onions).

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (4 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare fruits and lettuce as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Drain pineapple.  Reserve about 3 cups juice for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Add oranges and grapefruit.
STEP 4:
Add apples and bananas.  Toss lightly.
STEP 5:
Prepare 1 recipe Quick Fruit Dressing (Recipe No. M-56) using reserved pineapple juice.  Fold dressing into fruit salad. Toss lightly.  Cover; refrigerate.
STEP 6:
Separate leaves.  Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add ½ cup salad mixture.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 9 lb 14 oz fresh oranges A.P. (22 oranges) will yield 7 lb peeled, seeded oranges; 1 lb 15 oz grapefruit A.P. will yield 1 lb 7 oz peeled, seeded grapefruit.
2.  In Step 4, 6 lb 3 oz fresh bananas A.P. (18 bananas) will yield 4 lb peeled, sliced bananas.  NOTE:  Peel apples and bananas just before combining to prevent discoloration.  6 lb 14 oz fresh eating apples A.P. (16 apples) will yield 5 lb 13 oz unpared, cored apples.
3.  In Step 6, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine vegetables; toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Combine cottage cheese with vegetables; mix well.
STEP 4:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add salad mixture.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  4 lb 3 oz fresh cucumbers A.P. will yield 4 lb diced, unpared cucumbers.  1 lb 1 oz fresh radishes A.P. wil yield 1 lb chopped radishes.  10 oz fresh green onions A.P. will yield 8 oz finely chopped green onions.  2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz diced celery.  1 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb finely chopped peppers.  4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 2, 1 oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions and 2½ oz (2 cups) dehydrated green peppers may be used.  
3.  In Step 3, 1 lb 13 oz (1-2/3 - No.10 cn) canned dehydrated cottage cheese may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No. A-28.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  3/4 Cup (2 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A.31.
STEP 2:
Combine carrots, celery and peppers.  Tear prepared lettuce into small pieces; mix with other vegetables; toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  2 lb 7 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 2 lb sliced carrots.  4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb diced celery. 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb diced sweet peppers.  7 lb 9 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 7 lb trimmed lettuce.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3-1/8 Gallons)
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Add carrot strips to 2-1/2 gallons boiling water.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes or until tender-crisp.  Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 4:
Combine condensed soup, sugar, vinegar, pepper and mustard in a mixer bowl.  Blend at medium speed 3 minutes.
STEP 5:
Add salad oil or olive oil slowly to mixture while mixing at low speed 2 minutes.
STEP 6:
Add onions and peppers.  Scrape down bowl.  Blend 1 minute.
STEP 7:
Pour mixture over warm carrots.  Cover; refrigerate overnight or until flavors are well blended.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 19 lb 8 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 16 lb - ½ inch by 2 inch carrot strips.  16 lb frozen carrots may be used.
2.  In Step 6, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.

YIELD:  1 Gallon
EACH PORTION:  2 Tablespoons (1 Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine vinegar, water, sugar, salt, parsley, tarragon, garlic and pepper; blend well.
STEP 2:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 3:
Shake or beat well before using.

VARIATION:

1.  BASIL LOW CALORIE DRESSING:  In Step 1, omit parsley, tarragon and garlic.  Add 7/8 oz (3-3/4 tbsp) onion powder and 3½ tbsp crushed sweet basil.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
_description: Salad Dressing, tangy tarragon, low cal

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  2 Quarts
EACH PORTION:  1 Tbsp (½ Ounce)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Combine sugar, vinegar and mustard flour; stir until sugar is dissolved.
STEP 2:
Add yogurt and horseradish.  Blend well.
STEP 3:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Square (4 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad fruits and vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Add gelatin to 3 qts boiling water; stir until dissolved.
STEP 3:
Add 1¼ gal cold water; mix well.
STEP 4:
Pour abut 3 qt gelatin mixture into each pan; chill until slightly thickened.
STEP 5:
Grind cranberries.  Set aside for use in Step 8.
STEP 6:
Quarter oranges; remove seeds.   DO NOT peel.  
STEP 7:
Grind oranges.
STEP 8:
Combine cranberries, oranges, celery, and sugar; mix well.
STEP 9:
Add about 2 qt cranberry mixture to gelatin in each pan; stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 10:
Chill until firm.  Cut 5x7.
STEP 11:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add gelatin square. Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  3 lb 15 oz fresh cranberries A.P. will yield 3 lb 12 oz cranberries.  2 lb 12 of fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb finely chopped celery.  4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATION:

1.  JELLIED CRANBERRY AND ORANGE SALAD (CANNED CRANBERRY SAUCE):  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Omit Step 5.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.  Use 7 lb (1-No.10 cn) canned Cranberry Sauce (whole or jellied); beat with wire whip until smooth.  In Step 8, omit sugar; add whipped cranberry sauce to other ingredients.  Follow Steps 9 through 11.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Square (5½ Ounce)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare lemons and lettuce as directed on Recipe No.A-31.
STEP 2:
Drain pineapple; reserve juice for use in Step 5 and pineapple for use in Step 7.
STEP 3:
Using wire whip; beat cranberry sauce at medium speed in mixer bowl until smooth.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 4:
Add gelatin to 1 gal boiling water; stir until dissolved.  Add cranberry sauce; mix well.
STEP 5:
Add cold water and reserved juice, lemon juice, and rind; mix well.
STEP 6:
Pour about 1 gal gelatin mixture into each pan; chill until slightly thickened.
STEP 7:
Add about 1 qt pineapple and 2/3 cup unsalted nuts to gelatin mixture in each pan; stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 8:
Chill until firm.  Cut 5x7.
STEP 9:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add gelatin square. Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  1 lb 8 oz lemons A.P. (6 lemons) will yield 1 cup juice and 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 2:  7 lb (7-No.300 cn) canned cranberry sauce may be used.
3.  In Step 4, dessert powder, gelatin, raspberry may be used.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Square (5 Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad fruit and lettuce as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Drain apricots; reserve juice for use in Step 4.  Cut apricots in half; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Add gelatin to 1 gal boiling water; stir until dissolved.
STEP 4:
Add 1 gal cold water and reserved juice; mix well.
STEP 5:
Pour about 3 qt gelatin mixture into each pan; chill until slightly thickened.
STEP 6:
Add equal amounts of apricots, diced apples, and bananas to gelatin mixture in each pan; stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle 3 cups marshmallows over mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Chill until firm.  Cut 5x7.
STEP 9:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add gelatin square. Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1: 1 lb 12 oz fresh eating apples A.P. (6 apples) will yield 1 lb 8 oz unpared diced apples; 3 lb 1 oz fresh bananas A.P. (6 to 9 bananas) will yield 2 lb sliced bananas; and 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

VARIATIONS:

1.  JELLIED ORANGE SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Step 2. Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, reduce cold water to 2 qt; add one 32 oz cn canned orange juice, frozen, concentrate, and 6 lb 13 oz (1-No.10 cn) canned, crushed, pineapple, undrained.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, omit apples and bananas; add 6 lb (1 gal) peeled fresh oranges sliced and cut in halves (8 lb 7 oz A.P.).  Omit Step 7.  Follow Steps 8 and 9.
2.  JELLIED PEAR SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit apricots.  Use 13 lb 4 oz (2-No.10 cn) canned pear halves, quartered or slices, drained.  (Cut halves into 2 or 3 pieces.)  Reserve juice for use in Step 4.  In Step 3, use dessert powder, gelatin, lime, lemon, or raspberry.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  Omit Steps 6 and 7.  Follow Steps 8 and 9.
3.  JELLIED PINEAPPLE, PEAR, AND BANANA SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit apricots.  Use 6 lb 12 oz (1-No.10 cn) drained canned pineapple chunks or tidbits and 6 lb 10 oz (1-No.10 cn) drained canned pear halves, quarters or slices.  (Cut halves into 6 pieces.)  Reserve juice for use in Step 4.  In Step 3, use dessert powder, gelatin, strawberry, raspberry, or cherry.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  Omit apples in Step 6.  Follow Steps 7 through 9.
4.  JELLIED STRAWBERRY SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Step 2.  In Step 3, use dessert powder, gelatin, strawberry.  In Step 4, reduce cold water to 2 qt and add 6 lb (3 qt) partially thawed strawberries, 3 lb 6 oz (½-No.10 cn) canned crushed pineapple, undrained, and 2 lb (1 qt) thinly sliced bananas (3 lb 1 oz A.P.); stir to distribute evenly.  Follow Step 5.  Omit Steps 6 and 7.  Follow Steps 8 and 9.  EACH PORTION:  1 square (4½ Ounces).
5.  JELLIED BANANA SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Step 2. Follow Steps 3 through 5.  In Step 6, omit apples; increase  bananas to 10 lb (5½ qt)-15 lb 6 oz fresh bananas A.P. (30 to 40 bananas).  Add about 1/3 sliced bananas to gelatin in each pan; stir gently to distribute evenly.  Omit Step 7.  Follow Steps 8 and 9.

YIELD:  100 Portions (3 Pans)
EACH PORTION:  1 Square (4½ Ounces)
PAN SIZE:  12x20x2½-inch Steam Table Pan

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare lettuce as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Drain fruit cocktail; reserve juice for use in Step 4; fruit for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Add gelatin to 1 gal boiling water; stir until dissolved.
STEP 4:
Add 1 gal cold water and reserved juice and lemon juice; mix well.
STEP 5:
Pour about 3 qt gelatin mixture into each pan; chill until slightly thickened.
STEP 6:
Add about 2 qt fruit cocktail and 1-1/3 cups unsalted nuts (optional) to gelatin mixture in each pan; stir to distribute evenly.  
STEP 7:
Chill until firm.  Cut 5 by 7.
STEP 8:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add gelatin square. Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  4 lb 8 oz lemons A.P. (18 lemons) will yield 3 cups juice.  4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 3, other dessert powder gelatin flavors may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (2½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine onions, peppers, celery, and cabbage; toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Combine vinegar; salad oil or olive oil, sugar, salt and pepper; pour over cabbage mixture; mix well.
STEP 4:
Garnish with pimientos.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  14 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped onions.  15 oz sweet peppers A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped peppers.  1 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped celery.  15 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 12 lb finely shredded cabbage.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1½ Cups (8½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare ½ recipe Chili Con Carne, Recipe No. L-28 or Chili Con Carne with Beans, Recipe No. L-59.  Keep hot for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.  Tear lettuce into pieces.
STEP 3:
Combine lettuce, onions and tomatoes.  Toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Place 1 cup salad mixture in each soup bowl.
STEP 5:
Ladle ½ cup (1-Size 2 ladle) hot chili over each salad.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle 2 tbsp cheese (Cheddar or Monterey Jack) over each salad.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle 6 to 9 corn chips and 2 tbsp taco sauce over each salad.
STEP 8:
Serve immediately.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 8 lb 10 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 8 lb trimmed lettuce.  1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb thinly sliced onions.
2.  In Step 2, 4 lb 1 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 4 lb tomato wedges.
3.  In Steps 5 and 6, add chili and cheese just before serving to prevent wilted lettuce and unappetizing appearance.
4.  In Step 7, 1 recipe Taco Sauce (Recipe No. O-7) may be used.
5.  Taco Salad may be served with sour cream or guacamole.
RecipeItem/3/_ItemName: Fresh Red Tomatoes YrRndAvg Lrg Slc-1/2"

memo/__cdata:
YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3 Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Prepare ½ recipe Vinegar & Oil Dressing (Recipe No .M-69). Add crushed basil.  Stir.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Add salt and salad oil or olive oil to 2-3 gallons water; heat to rolling boil. Slowly add macaroni, rigatoni, rotini or tortellini, stirring constantly or until water boils again.  Cook 7 to 10 minutes or until just tender.  Drain; rinse with cold water.  Drain thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Add coarsely chopped salami, cheese, olives, celery, onions, peppers and tomatoes to cooked macaroni, rigatoni, rotini or tortellini.  Toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Add Vinegar and Oil Dressing.  Toss lightly.  Cover; refrigerate at least 3 hours or until flavors are well blended.  Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 2 lb (1 qt) prepared fat free Italian Salad Dressing may be used.
2.  In Step 3:  1 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 12 oz chopped celery; 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions; 10 oz sweet fresh peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped fresh sweet peppers; and 2 lb 9 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 2 lb 8 oz diced tomatoes.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Cook bacon until crisp; drain fat.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Tear lettuce into pieces.
STEP 4:
Place 3/4 cup lettuce in each individual salad bowl.
STEP 5:
Place 1 tbsp blue cheese on top of lettuce in center.
STEP 6:
Arrange following ingredients around cheese in separate wedge-shaped  sections:  1tbsp each - bacon, tomatoes, eggs and diced chicken; 1½ tbsp avocado (toss avocado in lemon juice to prevent darkening); add 2 tsp onions.
STEP 7:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 8:
Prepare 1 recipe Vinegar and Oil Dressing (Recipe No. M-69).

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  8 lb 10 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 8 lb trimmed lettuce.  2 lb 9 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 2 lb 5 oz diced tomatoes.  1 lb 10 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 7 oz chopped onions.  4 lb 13 oz fresh avocado A.P. will yield 3 lb 5 oz diced avocado.
2.  In Step 5, 5 lb 5 oz chicken, boiler-fryer, whole may be used.  Cook according to Steps 1 through 3 Recipe No.L-151
or use 2 lb 4 oz (1¼ - 29 oz cn) canned chicken, drained, or use 2 lb 2 oz turkey, cooked, diced.
3.  In Step 6, 6 oz (1½ lemons) A.P. will yield ¼ cup lemon juice.
4.  Add 2 tbsp (1- Size 0 ladle) salad dressing to each salad just before serving to prevent sogginess.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine Salad Dressing, pepper, and vinegar in mixer bowl; mix well.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Drain kidney beans; rinse, drain thoroughly.
STEP 4:
Combine dressing, beans, celery, eggs, onions, peppers, and relish; mix carefully.
STEP 5:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb thinly sliced celery.  13 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 oz thinly sliced onions.  1 lb 4 oz sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb thinly sliced peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 21 lb (21- No.303 cn) canned kidney beans may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 1½ oz (1/3 cup plus 3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare fruit and vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Toast coconut; cool; set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Combine pineapple, diced apples and bananas in pineapple juice until ready to mix.  Drain well.
STEP 4:
Add celery, coarsely chopped walnuts, raisins, chopped maraschino cherries and coconut to drained pineapple, apples and bananas mixture.  Mix lightly; set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 5:
Place cold water in mixing bowl; add topping, milk and 2 tbsp vanilla. Whip at low speed 3 minutes or until blended.  Scrape down bowl.
STEP 6:
Whip at high speed 5 to 10 minutes or until stiff peaks are formed.
STEP 7:
Add to fruit mixture tossing well to coat pieces.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 8:
Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish; add ½ cup (1- No.8 scoop) salad mixture.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  7 lb 8 oz fresh eating apples A.P. will yield 6 lb 6 oz unpared, diced apples.  4 lb 4 oz fresh bananas A.P. will yield 2 lb 12 oz sliced bananas.  2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb diced celery.  4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce.
2.  In Step 4, other unsalted nuts may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  4 Slices Tomato; 
                              1 Lettuce Leaf (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare lettuce and tomatoes as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Separate leaves.  Place 1 lettuce leaf on each serving dish.
STEP 3:
Slice each tomato into 6 slices.
STEP 4:
Arrange 4 slices tomatoes on each lettuce leaf.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 4 lb 5 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb trimmed lettuce; 22 lb 5 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 21 lb 14 oz sliced tomatoes. 

VARIATION:

1.  LETTUCE WEDGE SALAD:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Step 2; use 13 lb 8 oz fresh trimmed lettuce (14 lb 9 oz fresh lettuce A.P.).  Cut each tomato into 8 wedges.  Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.  Omit Steps 3 and 4.  EACH PORTION: 1 Wedge (2 Ounces).

YIELD:  100 Portions 
EACH PORTION:  ½ Cup (3½ Ounces)

METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash, and prepare salad vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Add salt and salad oil to 3-1/2 gallons water; heat to a rolling boil.
STEP 3:
Slowly add macaroni while stirring constantly, until water boils again.  Cook about 15 minutes or until tender; stir occasionally. DO NOT OVERCOOK.
STEP 4:
Drain.  Rinse in cold water; drain thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Combine macaroni, chopped eggs, celery, onions, pickle relish, Salad Dressing, pimientos (if desired), pepper (black or white) and vinegar.  Toss lightly.
STEP 6:
Garnish with paprika.
STEP 7:
Cover; refrigerate until ready to serve.

NOTE:

1.  In Step 2, 3 lb 12 oz (5-1/3 qt) shell macaroni or rotini may be used.
2.  In Step 5:  3 lb 3 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb 5 oz chopped celery.  1 lb 8 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 6 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 5, 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  Macaroni may be cooked in steam cooker.  See Recipe No. E-13.
5.  One No. 8 scoop may be used.

YIELD:  100 Portions
EACH PORTION:  About ½ Cup
 
METHOD:

STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare fruits and lettuce as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine any three fruits; cover; refrigerate.
